loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La socia Dorotea se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y tambien comprar alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Dorotea, operates an animal sales business, raising and selling guinea pigs and chickens.  She is an enterprising, hard-working woman and the business is her means of helping her family.  She is applying for a new loan, part of which she will use to buy guinea pigs and chickens and the rest to buy animal feed.  

Sra. Dorotea is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed for her animal sales business.

loans.name: N3P8-Qthắng-Chicken In City Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sáu is 46 years old and she is married. Sáu lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years.

In 2014, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Sáu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

The main hardship that Sáu faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

With her business profit, Sáu hopes for her business to do well.  She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: N17-Điện Biên-Smile Always Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng is 52 years old and she is married. Hằng lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
 
For five years, she has had a service business providing internet and game services. She has 5 game devices and she wants to expand to 10 devices to improve income. The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more devices to provide game services.

In 2009, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hằng has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more devices to provide game services

loans.name: N1-Cửahậu- Love My Life Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng is 26 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling rice and processed food for five years. Hồng lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable. The main hardship that Hồng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more food in order to cook rice and processed food for sale.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more food in order to cook rice and processed food for sale

loans.name: N11Cửahậu-Funny Old Women Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is 52 years old and married. She has had a laundry service for five years. Thu lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable. 

The main hardship that Thu faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more washing machine to maintain the laundry service.

In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thu has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. All members voted that she would be the group leader of "N11CửaHậu-Funny old women."

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more washing machine to maintain the laundry service

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 62 years old and married with three children. Narcisa works very hard to provide for them.

Narcisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Narcisa has been in this business for 20 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is 30 years old and has three children. Marian is married and has one child in school.

Marian is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marian requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marian has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marian would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nena dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, canned food, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 48 years old and married with four children. Merlina works very hard to provide for them.

Merlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Merlina has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Merlina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Vecenta

texts.en:
Vecenta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vecenta has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Vecenta requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Vecenta has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Vecenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 59 years old and married with five children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries.

Nida has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Nida aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries.

loans.name: Maryfel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Maryfel works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store and raising pigs. Maryfel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her dried fish-making business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Maryfel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Helman

texts.es: Helman, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Helman is 47 years old, married and he lives with his wife and children, who are his first priority.

With this loan, he will buy fertilizers and other inputs to help the development of his coffee crops, as well as pay for the labor to apply the products and to assist during the harvest. He will thus make sure to do good work.

Helman is looking to make the best use of the good climate and soil conditions available in this zone for coffee production. He will also apply his experience of several years in handling these crops. He will buy the best quality inputs for the growth and health of the crops in order to achieve an adequate harvest and generate considerable production results in the short term.

He will spend the income from the harvest on his family's wellbeing, to achieve some family-oriented goals, and he will continue investing in the crops. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously borrowed from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to develop his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Analiza is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Analiza has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna live in Ermera; she is a businesswoman. She started her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $200.

She has a kiosk, so now she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, aqua, cigarettes, biscuits, lighters, hand body lotion, gum, candy, notebooks, hard drinks and other things to sell.  

She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she hopes with this loan she can improve  her management.

loans.use: To buy sugar, aqua, cigarettes, biscuits, lighters, hand body lotion, gum, candy, notebooks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: N1Th06Thdương-Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nghi has a food stall where she sells fruit. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral because she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. The main hardship that Nghi faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

She is a reputable person in the community. Although this is Nghi's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every member agreed to vote that she would be the leader of N1Th06ThDương-Solidarity group.

With her business profit, Nghi hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: N1Phố1Đsơn-Funny Women Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền is 64 years old and she is married. Hiền lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for one year.  She is a reputable person in the community.

The main hardship that Hiền faces is a lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

Although this is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution; every member agreed to vote her to be the leader of "N1Phố1ĐSơn-Funny Women" group.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to build a new house.  She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a shampoo chair and a stock of hair care creams.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia de 21 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 2 años de edad y su compañero de vida. Yesenia se gana la vida desde hace 2 años en una cooperativa cercana, en la que siempre muestra todo su esfuerzo, para poder continuar sacando adelante a su familia apoya de su trabajo. Yesenia siempre muestra sus deseos de superación, con sus pocos ahorros logro construir su vivienda, pero esto no le fue suficiente para instalar ladrillo de piso, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Yesenia, 21, lives in a house of her own with her husband and 2-year old daughter.  She has worked for a local co-op for two years.  She works hard there because her job is the way that she helps to support her family.  Yesenia has scraped together her small savings to build a house, but her savings haven't stretched far enough to lay a floor.  She is applying to FUSAI for a loan that she will use to buy the materials she needs--bricks, cement, sand, gravel--to lay the floor.  She hopes to complete the project as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy supplies for laying a brick floor.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is married with four children and a is member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.   

Nilda supports the family through her vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son, Jayson, who is 22 years old and the youngest of four children in the family. He is studying for his Bachelor's of Science in Agricultural Business and is currently in the first of this four-year course.

Nilda is borrowing PHP 6,500 to pay for tuition fees of her son, Jayson, for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When Jayson graduates, he plans to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 53 years old, married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Carmelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Carmelina has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Carmelina aspires to save enough money in order to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia is 53 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eladia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eladia has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 60 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child in school.

Beatriz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies.

She has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: N7Th5Thdương- Make You More Beautiful Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa has a beauty salon store. She loves to make everyone more beautiful. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral because she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to do her makeup service.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to do her makeup service

loans.name: N5Phúthọ3-Hot Hamburger Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tỵ is 61 years old and is married. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling bread for five years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

In 2011, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Tỵ has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

The main hardship that Tỵ faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to make hamburger to sell.

With her business profit, Tỵ hopes for to build a new house.  She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to make hamburger to sell

loans.name: Rina Marisol

texts.es: Doña Rina de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar,ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 2 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, también se dedica a la venta de antojitos(enchiladas, pasteles, empanadas, etc.) y con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos es como puede salir adelante con su familia, Doña Rina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Doña Rina, 52, lives with her family in a house that she owns.  She has operated a sewing business for 2 years.  She has a space in her house where she keeps her workshop and she has many customers now who value the quality of her work.  In addition to her sewing business, she makes and sells prepared foods (enchiladas, empanadas, pastries, etc.).  Her income from the businesses have helped the family get ahead.  Doña Rina is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--thread, needles, material, buttons, etc.--for carrying on her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vicenta is 61 years old now.

Vicenta has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like nipa leaves.

Vicenta has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like nipa leaves.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ludivina is 59 years old.

Ludivina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Ludivina requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments and other necessary materials.

Ludivina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Ludivina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and other necessary materials

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is married with two children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  
 
Michelle supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her daughter, Tessie Ann, who is 23 years old and the first of two children in the family. Tessie Ann is studying for her Bachelor's of Secondary Education and is currently in the third of this four-year course.

Michelle is borrowing PHP 3,000 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter, Tessie Ann, for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Tessie Ann plans to help her parents earn an income to send her brother to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 65 years old and married with nine children. Margarita works very hard to provide for them.

Margarita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, sugar, home product care, and other groceries.

Margarita has been in this business for 15 years now. 

In the future, Margarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, sugar, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz Mary de 43 años reside en compañía de su familia en la ciudad de Cartagena, ella inició su negocio de miscelánea en el año 2008 y gracias a su entrega ha logrado consolidarse en el sector como un almacén que ofrece el mejor surtido a buen precio.  Todos los días a partir de las 6 a.m. sus clientes pueden realizar sus comprar de artículos de papelería, cosméticos, esmaltes, cremas corporales y detalles, alterno a esta actividad también comercializa carne de res, cerdo y pescado.  Gracias a sus actividades comerciales, su familia ha gozado de beneficios económicos representativos y para continuar ofreciendo un buen servicio, decidió realizar una solicitud de crédito y  está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para capitalizarse y surtir con útiles escolares y mantener un stock de carnes. Con esta inversión Luz Mary considera que podrá acercarse a su meta de negocio que es capitalizarse para lograr una estabilidad y poder ofrecer estudios universitarios a sus hijos.  Su principal desafío ha sido reponerse de la muerte de su madre y el traslado que realizo con su familia por la ola invernal que se presentó donde ella residía anteriormente.
texts.en:
Luz Mary is 43 years old and lives with her family in the city of Cartagena. She started her business selling a variety of goods in the year 2008 and thanks to her dedication she has manged to position herself in the sector as a store that offers the most variety at good prices. Every day from 6 am her clients can purchase paper products, cosmetics, nail polish, body creams, etc. Besides this activity she also sells beef, pork and fish.

Thanks to her commercial businesses her family enjoys corresponding economic benefits. In order to continue to offer good service she has decided to request a loan and is applying for a loan from Kiva, her first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to capitalize and stock up with school supplies and maintain a stock of meats.

With this investment Luz Mary thinks that she can get close to her goal which is to capitalize and establish stability and be able to offer university studies to her children. Her main challenge has been to recover from the death of her mother and the move her family made due to the cold wave that occurred where they lived before.

loans.use: to capitalize and stock up with school supplies and maintain a stock of meats.

loans.name: N15- Điện Biên-Women Do Business Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 36 years old and she is married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling poultry in the market for more than ten years.
Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Her income improved greatly after each time she got a loan, she could buy a television and a fridge. 
She is the group leader of "N15- Điện Biên-women do business" group now. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to resell in the market.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to resell in the market

loans.name: N7Th8Thdương-Repay On Time Always Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh has a business selling tissue paper.
Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral because she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.
The main hardship that Minh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tissue paper to resell.
In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more tissue paper to resell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is an industrious woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two young children. She engages in a hog-raising business. She has been raising and selling hogs for almost three years now. Her husband earns a living by being a mason/carpenter. She needs capital to finance her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and piglets. These will help improve Janeth's hog-raising business. She would be able to raise quality hogs and enable her to sell them in few months to come. She would now be able to afford to buy her children good food and provide better shelter.

She would like to expand her hog-raising business to be productive and also to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 48 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Flavia has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Flavia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 36 years old and married with one child. Perlita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Perlita has been in this business for six years.

In the future Perlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and has six children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Susan is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Julio Rolando

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es amable y muy unida este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo existen muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con amabilidad y respeto. 
En este Cantón vive y trabaja el señor Julio un hombre luchador de 34 años,  vive en unión libre, tiene cuatro hijos. Uno de sus hijos de 6 años cuando tuvo 1 año y medio sufrió una quemadura muy grave en su cabeza por lo que tuvo que ser hospitalizado varios meses y tuvieron que ponerle injertos extraídos de sus piernas ahora su hijo lleva una vida normal pero con cicatrices muy notorias. Se dedica a trabajar en labores de agricultura en una finca del sector con un promedio de 8 horas diarias, su esposa trabaja en un restaurant todo el día sus hijos pasan solos en casa.
Don Julio viene de familia muy humilde y sabe lo duro que es la vida, por ese motivo todos los días da su mejor esfuerzo para apoyar a sus hijos en su preparación.
Solicita este crédito para emprender en el negocio de un restaurant para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y junto a su esposa dedicarse a este negocio y poder estar más tiempo con sus hijos, el señor Julio agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
The canton of Pedro Vicente Maldonado is beautiful.  Its climate is hot and humid, but its people are friendly and supportive of one another.  The canton is popular with tourists and there are many inns where guests can expect to be warmly welcomed.  

Sr. Julio, 34, lives in the canton with his wife and four children.  One child, now 6-years old, was badly burned in an accident when he was only one-year old and doctors had to graft skin from the child's legs to repair the damage.  The treatment required several months in hospital but the stay was successful and, despite some serious scarring, the child can now live normally.  

Sr. Julio is a farm laborer.  He works 8 hours a day on average.  His wife works in a restaurant during the day and their children are often home alone.  Don Julio is from a poor family and knows how difficult life is.  He wants to make a better life for his family and is applying for a loan that he will use to open a restaurant.  The investment will allow him to make more money and give his wife more time to spend with their children.  Sr. Julio is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and the opportunity that their loans provide to people like him.

loans.use: to open a restaurant and support his wife's plan to stay at home with their children.

loans.name: Niyolbi

texts.ru: Ниёлби милая и добросовестная женщина. Ей 51 год, она заботливая жена и прекрасная мать пятерых детей. Живет она со своей семьей в районе Хамадони. Ниёлби на протяжении 10 лет занимается куплей и продажей скота. Сначала она покупает телят, потом откармливает их, выращивает и продает уже взрослых животных на рынке с наценкой. Ниёлби очень хорошо знает свою работу. К тому же она обеспечивает свою семью почти всеми видами молочных продуктов. В данный момент у Ниёлби нет денег, чтобы купить несколько голов телят. Она очень ждет от Вас поддержки и верит, что сможет, расширит свой бизнес.
texts.en: Niyolbi is a sweet and conscientious woman. She is 51 years old, a caring wife and a beautiful mother of five children. She lives with her family in the Hamadoni district. Niyolbi has been involved in reselling livestock for 10 years. She first buys calves, then fattens them up, raises and sells already grown animals at a market with a markup. Niyolbi knows her work very well. In addition, she provides her family with almost all types of milk products. Currently, Niyolbi does not have money to buy several calves. She really awaits Your support and believes that she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy several calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро та женщина, с которой хочется долго общаться. Она очень приятная личность. Зухро гостеприимная и немного застенчивая женщина. Она вместе с тремя дочками живет в маленьком районе Файзабад. Ее муж и старший сын не найдя хорошую роботу уехали на заработках на чужбину. Зухро не отстает от своих родных и тоже приносит в дом источник дохода. Она шьет женские платья. Зухро просит ей помочь купить швейные принадлежности (нитки, иголки, флизелин, клеящая лента). Зухро надеется передать все свое мастерство своим дочерям и верит, что может быть одна из них продолжит ее деятельность.
texts.en: Zuhro is the type of woman, with whom one wants to talk for a long time. She has a very sweet personality. Zuhro is a welcoming and somewhat shy woman. She and her three daughters live in a small district of Fayzabad. Her husband and oldest son could not find good work and left to work abroad. Zuhro keeps up with her family and also brings income home. She sews women's dresses. Zuhro is asking for help to buy sewing accessories (threads, needles and adhesive tape). Zuhro hopes to pass her trade to her daughters and believes that maybe one of them will continue her business.

loans.use: to buy sewing accessories, such as threads, needles and adhesive tape

loans.name: Genis Esther

texts.es: Genis de 52 años, considera que las oportunidades para mejorar la calidad de vida se logran a base de nuevos retos y que gracias al empeño, automotivación y espíritu de superación que tengamos podemos alcanzar el éxito. Con esta misma pensativa, hace 5 años Genis invirtió su pequeño capital en equipos de telefonía celular que comercializo por medio de encargos a sus amigos y vecinos.  Poco a poco su base de clientes fue incrementándose y con el apoyo de una de sus hijas arrendó un local, compró unas vitrinas que surtió con ropa, calzado, equipos de telefonía celular y accesorios.  Genis diariamente atiende a sus clientes a partir de las  9 a.m. a 9 p.m. y planea incrementar su inventario para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que utilizará en la compra de nuevos equipos de celular y prendas de vestir de nueva colección, inversión que le permitirán un incremento en sus ventas y sus utilidades. Su sueño de prosperidad es adquirir su propio local y continuar apoyando económicamente a sus hijos.
texts.en: Genis, who is 52 years old, considers that the opportunities to improve quality of life are achieved on the basis of new challenges and thanks to effort, self-motivation, and spirit of overcoming that we have, we can reach success.  With this same outlook, five years ago, Genis invested her small amount of capital in cell phone equipment that she sold through her friends and neighbors.  Little by little, her customer base kept increasing and with the support of one of her daughters, she leased a shop, purchased some display cabinets that she stocked with clothing, shoes, cell phone equipment and accesories.  Genis daily attends to her customers from 9 am to 9pm and she plans to increase her inventory which is why she is processing her first Kiva loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, financing that she will use to purchase new cell phone equipment and clothing from a new collection.  This investment will allow her to increase her sales and utilities.  Her dream of prosperity is to acquire her own store and continue financially supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase new cell phone equipment and clothing from a new collection.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс молодой и озорной человек из городка Худжанд. Ему 18 лет. Он учится на экономиста и параллельно работает бухгалтером в школе. Фирдавс смышленый юноша. Она выбрал свою профессию давно, и смело идет к своей цели. Фирдавс учится на платной основе и ему необходимо оплатить учебный год. Он просит ему помочь в этом. Фирдавс будет благодарен, если ему помогут, и он обещает учиться исключительно на отлично.
texts.en: Firdavs is a young and mischievous person from the town of Khujand. He is 18 years old. He is studying to become an economist and concurrently works as an accountant at a school. Firdavs is a smart young man. He chose his profession a long time ago and is bravely moving toward his goal. Firdavs studies on a paying basis and has to pay his annual tuition. He is requesting your help with this. Firdavs will be grateful for the help and promises to study only with excellence.

loans.use: to pay his annual university tuition

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de Pichincha en San Miguel de los Bancos Recinto Pueblo Nuevo con un clima cálido húmedo con gente muy unida, trabajadora que se dedica a las labores del campo vive Eva Guamán es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante, ella ha buscado la manera de triunfar en la vida uno de sus logros es tener su negocio de venta de gallinas y venta de cerdos, también trabaja los fines de semana en un restaurante del sector y sus hijos pasan con un familiar.
Tiene muchos sueños que quisiera concretarlos uno de ellos es darles  a sus hijos lo necesario dándoles una buena educación para que en algún momento lleguen a ser grandes profesionales y no tengan que pasar ninguna necesidad.
El negocio que desea fortalecer es la ampliación de sus corrales para poder incrementar su producción de gallinas criollas, a esta actividad le dedicarán un promedio de 3 horas diarias, tiene mucho conocimiento a pesar de que lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, está convencida que sus ingresos mejorará la situación de su hogar debido a que siempre le pone mucho fe y dedicación a las metas que se propone. 
La Sra. Eva agradece profundamente a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder pronto cumplir con sus sueños, está convencida que esta oportunidad que se le presenta debe aprovecharla al máximo.
texts.en:
Eva Guamán lives in northwestern Pichincha in the San Miguel del los Bancos settlement of Pueblo Nuevo.  This is a place with a warm humid climate where the people, most of whom work in agriculture, are very united and hardworking.  Eva Guamán is a single mother with 3 children who are the reason that she continues to move forward.  She has sought a way to triumph in life. One of her achievements is having her own business selling hens and pigs.  On the weekends she also works in a restaurant in the area while her children stay with a relative.

Eva Guamán has a lot of dreams that she would like to turn into reality.  One of these is to provide her children with a good education so that in the future they can become great professionals who will lack for nothing.

Eva wants to expand her pens to fortify her business. This way she can increase her production of creole hens, a business that she devotes about 3 hours to each day.  She has a lot of knowledge, even though she learned the occupation on her own initiative.  Eva is convinced that her income will improve the situation of her household, and she always puts a lot of faith and dedication into the goals that she proposes.

Eva is profoundly grateful to the Fundacion and to Kiva for the support and opportunity being provided to improve her quality of life and accomplish her dreams.  She believes that she must take maximum advantage of the opportunity that is being presented to her.

loans.use: to expand her pens and increase her production of hens

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La socia Griselda se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una empresa privada,la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio propio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cemento y arena para la construccion de su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Griselda continues to work for a private company.  Through this work, she provides for her family.  She dreams of having her own business.  Griselda is requesting this loan to buy cement and sand for construction work on her house.

Griselda is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ina Mercedes

texts.es: Ina es una emprendedora Barranquillera de 62 años de edad  que desde hace 5 años convirtió un hobby en su negocio, esta actividad la practicaba porque le gustaba, sin embargo hoy en día, desde la comodidad de su hogar trabaja en su taller de confecciones, el cual adecuó en una habitación de su vivienda,  espacio propicio para confeccionar blusas, pantalones y vestidos de acuerdo a lo solicitado por su clientela, también brinda servicio de clínica de ropa. Ella proyecta incrementar su inventario de telas e insumos con el fin de ofrecer productos terminados y ampliar su mercado, sus ventas y sus utilidades, para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en telas, hilos, correderas, accesorios y demás. Su meta es incrementar su número de clientes, contratar empleados y obtener mejores ingresos que a futuro le permitan comprar su casa propia.
texts.en: Ina is an enterprising woman from Barranquilla who is 62 years old.  Five years ago, she converted her hobby into a business.  She used to sew because she enjoyed it, however today she works in her sewing workshop in the comfort of her home.  She adapted a room in her house to make the workshop.  In this space, she makes blouses, pants, and dresses according to her customers'  requests.  She also makes clinic clothes.  She plans to increase her inventory of fabrics and supplies so that she can offer more finished products for sale and expand her market, her sales, and her profits.  To do this, she is taking her first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest these funds in thread, fabric, zippers, accessories, and other items.  Her goal is to increase the number of customers she has, hire employees, and generate more income so that in the future she can buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Makanga

texts.en:
Makanga is a married man who has no children. He lives in his own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. He lists transport as his main monthly expense.

He has operated a barber shop business for the past five years. His potential customers are his fellow neighbours and people at the market place. He dreams of earning more income .

With the KES 50,000 he wants to purchase another shaving machine forn his business. He decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve his business

loans.use: to purchase another shaving machine for his barber shop business.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin is 64 years old and works as a driver. He needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. Fermin is divorced and he has three adult sons.
His family members have their own expenses and can t help him financially. That is why Fermin is still working although he is a senior citizen. His retirement payments are not enough for him. Fermin would like to buy another vehicle in the future

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en: Inocencio is a married man and father of two children. Inocencio has his own house which is made of adobe (a fragile material).  Inocencio and his wife make cheese  They go to Achacachi to sell their cheese products  Inocencio needs a loan to buy a milking cow that will be very helpful for his business Inocencio has had experience with cows since he was a child so he hopes you can trust him

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable, sus fiestas de Cantonización las celebran en el mes de julio, este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, como la cascada del amor y varias hosterías su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando conciertos y bailes populares.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Martha una mujer emprendedora de 29 años ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y sus padres no le pudieron dar el estudio, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella y sus esposo se dedican al negocio de producción de naranjilla y venta de ganado de carne, aprendió de esta actividad desde su niñez junto con sus padres, trabaja un promedio de 2 a 5 horas diarias.
Este préstamo utilizará la Sra. Martha para emprender en el negocio de crianza y engorde de pollos broiler, cuenta con el espacio adecuado y los conocimientos necesarios, con este préstamo espera que su situación económica mejore y pueda darle a su familia un mejor futuro, la señora Martha agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a territorial unit with a humid climate and very kind people. They celebrate the festivities of their area in July. The area has various tourist attractions like the waterfall of love and various hostels. The people are cheerful and like to enjoy all of the festivities, organizing concerts and dances. 

In this territorial unit, Martha lives and has her business. She is a 29 year old enterprising woman who comes from a family of few economic resources. Her parents couldn't give her an education. She lives with her husband and three children. She and her husband make a living producing a fruit called naranjilla and selling beef cattle. She learned this work in her childhood together with her parents, working 2 to 5 hours daily on average. 

Martha will utilize this loan to start a business of raising and fattening broiler chickens. She has the adequate space and necessary knowledge. With this loan she hopes that her economic situation improves and that she can give her family a better future. Martha thanks Kiva for the support and the help provided.

loans.use: to start raising chickens on her farm to diversify her production and increase her clientele.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Nyanyo Kpakpa Group

texts.en:
The members are part of Nyanyo Kpakpa Group and are on their 10th loan with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of six members whose businesses include selling footwear, food, ladies garments and smoked fish. This loan will help with their small businesses, including Regina's. This is her 10th loan from ID-Ghana, having joined on a friend’s invitation. She has a business selling canvas and slippon footwear and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more slippon and canvas footwear in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to her customers. This work will allow her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has two children. When asked what she likes abut ID-Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. The group will need a total of GHS 7,700 to improve their businesses.
They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more slippon and canvas footware in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to her customers.

loans.name: N2Thịtứ_Dlực_Young Dynamic Women Group

texts.en:
Mai is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She has a retail business selling rice, which she has been doing for 10 years. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2014, Mai joined N2ThịTứ_DLực_Young Dynamic Women Group to improve her  business. She is the group leader of N2ThịTứ_DLực_Young Dynamic Women Group, which consists of five members. She is a reputable person in the community. 

Mai is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase rice to resell. With her business profit, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is a 29-year-old engineering student in his third year. He lives in the Banteay Meanchey province in Cambodia. Previously, he worked for a phone company and worked on weekends. Currently, he is working for an organization and makes $6.67 each day. Vannak is applying for a loan, his second with Kiva, through KREDIT because he hasn’t enough money to pay for his third-year tuition fees. 

He will use the loan  to fully finance his third year at the university. Vannak wants to be a good engineer and earn a reasonable salary, save money, and build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for his third-year tuition fees.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha earns a living by buying and selling scrap materials including metals, empty plastic bottles, and cans. She is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, ages 10 and 14. She has been engaged in the scrap buying business for more than 10 years. She needs additional funds to sustain her current source of income.

Juditha has requested a loan to purchase materials like scrap bottles, cans and plastics to recycle. This loan will help Juditha sell a higher volume of scrap materials. Then she could settle her obligations and would be able to stabilize her finances. 

She is doing her best to be successful in handling her business so that it supports the needs of her growing children and also make here financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like scrap bottles, cans and plastics

loans.name: N4Thịtứdlực_Young Women Do Business Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy is 45 years old and she is married with two children.

Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2014, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is a reputable person in the community. Thủy and eight other women established the "N4Thịtứdlực_Young Women Do Business" solidarity group to get a loan for their businesses.  All members agreed to vote for her to be the group leader.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children, all attend school.

She grows vegetables and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seedlings  and other farm supplies.

This is the second loan that Flordeliza requested through by Kiva.

Flordeliza wishes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings  and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bregida

texts.en:
Bregida is an 48-year-old woman with five children and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Bregida has had a fish vending business for 9 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Bregida would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 29 years old, married and has two children, one in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emma has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 58 years old, married, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years.

Lorna requested a loan from NWFT for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and has nine children. She sells fish and rice in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a loan from NWTF for 6,750 PHP, which she will use to buy a solar lamp to provide her children with a bright light when they study at night. Teresita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Zandra Lorena

texts.en:
Zandra is an artisan from Guatemala, who specializes in jade jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade for her designs. Zandra has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I was born on May 23, 1983, in Quiché, but I grew up in an orphanage in San Lucas Toliman. The first thing I ever made on my own was a pair of silver earrings. My husband taught me, so I could help him. I remember watching him work on his own until all hours of the night, and I really wanted to learn how to craft jewelry. I felt happy when I saw the jewelry I had crafted and how beautiful it was. It's not been easy getting established as an artisan, because silver is very expensive and it's difficult to purchase. But when you set your mind to it, you can achieve your goals. My greatest dream is to be able to buy a piece of land and build my own house, so that I may leave it to my two sons.

"Thank you for your support! With these funds, I will be able to invest in my craft and create more pieces."

Use the link below to view Zandra's jade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8030

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of silver and jade, to use in her designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some containers of motor oil.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y trabaja de jornalero en una finca cerca de su casa se dedica desde muy pequeño a esta actividad agrícola ya que su padre le enseño ese oficio, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
This young man’s face has been blurred because he is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk zone.  He grows corn, and works as a day laborer on a farm near his house.  He has been working in agriculture since he was very young, as his father taught him this work.  He lives in his own house with his family. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph, in order to continue with his work. In this way, he can earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc.

loans.name: N6P15Đsơn-We Need You Group

texts.en:
Anh is a 38-year-old married woman who has had a retail business selling dry food and other items for 5 years.
Anh lives in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  She is a reputable person in the community.

Her family is a low-income household and the market is slow in this region. 
The main hardship she faces is a lack of capital and she requests a loan to purchase cake, sweets, sugar, and milk.

This is Anh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and every members voted her to be the leader of "N6P15ĐSơn-We need you" group.

Anh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase cake, sweets, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: N1Chiếnthắng-Funny Fisherwomen Group

texts.en:
Tâm is 30 years old and married.
 She has operated a food stall/restaurant, selling seafood, for 6 years.
Tâm lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village and the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Tâm faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to resell.
She is a reputable person in the community.
Although this is Tâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every member of the group agreed to vote her to be the leader of N1ChiếnThắng-Funny fisherwomen group which consist of eight members.
With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to resell

loans.name: N1P8Qthắng-I Love Chickens Group

texts.en:
Lài is 41 years old and married with two children.
 
She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for two years.
Lài lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Lài faces is lack of capital.
In 2014, Lài joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to began raising chickens. Lài has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Her family life is better now. She is the group leader of N1P8QThắng-I Love Chickens solidarity group.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future.
With her business profit, Lài hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Merlyn

Merlyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

Hiệp is 35 years old and married. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. This region often suffers natural disasters such as floods and drought. 

Hiệp operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, which she has been doing for five years. The main hardship she faces is lack of capital.  

Hiệp is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. Although this is Hiệp first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, every group member agreed to vote her to be the leader of N4th8QĐại-Flying Fish Group. With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

texts.en:
Lệch is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, and this region is affected by natural disasters such as floods and drought. 
The main hardship that Lệch faces is  lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase more seafood to sell.

In 2014, Lệch joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business and has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

 Lệch hopes for her business to do well, her family to be healthy and happy, and her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase seafood.

loans.name: Las Maria Group

texts.en:
Santa Lucía La Reforma is a town in the Western Highlands in the department of Totonicapan. Here, nine hard-working women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Marias.” They share many common dreams and goals. They range in age from 25 to 60 years. The majority of the ladies sell vegetables.

Angelita is a 24-year-old, married member of the Trust Bank. She has two children. She came from a large family of 15 children; for this reason, she had only two years of formal education. She has a small business, which is the purchase and sale of peanuts and seeds. Angelita learned about this business from her mother-in-law. Angelita is very motivated and pleased to be a member of the Trust Bank. She is requesting a loan to purchase ten large sacks of peanuts and seeds. She is determined to create more income and raise the standard of living for her family.

The ladies look forward to their monthly meetings, when they see each other and transact business on their loans. After this task is completed, they participate in informal educational seminars with a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge. They learn about all kinds of relevant subjects, like hygiene, health and nutrition, women’s rights and violence against women. The ladies learn to manage their loans with information about budgeting, accounting, pricing, marketing and customer service. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus.”

Thank you to each KIVA lender, for believing in Angelita and her friends in the “Las Marias” Trust Bank. They are taking positive steps to create a more prosperous future for themselves, their families, and their community of Santa Lucía La Reforma.

loans.use: to purchase ten large sacks of peanuts and seeds to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, biscuits, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rita Judith

texts.en:
Rita Judith is 32 years old. She is a salaried worker, but she earns additional income selling clothes, shoes, purses, etcetera. She says that she enjoys working, because she gets to meet a lot of people and this gives her opportunities to sell products and earn additional income.

She is asking for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. She says that her goal is to become fully independent.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucille is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lucille has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lucille requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lucille has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lucille would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a maize milling machine so that he can provide milling services to over 250 families in his community.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 43-year-old married woman with five children, three attend school.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 8 years.  She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF  to to increase her inventory.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid 6 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income raising livestock.

Analyn aspires to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Nur. Nur lives in Magelang, around a one hour and thirty minute flight from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Nur is happily married.

He owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive, who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system. The sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money. Moreover, his community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Nur is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits to his local community. Understanding its importance, your loan will be very useful in helping Nur improve his business and, by extension, his community, which needs access to such services.

As seen in the photo, Nur is standing in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to help local community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, 49, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is a father of nine children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice. He sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for around thirty years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by providing a latrine for their use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: N2Thủ Lộcqlợi-Funny Farmers Group

texts.en:
Thu  is a 38-year-old married woman who  lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her household is noted as poor and the market  is slow in this region. 
 
She has raised poultry and cattle for more than 10 years.  She is a reputable person in the community.

The main hardship that Thu  faces is a lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase  poultry and cattle to raise and sell.

This is  Thu's  first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and the members voted her as the leader of "N2Thủ lộcQLợi-Funny farmers" group.

Thu  hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase  poultry and cattle.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:

Carolina has had a fish vending business for 10 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.name: Lolita

Lolita has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

In the future Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.name: N3Thuận17Qnham-Against Poverty Group

texts.en:
Mrs Điểu is 50 years old, and she is married. She has operated a food stall/ restaurant, selling fish, for more than 10 years. Điểu lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village. Moreover, this region often suffers from natural disasters, such as storms, because it is near the sea. The main hardship that Điểu faces is a lack of capital.

In 2014, Điểu joined the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, to improve her business. Điểu and three of her neighbors resolved to fight against poverty for their families, so they established the "N3Thuận17QNham-Against Poverty Group" to get a loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, seeking to improve their incomes.

Điểu has successfully repaid one previous loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

With her business profit, Điểu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es: Juana tiene  44 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su esposo  y un hijo de 19 años de edad por quien ella ha luchado con el fin de sacarlo adelante con los estudios. Juana es una mujer  luchadora que se dedica a vender productos básicos de primera necesidad ya que tiene instalada una pequeña tienda  en su residencia, además es modista  y con esta actividad logra llevar una vida más estable económicamente hablando, ella  siempre busca la manera de brindar a su familia una vida digna  y  darles todo lo necesario en su hogar, Juana con el propósito de mejorar su condición de vida a tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito a FUSAI para poder ampliar y mejorar el corredor de su vivienda , por lo que ella con el monto otorgado piensa comprar : lámina, polines, cemento, grava y arena para poder  ampliar y encementar el corredor de su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is 44 years old, she lives in her own home with her husband and their nineteen-year-old son. She has worked hard to get him ahead with his studies.

Juana is a hard-working mother who makes a living selling products for everyday needs. She is also modest, and this job allows her to lead a more financially stable life. She always finds a way to give her family a decent life and to provide them with everything needed at home. 

With the purpose of improving her living conditions, Juana has made the decision of getting a loan from FUSAI to expand and improve the hallway of her home. She hopes to use the amount given to buy sheet metal, poles, cement, gravel and sand in order to expand and cement the hallway of her home.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, poles, cement, gravel and sand to expand and cement the hallway of her home.

loans.name: N4Ttiến22Qnham-Old Women Arent Afraid Of Difficulties Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sánh is 55 years old, and she is married. She has had a retail business, selling dried foods and general things, for more than 10 years.

Sánh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village. Moreover, this region often suffers from natural disasters, such as storms, because it is near the sea. The main hardship that Sánh faces is a lack of capital. In 2010, Sánh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, seeking to improve her business.

Now she is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, and other things to resell. Sánh has successfully repaid five previous loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Sánh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, and other things to resell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marcela runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase items to sell at her store, like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. Marcela has been in this business for five years, now.

In the future, Marcela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell at her store, like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 46 years old and widowed; she has one child who is in school.

Jasmin runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maydagul

texts.ru: Майдагул человек, который всегда всем помогает и поддерживает. Ей 39 лет. Он живет со своей семьей в районе Фархор. Майдагул очень трудолюбивый человек. Она занимается растениеводством и куплей продажей скота. Она имеет четыре года опыта работы. В основном она любит и предпочитает скотоводство. Потому что от этого вида деятельности она получает хорошую прибыль. И еще она изготавливает  все молочные продукты у себя дома, такие как кефир, йогурт и т.д. Майдагул хочет, купит несколько голов телят, откормить их и продать. Также ей нужно купит корм для скота. К сожалению, у неё нет достаточно денег, и она очень надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Maydagul always helps and supports others. She is 39 years old. [She] lives with her family in the Farkhor region. Maydagul is a very-hard working person. She grows farm produce and also buy sand resells livestock. She has four years of experience in this line of work. She mainly likes raising livestock, because this type of business brings a good revenue. In addition, she also prepares dairy products at home, for example, kefir, yogurt etc. 

Maydagul would like to buy several calves for fattening and resale. She also needs to buy animal feed. Unfortunately, she lacks the funds needed, and really hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase several calves and feed for them.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 39 years old and has four children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Marivic has been in this business for 14 years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jenjelina

texts.en:
Jenjelina is a 33-year-old woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jenjelina has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 38-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school. Susana is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food production/vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Susana has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:

Analie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Analie has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Analie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Analie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Karla Yesenia

texts.es: Karla de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 10 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a viernes tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Karla is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her mother. She has had a beauty salon in her home for 10 years. She works Monday through Friday and has many customers as she works well. She is able to pay her household expenses with her earnings. She seeks a loan to be able to buy products for her beauty salon such as creams, shampoos, hair clips, scissors, and other items that she needs and in this way she will be able to have better profits which will help her have an improved economic stability.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon such as creams, shampoos, hair clips, scissors, and other items.

loans.name: N10Tthuậnqnham-Sunny On The Sea Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mận is 41 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.

Mận lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. In addition, this region has often suffered from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. The main hardship that Mận faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. 

In 2010, Mận joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Mận has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Mận hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Juan Carlos
