texts.es: Juan de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en: Juan is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has been growing corn and beans for 15 years. He sells his products in different markets near his home. He seeks a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc. and in this way be able to obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Liezel has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living through pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Leonila dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 34-year-old married woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her snack food business.

Jessica has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack food business.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 58 years old and married with one child. Fedelina works very hard to provide for her family.

Fedelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Fedelina has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Fedelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge es un joven universitario  de 19 años, dedicado a la comercialización de productos para el hogar y de aseo personal, los cuales ofrece a través de catálogos. Hace un año conoció el negocio por parte de su mejor amigo y descubrió que era una opción bastante rentable, por lo que se animó a comenzar el negocio en el cual invierte el mayor  tiempo posible para  hacerlo crecer. Sus clientes son familiares, vecinos y referidos y realiza sus ventas de contado en el horario de 9:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. Actualmente Jorge cuenta con muy poco capital de trabajo, por los cual no logra atender toda la demanda que genera su clientela; actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el objetivo de obtener los recursos para invertir en un mayor pedido de artículos para el hogar y de aseso personal, pues al aumentar su oferta sus ventas serán mayores y por lo tanto obtendrá una mayores utilidades. Jorge desea convertirse en distribuidor mayorista de los productos  que comercializa, terminar su carrera universitaria y generar  los ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 19, is a young university student who sells household and personal-care products via catalog. His best friend introduced him to the business a year ago, and he discovered that it was a pretty profitable option.  This motivated him to get started in the business, in which he invests as much time as possible, in order to make it grow. His customers are relatives, neighbors, and referrals. He sells for cash, from 9:00 AM until 8:00 PM.  

Currently, Jorge has very little working capital, so he is not able to fulfill all of his customers’ orders. He is requesting his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in a larger order of household and personal care articles, as increasing his selection will increase his sales, and thus, his earnings.

Jorge wants to become a wholesale distributor of the products that he sells, complete his university program, and generate the income that will allow him to support his family.

loans.use: to invest in a large order of household and personal-care items.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 68 años de edad, trabajo como secretaria, tubo tres hijos dos varones y una niña, hace 27 años su pareja la abandono, ella se dedica actualmente a la sastrería, esto le ayudo a darles una carrera profesional a sus tres hijos los cuales aun viven con ella.

María, desde hace poco mas de 27 años se dedica a la fabricación de trajes de vestir, manteles, cortinas, adornos para licuadoras, etc. ademas tiene  una pequeña tienda la cual distribuye sus productos, oficio que aprendió de su madre, ella trabaja en su casa de habitación, ya que no se puede movilizar mucho por que tiene una prótesis en la cadera para poder caminar.

El crédito sera utilizado en la compra de tela, hilo y agujas de diferentes colores para la elaboración de los productos.

El sueño de María, es que su negocio siga creciendo para obtener mejores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 68 years old and works as a secretary. She has two sons and one daughter. 27 years ago her spouse abandoned her. Today she works as a seamstress. This helped her be able to provide a professional career to her three children, all of whom still live with her. Maria has been making clothing, table cloths, curtains, etc for a little over 27 years. In addition she has a small store where she sells her products. She learned these skills from her mother. She works from her home as she cannot move very mush as she has a prosthesis on her back in order to be able to walk.

The loan will be used to buy thread, needles, and fabric of different colors to make her products. Maria dreams of continuing to grow her business in order to obtain better income and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and fabric.

loans.name: N1Tđức06Qnham-Albatross On The Waves Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghinh is 53 years old and married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. Nghinh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, this region often suffers because of natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

The main hardship that Nghinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. In 2012, Nghinh joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nghinh has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Nghinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

Note: In the photo: the child is a member's son. He just wanted to stand with his mother; he did not get a loan. The person standing far behind is not a member in this group.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ligaya is 60 years old and one of her children is in school.

Ligaya has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Ligaya has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ligaya would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable to sell

loans.name: N7Th1Qlộc-Hard Working Farmers Group

texts.en:
Hoa is 44 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture, raising livestock, for seven years. Hoa lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of N7Th1Qlộc-Hard Working Farmers Group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Leivis Eduardo

texts.es: Leivis Eduardo, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y hijos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leivis Eduardo is 23 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and children who are his main priority. 

With his loan he intends to purchase: good quality bean seeds to ensure good germination; organic fertilizers, which will help to improve the condition of the soil; and other products to use while planting. It will also pay for hired labor to prepare the land, ensure that rainwater doesn't cause erosion damage, apply the products and assist with the plants once they have developed. This way he can ensure that he does a good job.

He intends to take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions in that area for his crop. He will also put into practice various years of experience in the management of basic grains. Also, he will be able to buy the best high quality products so that his crop develops well, is healthy, and has a good harvest, giving him high production in the short term. 

He wants to use the income he hopes to obtain from his harvest for his family's wellbeing and studies, meet some family goals, and continue investing more in his crops.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with easy terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, el posee  un taller de costura desde hace 20 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, el quiere mejorar su vivienda  construyendo un muro principal en donde muestra la fotografía, pero como no posee de suficiente capital para hacerlo por eso está solicitando un crédito para la compra de material de construcción y pago de mano de obra y así poder tener un hogar digno.
texts.en: Lucio, 43 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and their two daughters. He has owned his sewing shop for 20 years, located in his home. He wants to improve his home by building a main wall where he will display photos, but since he does not have enough money to do so, he is requesting a loan to buy construction material and pay for labor. Thus, he will be able to have a respectable home.

loans.use: to buy construction material and pay for labor.

loans.name: N05Ttiến22Qnham-Hard Working For Future Group

texts.en:
Tiến is 36 years old and married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for more than 10 years.
Tiến lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village and the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Tiến faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.
In 2011, Tiến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Tiến has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Tiến hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

Note: In the photo: only the three people in the foreground are in this group.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: N7Ttiến22Nham-Children Need To Go To School Group

texts.en:
Hương is 29 years old and married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Hương lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. This region often suffered from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.
In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

Note : In the photo, only the four women in the foreground are group members.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marina works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional basket of fish to make dried fish for her business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional basket of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 63 years old and has four children.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Luzviminda has been raising pigs for 44 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Annalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business making peanut butter in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Annalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her peanut butter business.

Annalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anamarie

texts.en:
Anamarie is 45 years old and married with three children. Anamarie works very hard to provide for her family.

Anamarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, candies, home care products, and other groceries.

Anamarie has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Anamarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, candies, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 55 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Carmen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carmen has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 57 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Felipa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, home care products, and other groceries.

Felipa has been in this business for four years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, bread, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 58-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food production/vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Elisa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sergio Misael

texts.es: Sergio de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles, tiene 7 años de dedicarse al negocio muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Sergio is 38 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner. He has a carpentry workshop where he produces and sells a variety of beautiful and quality furniture pieces. He has worked in this business for 7 years. Many people prefer his services because he provides quality furniture and good prices. He is requesting a loan with 'Integral' to invest in his business by purchasing wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds, and other items that can attract more clients. This way, he can accomplish his goal of improving his of quality of life as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish, glue, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bricks to build a house for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Floramie has a personal product care business in the Philippines. Floramie has been in this business for 5 years. 

Floramie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like vitamins, etc.

In the future, Floramie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Los Pinos De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS DE COLLPANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Trinidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, venta de accesorios para celular, venta de ropa, venta de zapatillas, venta de gorros, venta de papa, venta de comida, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Trinidad es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de accesorios para celular; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga desde hace ocho años con los pocos ahorros que tenía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra  de audífonos, carcasas y cargadores por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y  tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la capacitación y los ahorros que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The group bank "Los Pinos de Collpani" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the regional office at Collpani. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, of which Trinidad is the President. The businesses of the members are varied and include the sales of meats, phone accessories, clothing, shoes, hats, potatoes, food, and fruits. 

The loan they take out will benefit small business owners like Trinidad. She notes that she has been part of Pro Mujer for eight years when she joined after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling phone accessories. She indicates that she learned this business from a friend 8 years ago, and started it with the few savings she had.

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (through the purchase of wholesale headphones, phone covers, and chargers), which she will buy from wholesalers in the city La Paz. Afterwards, she will sell these in her stall. This work allows her to generate income to financially support her family since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and savings that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy wholesale headphones, phone covers, and chargers

loans.name: Jennnifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jennnifer works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Jennnifer is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional tools and materials for her furniture making business.

Jennnifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 48 years old, married with three children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Mercy aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and widowed with six children. With one child in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, salt, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for 23 years. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, salt, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Relyn

texts.en:
Relyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Relyn is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Relyn has a clothing-sales business in the Philippines. Relyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more blouses, pants, footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing to offer for sale.

Relyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Relyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, pants, footwear and other ready-to-wear clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 28 years old and has two children. Alma is married and has two children who are in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for two years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Glaiza is 22 years old.

Glaiza has a business buying and selling scrap in the Philippines. Glaiza requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell.

Glaiza has been in this business for four years. In the future, Glaiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario has been a fisherman for almost five years.  He goes fishing and sells fresh fish to support his family's daily needs. He  is a married man with six  children. Three of his children are still attending school. 

Apolinario needs capital to finance his fishing livelihood. He has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net and gasoline for fuel (for the motor boat).  These will help him to improve his catch and enable him to sell more fish to the locals.  With that, he could augment his income and continue to provide good food for the family. He could now start to settle his finances and start to expand his fishing business. 

He is determined to manage it productively to improve the family's living condition and to continue financing the schooling of his three children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and gasoline for fuel (for the motor boat)

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 33-year-old woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Jennifer requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mildred works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Mildred is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Socabon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIRGEN DEL SOCAVON” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cerveza, venta de comida, venta de pan, tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, venta de abarrotes, venta de leche.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felicidad es integrante, ella indica ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de un asesor de crédito de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que con los ahorros que tenía decidió emprender este negocio que lo aprendió de su mamá  hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Socavon" will begin its 7th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada regional office. It is composed of eight members and is governed by a board of directors of which Felicidad is president. The members of the communal bank have various businesses, such as selling beer, selling food, selling bread, running a neighborhood store, selling candy, selling groceries, and selling milk.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesses like Felicidad's. She states that she joined Pro Mujer after being invited by one of the institution's promoters. Currently, she has a business selling food. She discloses that she decided to start this business (which she learned from her mother several years ago) with her savings.

Felicidad is requesting this loan to increase capital. She will buy flour and noodles at wholesale from wholesale sellers in El Alto and afterwards she will sell them at her food stand. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has two children.

When Felicidad was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health center services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy flour and noodles at wholesale.

loans.name: Renu

texts.en:
Renu is a 40-year-old widow. She lives at Kandi in the district of Murshidabad.  She is a mother of one grown-up son.  She never had opportunity for study in her young age; she can only sign her name. They have a semi-concrete house in the village.

After her husband's death, her son started working to generate income for the family. He is a Toto rickshaw driver. It is a battery-operated auto-rickshaw which is an eco-friendly, four-wheeled vehicle. He offers transportation service in the village and nearby village using his Toto rickshaw in order to make a living. He carries people from one place to another. Now the Toto has been damaged in an accident and needs maintenance. He wants to repair it as soon as possible as it is the only income-generating source for their family.

As a responsible mother, Renu decided to help her son and applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to cover the cost of repairing the vehicle. Renu hopes that with the help of this loan, her son can repair the Toto and can provide better transport facilities to the village people, and thus, can earn a lucrative income. In the future, Renu wants to purchase one more Toto.

Renu and her son are very happy after getting the loan and are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for repairing their 'Toto' rickshaw.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas desde hace 20 años, comercializa su producto en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa gracias a su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo ha podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas semillas de marañón por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Teresa is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has made a living selling roasted cashew seeds for 20 years, selling her product in the different markets that are found close to her house. Thanks to her work and with the help of her husband she has been able to succeed. 

She is seeking a loan to buy more cashew seeds wholesale to continue with her work and thereby obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy more cashew seeds wholesale.

loans.name: Shafali

texts.en:
Shafali lives in Sahispara village of Kandi in West Bengal. She is a 20-year-old married woman. She has a family comprising five members: her husband, two sons, one daughter. One attends school; two are preschoolers. In her young age, Shafali studied up to primary level and could not continue due to financial issues in her family.

Now Shafali is a housewife. Her husband is driving a Toto (a battery-operated auto-rickshaw) which has become a very much popular vehicle for carrying people to cover short distances.  This Toto is the only source of income for a family of five members. The earnings from this business are inadequate for the family. At present, the auto-rickshaw needs some repairing and also a change of tyres and tubes.

Shafali intends to access a loan and improve her husband's business. So, she applied for a business loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to repair the Toto-rickshaw and purchase new tyres and tubes for it. She has a cherished desire to run a standing business and purchase a new Toto-rickshaw for earning more income in the future.

She expresses her gratitude towards her generous lenders.

loans.use: To pay for repairing her husband's Toto rickshaw.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, rodeado de gente trabajadora, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tienen las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes.
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio el señor  Luis un hombre luchador de  33 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 3 hijos, la esposa no trabaja ella le ayuda en el negocio con la alimentación de los cerdos en las mañanas y él en las tardes  se encarga el de forma personal ya que también trabaja como jornalero en el Concejo Provincial. 
Aprendió esta actividad por iniciativa propia y con la gran ayuda y ventaja que en su trabajo les dan talleres y les enseñan sobre el correcto cuidado y alimentación de los cerdos en todas sus etapas, a este negocio le dedican un promedio de 3 horas por día, Don Luis viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y gran parte de su vida tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos menores, 
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio de los cerdos arreglando y ampliando las chancheras ya que quiere comprar cerdas madres, con esta nueva inversión incrementara su producción de cerdos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
El señor Luis agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando a él y su familia para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the “Canton of Love”, is a canton with a warm, humid climate, and surrounded by hardworking people. It has various recreation sites that are much visited by domestic and foreign tourists. There are the traditional Canton fiestas, in which popular dances and the famous “burning of the castle” are performed. The people in this canton are very calm and gracious with all their visitors.

This is the canton in which Señor Luis lives and has his business. He is a man with a fighting spirit, age 33. He maintains a strong common-law-marriage, from which he has three children. His wife doesn’t work, but she helps him with the business. She helps him with feeding the pigs in the morning, and takes charge of the business personally in the afternoon, as he also works as a day-laborer for the provincial government. 

He learned this occupation through his own initiative; and he had a great help and advantage in that his job provides workshops and lessons on the proper care and feeding of pigs in all phases.  He devotes an average of three hours a day to this business. Don Luis comes from a family with few economic resources, and for a great part of his life he had to work to help his parents and younger siblings.

He is requesting the loan in order to invest in the pig business, repairing and enlarging the pig pens, as he wants to purchase breeding sows. With this new investment, he will increase his production of pigs and improve his income.

Señor Luis thanks Kiva for the support and the opportunity they are giving to him and to his family, so that they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to repair and expand his pig pens in order to be able to add breeding sows, and grow his business with the income, in order to achieve his dream of becoming a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as dynamic. 

Danson operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Danson will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijas, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años ya que sus padres le enseñaron la actividad agrícola, el comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra llevar el pan diario a su casa,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in his own house with his life companion and their three daughters. He has been working in agriculture for fifteen years, because his parents taught him the occupation of farming. 

He sells his produce in the different markets near his house; and with his sales, he manages to provide for his home. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, fertilizer, compost, herbicide, etc.  

In this way, he can obtain better earnings for a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as dynamic. 

Anthony operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Anthony will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits. His business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as trustworthy. 

Esther operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Esther will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josephine is 36 years old and all eight children are sent to school.

Josephine has a machinery rental business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her grinding machine.

Josephine has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her grinding machine.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 61 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Fely has a fishing business in the Philippines. Fely requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Fely has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She describes herself as outgoing. 

She operates a farm where she grows rice. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her challenge as a low water supply. She will use this 85,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a sufficient water supply.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 4 años inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, pesticidas, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su madre.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated because he is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area has been growing corn for the past four years. He began with his own capital and sells his products around the area where he lives. 

The young man lives in his own home with his mother. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, pest control products, etc., in order to obtain better economic returns for a better quality of life with his mother.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as being a lack of enough funds. She will use her 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. 

Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a farm where he grows rice. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as being a low water supply. 

He will use this 100,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will have a sufficient water supply.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a Kiva borrower. She has six children and operates a farm where she keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for six years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of water storage capacity. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a Kiva borrower. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She describes her challenge to be lack of enough clean water. She will use the KES 48,050 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a married mother of one child. She operates a retail business where she sells flasks and jugs. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more flasks and jugs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: buy more flasks and jugs

loans.name: Gul Nargis

texts.en: Gul Nargis, age 36, is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a variety of new embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. This loan will help him  offer more varieties to his customers and help him continue his work efficiently and professionally. Gul Nargis is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase raw materials for embroidery. Gul Nargis is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's embroidery shop

loans.name: Safdar's Group

texts.en:
Safdar is standing in the middle by raising his hand in this picture. He is 32, married with 5 family members, and he is a resident of village Allah Ditta, Tehsil Noshehra Virkan, Distt Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is a farmer who grows wheat, rice, vegetables, and fodder in his farm land. He feeds his family through the sale of his crop.
He and his group members are beneficiaries of JWS. They have successfully completed two loan cycles with JWS and paid back all the loans in time. JWS has provided them successful training on wheat and rice crops management.
They are requesting a loan to buy farm inputs like quality seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. This loan facility will increase their farm output in terms of quality and quantity. 
His dream is to send his children in school for better education.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has five children. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a productive area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Crosalita

texts.en:
Crosalita raises and sells hogs as her main source of income. In addition to that, she engages in farming, growing and selling rice.  She is 58 years old, married and has two grown children. She resides in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in agriculture for more than 10 years. 

Crosalita is asking for a loan to buy farm materials like fertilizer, rice seedlings and also to pay for laborers. These resources are very essential for the  improvement of her farming business. The loan will help Crosalita boost the harvest and improve her earnings as well. She could then do some expansion and set aside some savings for emergency purposes.

In the future, Crosalita is hoping to start raising poultry for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm materials like fertilizer, rice seedlings and also to pay for laborers

loans.name: Juana Iris

texts.es: Juana de 30 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa humilde pero de su propiedad y vive junto a sus dos hijos varones de 10 y 5 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Juana  desde hace vario tiempo se dedica a laborar como camarera en un hotel y gracias a los ingresos económicos por sus servicios ha logrado darle a sus hijos  todo lo necesario en el hogar. Juana es una mujer que siempre busca la manera de mejorar su vivienda y que esta se vea cada vez más bonita es por ello con el propósito de reparar el techo y las paredes de su vivienda que se encuentran dañadas debido al paso de los años, ella  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de:   lámina y cemento para mejorar su vivienda y brindar a su familia mayor protección.
texts.en:
30-year-old Juana is a single mother. She lives in a house that is humble, but she is the owner. She lives with her two sons, who are 10 and 5 years old and attend school.

For some time now, Juana has made a living as a waitress in a hotel, and thanks to the income she earns for her services, she has been able to give her sons everything they need at home.

Juana is a woman who is always looking for a way to improve her house, so that it can continually look nicer. Wanting to repair her house's roof and walls, which are damaged from the passage of time, she has decided to request a loan through FUSAI. She will use it to purchase sheet metal and cement to make improvements to her house and provide her family with better protection.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and cement to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Haide is 28 years old and has one child in school.

Haide has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Haide would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 46 years old and has six children. She is married and four of her children are in school.

Lina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es: Maria, tiene 46 años de edad, esta soltera, vive en compañía de su madre, y residen en un sector de Cofradía, Cortes. Maria siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, antes vendía cosméticos y hace dos años inicio con negocio en casa, estableció una pulpería para vender refrescos, pastas, condimentos,churros, pan, dulces, arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, jugos y otros abarrotes.  Su fin es capitalizar su negocio comprando más productos, por eso solicita un prestamo de 8,000 lempiras para comprar granos básicos, refrescos, productos de aseo, pan, huevos, embutidos y otros. Ella tiene como meta obtener buenas ganancias para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Maria is 46, single and lives with her mother in a sector of Cofradía, Cortés. Maria has always made her living in sales. She used to sell cosmetics and two years ago she started working out of her house. She opened a small grocery store to sell soft drinks, pasta, condiments, churros, bread, candy, rice, sugar, lard, beans, juice and other groceries. Her plan is to build her business by buying more products and she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, cleaning products, bread, eggs, sausages, etc. Her goal is to earn enough money to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, cleaning products, bread, eggs, sausages, etc. as stock for resale.

loans.name: Ardani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of the Ruma agents, Ardani, who lives in Magelang, around a 90-minute flight from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ardani is happily married. His job is being a mechanic to his neighbors. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well as contribute to his community. 

By supporting this loan you will be providing extra working capital for Ardani's shop. This will allow Ardani to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product, Mapan, which is designed for lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change with agents like Ardani. As their balances grow, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. As a Mapan agent, Ardani is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Ardani will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Ardani believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

Ardani is in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchase products through Mapan, Ruma's e-commerce service for lower-income communities.

loans.name: Sabulon Arcesio

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de la Provincia de  Pichincha se encuentra la Parroquia de Pacto, Recinto Pacto Loma un lugar de clima cálido, el mismo cuenta varios sitios turísticos de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros las tradiciones  de este lugar son las festividades que cada año se realizan en honor a la Virgen del Quinche. 
En este sector vive y trabaja el Señor Sabulón un hombre muy luchador, que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo, se dedica a trabajar haciendo carreras en su camioneta a personas del sector y aledaños de esta manera ha sacado a su familia adelante, trabaja en esta actividad un promedio de 7 horas diarias.
Don Sabulón solicita este crédito para invertir junto a su esposa en el negocio de crianza y engorde de pollos broiler aprendió esta actividad por iniciativa propia y por acudir a varios cursos del SECAP que se dictaron en el sector con este negocio mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y podrá dara su familia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
To the northwest of the province of Pichincha is the Pacto parish, Recinto Pacto Loma, a place with a warm climate and various restful tourist sites that are highly visited by national tourists and foreigners. The traditions of this place are the festivities that are carried out every year in honor of the Virgin of Quinche.

In this area Sabulón lives and works. He is a very tenacious man who lives together with his wife and child. He earns a living making trips in his truck for people in the area and neighboring areas. In this way he has progressed his family forward. He works in this job on average 7 hours per day. 

Sabulón is seeking this loan to invest, together with his wife, in the business of raising and fattening broiler chickens. He learned this work through his own initiative and by using various courses that SECAP gave in the area. With this business they will improve their economic income and be able to give their family a better future.

loans.use: to begin his business raising chickens and to work together with his wife to get ahead and have a better future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty salon items such as facial creams, and combs plus furnishing items like dressing chairs and mirrors for her own beauty salon

loans.name: Liliana Leonor

texts.es: Liliana de 34 años,  ha demostrado tener una gran capacidad emprendedora al enfrentarse a nuevos retos y desafíos, que le han permitido progresar y solventar sus necesidades económicas. Ante la separación con su pareja  y quedar a cargo de su hijo de 8 años de edad, decidió iniciar su propio negocio; logró identificar un mercado potencial entre los camioneros y mecánicos que transitaban por el sector donde reside y consideró que el negocio de los mecatos era una verdadera oportunidad para generar ingresos, negocio que la logrado mantener a través del tiempo. Liliana trabaja de 7:00 a.m. a 6 p.m. ofreciendo a sus clientes además de mecatos y refrescos el servicio de transcripción y fotocopias. Ella desea fortalecer su negocio para y diversificar su negocio con otros productos, para lo cual está aplicando a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en la compra de una vitrina y su surtido en productos de variedades.
texts.en:
Thirty-four year old Liliana has shown great entrepreneurial capacity to face new challenges, which has allowed her to progress and meet her financial needs. Faced with separating from her partner and being in charge of their eight year-old son, she decided to start her own business. 

She was able to identify a potential market among truck drivers and mechanics who passed through the area where she lives and considered that the business of selling snacks was a real opportunity to generate income. She has managed to maintain the business over time. Liliana works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. offering customers not only snacks and refreshments, but also transcription and photocopy service. 

She wants to strengthen her business and diversify it with additional products, which is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a display case and a stock of assorted products.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a display case and an assortment of products.

loans.name: Mawela Group

texts.en:
Magreth is a businesswoman running a couple of businesses. She is in her early 40s, is married and has a boy and girl who are in school. Her primary business is selling hardware, steel, paint and other building materials. She also manages a brick-making and selling business. She is really a good businesswoman dreaming of a high level of business. Magreth works from 7 a.m.to 6 p.m daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her fourth credit request to be apportioned among Mawela, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous credits, paid back successfully, Magreth bought a brick-making machine (manual). She dreams of drilling her own well and buying two electronic machines to make more bricks and receive more orders.  She could have more brick orders but it's difficult to satisfy customers due to a low water supply and manual machine. She is happy because Kiva's loan enabled her to start her hardware business. She really appreciate the lenders' support and wishes you all the best. She earned profit which she used to reinvest back to her business so it could grow. 
Magreth will invest part of her new credit request to drill her own well to have enough water for her brick business.

loans.use: to drill her own well to have enough water for her brick business.

loans.name: Johnnie

texts.en: Johnnie is 33 years and married with three children. He lives in Kasese,Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop of general merchandise since 2010. Johnnie started this business to support his family. He also does farming as a side income business. He faces a challenge of weather change and limited capital. He now requests a loan to buy fertilizer to put in his garden and also to pay labor on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to put in his garden and also to pay labor on his farm.

loans.name: Kumush

texts.en: Kumush is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1961. She is living in village with her family. She is married and has six children. Her family is quite big. She has 15 years of practice doing business in a domestic market. She retails clothing and grocery products. She buys from the central market and sells to rural inhabitants. Her store is general and she has regular customers every day. The business income that she has e is not constant so in addition she works at a school as a cleaning woman. She tries to earn money to feed and ensure her children grow healthy and behave. Her daughter is going to enter to university. She has not her saved up money to pay higher education costs. She appealed to KIVA and IMON to get a loan to pay her daughter’s education fees. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s education fees

loans.name: Piscis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PISCIS” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de coca, venta de papa, venta de dulces, venta de frutas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años. 

El crédito que sacara será para el aumento de capital (compra de chamarras por mayor) que lo adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz  para posteriormente comercializarlo en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Piscis" Communal Bank will begin its eighteenth cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman] as part of the part of the John Paul II Regional Office. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board of directors in which Maria Elena is the President. Businesses that members of the communal bank run are varied and include selling milk, clothes, coca leaves, potatoes, candy, fruit, and running a neighborhood store.

The loan they take out will benefit a group of small micro-entrepreneurs of which Maria Elena is a member. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Today she has a business selling clothes, which she learned on her own initiative several years ago.

The loan she will take out will be to increase her capital (to purchase jackets wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz  and sell later at fairs in the city of El Alto. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training and health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase jackets wholesale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and married with six children. Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bread, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Lydia has been in this business for 20 years. 

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additioanal items to sell like bread, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Alto Villa Victoria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTO VILLA VICTORIA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de pan, venta de carteras, venta de cosméticos, venta de mantas, venta de ropa para damas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de su una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana desde hace ocho años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces y galletas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene una hija. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el la capacitación que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “Alto Villa Victoria” Communal Bank will start its third loan cycle with ProMujer as part of the Juan Pablo Regional Center.  The group is comprised of three members, and is managed by a board of directors where Pamela is president.  The group members are engaged in varied businesses including a neighborhood grocery store, and the sale of food, bread, wallets, cosmetics, blankets, and women’s clothing.

The loan they are taking out will benefit a group of small business owners where Pamela is a member.  She says that she joined ProMujer at the invitation of a friend who is one of the institution’s clients.  Currently, she has a neighborhood grocery store business, and she states that she learned this business from her sister eight years ago.  

She is taking out the current loan to increase capital (to purchase wholesale candy and cookies), which she will acquire from wholesale venders in El Alto, and later sell at her sales stand.  This type of work allows her to support her family financially as she is single and has a daughter.
When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she responded that she enjoys the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale candy and cookies.

loans.name: Heri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Heri. Heri lives in Solo, a city located about 6 hours drive from Jakarta. Heri is happily married and he owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn more about expanding business through technology. His community sees him as a trustworthy mobile provider.

As the business grows, Heri is hoping to get working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Heri improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Heri’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his customers. Heri is the one seen in the photo. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Amisi

texts.en: Amisi is a 47 year-old married man with 8 children, 4 of whom are attending school in Kasese Uganda. He works 6 hours a day and 5 days a week. He deals in agriculture products selling dry beans, maize and ground nuts and earns a side income from a monthly salary. He intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans and ground nuts to resell. He is hardworking, but faces challenges of price fluctuation in agriculture products.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and ground nuts to resell.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is 48 and the mother of four sons and one daughter, living with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession and he has been selling fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family have increased and he does not have other resources to cope with these needs. Therefore, he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the fruits. Therefore, his wife, Gulshan, requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more fresh seasonal fruits. Gulshan thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for her husband's fruit shop

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
These are the members that belong to Muhammad’s group located at Ghoga a village in tehsil kamoki of Pakistan. He is a member of this group and he is also the group leader raising his hand in the photo. He is married, 57 years old and has 9 dependents. He is a farmer by profession. He has land where he grows wheat, rice, and vegetables for his personal use as well as for business purpose.
He has gone through successful training on modern agriculture techniques on the plat form of his local lender to increase his yield. He has to buy 5 sacks of quality Seeds, 18 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for their upcoming rice crop. This loan will increase his crop output. He dreams to send his children to good schools. He promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is 37 years old, resident of Harpoke village in tehsil Kamonki, District Gujranwala. He is the head of his family and looks after the subsistence needs of twelve family members. He is a farmer by occupation and he cultivates rice, wheat and green fodder as per seasonal requirements. He is the group representative of three, raising hand in photo.
He and his group members face problems to secure required agricultural inputs in timely manner due to limited or no savings. They therefore have to rely on informal sources of credit that cost them a lot and also take away the right to sell their crops at market rates. 
The group is hoping that the proposed credit facility shall help them to procure required inputs in timely manner. They are also committed to be responsible borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Divino Amparo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIVINO AMPARO” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia  es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de conservas, venta de comida, venta de zapatos, venta de muebles, venta de jugos de fruta, venta de  carne de pollo. 
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de conservas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas por mayor) que adquirirá de las comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The "Divino Amparo" [Divine Refuge] Communal Bank started its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman], as part of the John Paul II Regional Office. It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board of directors of which Claudia is the President. Businesses that members of the communal bank run are varied and include selling food, canned food, shoes, furniture, fruit juices, and chicken meat.

The loan they take out will benefit a group of small micro-entrepreneurs of which Claudia is a member. She says that she became part of Pro Mujer by an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Today she has a business selling canned food, which she learned on her own initiative several years ago.
 
The loan she will take out now is for increasing her capital (buying canned foods wholesale), which she will acquire from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then sell in her stall. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she loves the training and the health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase canned food wholesale.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Letecia is 55 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy eggs, shampoo, beverages and rice to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 9 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy eggs, shampoo, beverages and rice to sell

loans.name: Ali's Group

texts.en:
Ali is the gentlemen raising his hand in the photo. He is a farmer from Harpoke Tehsil Kamoke Distt Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is 44 years old, married with 9 family members. He is a poor farmer. He is the leader of the group of 3. 
Group members used to borrow money from a middle man at a very high interest rates to finance their agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides, seed and fuel. The middle man leaches the margin by pledging the crops in advance and upon harvesting, paying lesser rates to the farmers than the market rates. 
Ali is requesting a loan to buy agriculture inputs for rice crop. This loan shall release him from the control of the middle men and improve his crop output. He is committed to repay loan timely.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador que a sus 44 años de edad muestra cada día sus deseos de superación, ya que poco a poco ha logrado ir construyendo su vivienda en la que habita junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos un varón de 12 años y tres niñas de 16, 18 y 14 años de edad. José desde hace 10 años se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en una empresa cercana, además en sus ratos libres y con el apoyo de su familia cultiva maíz y frijol, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. José desea invertir en materiales para cultivar una mayor cantidad de productos, pero lo que le tiene mayormente preocupado es su servicio sanitario, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava e inodoro para construir su servicio sanitario para mantener la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en: José, 44, is a hardworking man, and each day he shows his desire to succeed.   Little by little, he has managed to build his home where he lives with his wife and four children, a 12 year old boy and three girls, ages 16, 18, and 14.  For ten years, José has made his living providing his services to a nearby business and, with his family’s support, he also plants corn and beans, which allows him to earn better income.  José wishes to invest in materials to cultivate a greater amount of products, but what he is mostly concerned about is his bathroom, so he is requesting a loan from Fusai to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and a toilet to build his bathroom and keep his home sanitary.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and a toilet to build his bathroom and keep his home sanitary.

loans.name: Benedicto Arcadio

texts.es:
