Benedicto, de 26 años de edad, estudio octavo, pero tenía que  trabajar y estudiar y sentía duro hacer la dos cosas, opto por dedicarse a trabajar y dejar sus estudios ya que  su padre no podía darle el estadio, esta acompañado, padre de dos hijos, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, de él depende su conpañera de vida y sus dos hijos.

Benedicto, se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 7 años, el ayudaba a su padre en la agricultura pero luego aprendió a trabajar el oficio, lleva 4 años de trabajar en la siembra de maíz y frijol, de manera que  hoy en día siembra una manzana de frijol y una de maíz, tiene que caminar 20 minutos para trasladarse a lugar donde cultiva.

El Crédito será invertido en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, ya que así estará cuidando la milpa para que produzca buena cosecha.

El sueño de Benedicto es darles el estudio a sus hijos, prepararlos académicamente para así se conviertan en personas de bien, mejorar su calidad de vida y darles una vida digna a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Benedicto, 26 years old, studied through eighth grade, but he had to work and go to school and found it hard to do both.  He chose to work and quit school, since his father could not pay for his education.  He is in a relationship, father of two children. His partner is busy taking care of work at home; his life's companion and their two children depend on Benedicto for support.

Benedicto has worked as a bricklayer since age 7.  He helped his father in agricultural work, but then learned the duties of the profession.  He has worked for four years planting corn and beans, so that today he plants a manzana (about 2 acres) of beans and the same amount of corn.  Benedicto must walk for twenty minutes to get to the land he is farming.

The loan will be invested in buying compost and fertilizers for his crops, since that is how he will be taking care of the field to get a good harvest.

Benedict's dream is to provide an education for his children, to prepare them academically to be good people, to improve their quality of life, and give a worthy life to his children.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his field

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Luis de 23 años, su historia en el mundo de los negocios se remonta al año 2009, cuando decidió invertir sus ahorros en su propio negocio; adecuó en su vivienda un espacio  e instaló vitrinas, las cuales surtió con adornos, accesorios, detalles de para toda ocasión, así mismo compro un computador para ofrecer el servicio de navegación por internet  y equipos de telecomunicaciones para ofrecer el servicio de llamadas, fax, venta de recargas y planes de telefonía celular.  Día a día  trabaja a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m., un amplio horario para ofrecer sus productos y servicios a  sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y transeúntes del sector. Actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en incrementar sus inventarios pues está convencido que con una mayor oferta sus ventas se incrementarán y obtendrá mayores ingresos que le faciliten la ampliación del local y el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old, and his story in the world of business began in the year 2009, when he decided to invest his savings in his own business.  He prepared an area in his house, installing display cases, which he stocked with ornaments, fittings, and items for every occasion.  He also bought a computer to offer Internet services and telecommunication equipment to offer phone services, fax, sale of phone recharges and cell phone plans.

Day after day Luis works from 6AM until 9PM, a long workday, to offer his products and services to his neighbors, friends, acquaintances and those who pass by in the area.  At present he is taking out his first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, for resources to invest in increasing his inventory since he is sure that with more to offer, his sales will increase and he will obtain additional earnings that make it easier to enlarge the store and improve his residence.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Rashad's Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Rashad, he is the group leader. He is 33 years old, married with four children. He joined JWS's program in 2014.

He grows rice, wheat and vegetables in his farm land. With the crop management training he got from his local lender, he has been able to commercialize his farming business and is now able to get more profits out of it. He is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers for his rice crop. This will increase his income and hence be able to educate his children and provide for his family's needs. 

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their support and he promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Zulfiqar's Group

texts.en:
Zulfiqar is a resident of Khokhar Bhudo, a remote village in tehsil Kamonki, District Gujranwala. He is the sole bread earner of his family and he cultivates rice and wheat crops in his fields. He is the group leader and he is standing in the middle of the photo, holding a register.
He and his group members are poor farmers and they always struggle to finance their agricultural inputs in a timely manner. They are requesting a loan to purchase 30 sacks of fertilizer, 5 sacks of seeds and herbicides. This loan will increase their crop output. Group members are committed to be responsible borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Tariq's Group

texts.en:
Tariq is the leader of his group and he is raising his hand in photo. He is married with 9 family members. 

He has been farming and cultivating crops for 18 years. He grows rice and wheat in his farm. 

He plans to buy 16 sacks of fertilizer and 10 boxes of insecticide with this loan. He wants to use his profits to support his business. He also plans to take care of his family and to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in Kasese Uganda. He deals in MTN Mobile Money services that involves sending and receiving cash transactions on mobile phones. He gains additional income from selling coffee. He has been in business since 2013 and needs capital to boost his mobile money business. He is hardworking, but faces a challenge of inadequate capital. He has a dream of having many mobile money outlets to serve the increasing customer demands.

loans.use: to boost his mobile money business.

loans.name: Shoan

texts.en:
Shoan is 47 years old with four children.

Shoan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cigarettes, bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Shoan has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from fruit vending.

Shoan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cigarettes, bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 26 years old and has two children. Teresita is married and has one child in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresita has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 59 years old and widowed with three children. With one child in school, Segundina works very hard to provide for them.

Segundina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Segundina has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Segundina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam is a 45 years old man with 11 family members. He lives in a remote village in District Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is standing in this picture by raising his hand. He works in his fields to earn the family's living by cultivating rice, wheat and vegetables. 
He is using modern agriculture techniques to increase his Income. He has done soil testing, water testing & laser leveling in his field to increase his agriculture yield. He is requesting a loan to purchase agriculture inputs such as  quality seeds, fertilizer & pesticides for rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Ashraf Jan

texts.en: Ashraf Jan is 52 years old and married. She is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Her husband is an active person and by profession he is an expert chapati maker on the tandoori (The term tandoori refers to a variety of ovens, the most commonly known is a cylindrical clay oven used in cooking and baking). He owns a tandoori shop where he offers services for chapati baking to the people of his area. He is the only person responsible for meeting the needs of his family and managing the entire household. He wants to expand his business and therefore he needs to buy wood pieces for fuel in his tandoori. However, due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy the wood for his business needs. Therefore, Ashraf Jan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband will be able to enhance his business. Ashraf Jan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance .

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's tandoori business ( Chapati Making )

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. Ten years ago she started working as a hairdresser from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She worked hard throughout the years to gain her own clientele. She has a good reputation in her area for her professional skills.

Marwa is an ambitious lady who wants to develop her business. Through hard work she succeeded a year ago in moving her business from her house and opening her own beauty salon. Today she is acquiring a 2,500 USD loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to register her shop legally and to buy necessary beauty products.

Marwa hopes to expand her business in the future so as to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to register her shop legally and buy necessary beauty products.

loans.name: Marta Adilia

texts.es: Marta tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia al lado de su compañero de vida con quien día a día luchan para seguir adelante. Marta es una mujer emprendedora y capaz de realizar lo que se propone con el propósito de vivir cada vez mejor, gracias a la ayuda de un crédito anterior ella pudo comprar bloque de cemento y madera para así reconstruir las paredes de su casa las cuales estaban en malas condiciones, ella se dedica a realizar oficios varios pero los ingresos solo le alcanzan  para solventar los gastos del hogar es por ello que con el objetivo de seguir mejorando su hogar ella tomo la decisión de solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para poder encementar el piso de la casa ya que el que posee actualmente es de tierra, con el monto otorgado comprara: grava, arena y cemento.
texts.en: Marta is 56 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion with whom she fights day to day to get ahead. Maof rta is an enterprising woman  who is capable of a achieving what she sets out to do, with the goal of always improve her living standards. Thanks to the help of a previous loan, she was able to buy cement blocks and wood to rebuild the walls of her house, which were in very bad condition. She works at various trades but the income is only enough to pay for the household expenses. That is why in order to continue improving her home, she decided to ask for a new loan from FUSAI to put in a cement floor in her house because right now she has a dirt floor. With the amount she is asking for, she will buy gravel, sand and cement.

loans.use: to buy gravel, sand and cement.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya is a bright woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is single and lives with parents. She is a farmer. She has land where she plants vegetables and cereals. She has eight years of practice in this field. She is responsible, gentle and careful daughter. She is willing to treat her elderly father. She wants to see him healthy and able. She is asking financial support to treat her father in hospital. She awaits KIVA lenders kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to treat her elderly father in hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beers and spirits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Evaline operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 



With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a smallholder farmer and a resident of Harpoke village in Gujranwala District, Pakistan. He is the group leader holding a register in the photo. He is 34 years old with four family members. He mainly grows wheat, rice, vegetables in his land and sell the crop products to earn a income.

He mobilized a group of 3 farmers to join JWS for catering the financial needs. JWS teaches them the latest farming techniques so they can improve their yield by using quality seeds and fertilizer. Muhammad and his group members are requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs and tools to expand their farming business. This loan enables them to increase their yield and family income.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Josa

texts.en:
Josa, 31, has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past two years she has worked hard selling fish to earn a living in the Philippines.

Josa has applied for a 7,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. Her work is motivated by her wish to provide a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Las Rosas Y Un Clavel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS Y UN CLAVEL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sofia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de polleras, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de material escolar.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sofia es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a  Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pantalones por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS ROSAS Y UN CLAVEL” credit group will being its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Sofia is the president. The credit group's members' businesses are varied. Among them are: selling food, selling skirts, selling clothes, selling cosmetics, selling sports clothes and selling school supplies. 
	

The loan the will take out will benefit the micro business-women, including Sofia. She says that joined Pro Mujer  at the invitation of a consultant who is a part of the institution. Right now, she has a clothes selling business. She says that she learned this business several years on her own initiative. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital, by buying pants wholesale. She will acquire them from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later she will sell them in the markets of the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she is single and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy pants wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fingerlings for her fishpond.

loans.name: Alcira Matilde

texts.es: Alcira es una tradicional ama de casa dedicada al cuidado y educación de sus 2 hijos menores de edad. Hace ocho años decidió intentar iniciar su negocio, emprendiendo un proyecto desde el hogar con el propósito de generar ingresos para aportar a su familia.  Con un escaso capital  pero apoyada por sus hermanas, inició vendiendo ropa, calzado, cosméticos y demás artículos por encargo de sus clientes, posteriormente se vinculó como consultora de una empresa  distribuidora de productos por catálogos, actividad que ha logrado mantener a través del tiempo y que le genera un ingreso aceptable. Actualmente Alcira está aplicando a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en los productos que oferta el catálogo que promociona: ropa, calzado, colonias, cremas, perfumes y demás, para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. La meta de Alcira es lograr que los ingresos sean suficientes para brindar la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alcira is a traditional housewife.  She devotes herself to the care and education of her two minor children.  

Eight years ago she decided to try to start a business.  She undertook a project from her home in order to generate income to contribute to her family.  With scant capital, but supported by her sisters, she started selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and other items by customer orders.  Later she associated as a consultant with a company that distributes products by catalogs.  She has managed to sustain this business activity through time.  It generates an acceptable income for her.

Alcira is currently requesting her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to use the loan to buy the products that are on sale in the catalog; clothes, shoes, colognes, creams, perfumes, and others.  She will do this in order to increase her sales and to improve her earnings.  Alcira’s goal it to manage to earn enough to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy the products that are on sale in the catalog; clothes, shoes, colognes, creams, perfumes, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de jugos, aguas y gaseosas desde hace mas de 4 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: This young woman has her face pixelated because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has made a living selling for more than four years selling juices, water, and soda. Her business is located within her place of residence and she has many customers. She lives in her own own with her family unit. She requests a loan for the purchase of more products for adults to be able to better serve her customers' needs and have better income and better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: purchase more products: juices, water, and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have his car engine checked.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Sri, one of Ruma’s agents. Sri lives in Malang, a small area in East Java located about one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta by plane. Sri owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits. She is happily married and she and her husband have two cute children. She feels happy because since she joined Ruma, she can give more contribution to her community who need access to communication service.

As the business grows, Sri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sri improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. Sri's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Sri is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members her local community.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 38 years old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and has been running an auto rickshaw for the last twelve years. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of much use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Kalsoom has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business well. Kalsoom is so much thankful to Kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Armon

texts.en:
Armon is 26 years old; he is a single, hardworking man. He is requesting a school fees loan because to him, he finds it a challenge to pay the whole amount at once, but given an opportunity, he could pay in installments. 

He is in a higher level institution, it’s a private institution. He started his studies in 2013, and he plans to graduate in 2016.

loans.use: to pay school fees in installments.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Dainess, who is in her mid 50’s, is married with four children. One still in school and the three others are grown-up. She has been running a business of growing and selling chickens and she has cows for selling milk. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more chicks, chicken feed and bought cows for her milk business, and has repaid all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, bought a motorcycle, and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy 1000 chicks and chicken feed. She dreams of building another house. Dainess will share this loan with her loan group "WAEFESO," which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 1000 chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy adult chickens for resale, along with fabrics and clothing.

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es:
Juan un hombre con 27 años de edad, comenzó a trabajar desde niño con el fin de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, siempre dispuesto a trabajar, responsable y con espíritu emprendedor.

Día a día busca los medios para lograr cubrir sus necesidades por medio de una moto alquilada, es por esto que el busca un préstamo, con el cual anhela comprar su moto y prestar su servicio como moto-taxi.

Su mayor sueño es el de seguir trabajando para comprarse una vivienda y tener una vida sana y tranquila.

Sabe que gracias a la Corporación interactuar y a los colaboradores del portal kiva su sueño se cumplirá.
texts.en: Juan is a 27 year old man who started to work as a child in order to help his family to get ahead. He is always ready to work, responsible and has an enterprising spirit. Day by day he searches for the means to pay for his necessities by working on a rented motorcycle. For this reason he is looking for a loan with which he hopes to buy his motorcycle to work offering his services as a motorcycle taxi. His big dream is to continue to work so he can buy a house and have a quiet and healthy life. He knows that thanks to Corporación Interactuar and the lenders from Kiva he can achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to work as a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a variety of sewing materials for her stitching work

loans.name: Eugenio Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel un hombre con disposición para trabajar, que se gana  la vida con la preparación y venta de alimentos, con su empeño y dedicación logra pagar los gastos de su hogar y para el sostenimiento de la educación de sus hijos. 

Pide un apoyo económico con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de una estufa industrial, un cilindro, un paraguas y demás materia prima que su negocio necesite.
Esto le permitirá consolidar y aumentar su negocio en gran medida.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una vivienda para su familia, de esta forma poderles brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Aporte al sueño de este micro-empresario, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man with willingness to work, who earns a living through the preparation and sale of foods. With his determination and dedication, he is able to pay for his household costs and for the continued education of his children.

He is requesting economic support from Corporación Interactuar for the purchase of an industrial stove, a barbecue, an umbrella, and other raw materials that his business needs. This will allow him to consolidate and increase his business a great deal. 

His biggest dream is to purchase a home for his family, in order to give them a better quality of life. Support the dream of this microentrepreneur; make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial stove, a barbecue, an umbrella, and other raw materials that his business needs.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, Amavi est une femme mariée. Amavi est mère d’un enfant et habite dans le quartier de Bè. Amavi vend des friperies dans son quartier et réalise un revenu grâce à son activité pour aider son enfant. Amavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des friperies, Amavi demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire
texts.en:
Aged 41, Amavi is a married woman and a mother of one child. She lives in the area of Be. 

Amavi sells used clothing in her area and earns a living thanks to this business, which helps her children.

She procures her stock once a month at the market.

She is seeking this loan to order more used clothing, [which will help her] attain her goals and earn a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 400 [pieces of] used clothing

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Veuve, Yawa est une femme qui vit à Avédji avec sept enfants à sa charge. Agée de 47 ans, Yawa vend des gâteaux en parcourant son quartier pour gagner son revenu. Yawa réalise une bonne rentabilité et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois à la boulangerie. Yawa nécessite ce crédit pour commander des bassines de gateaux à vendre afin de maximiser son bénéfice et soutenir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: A widow, Yawa is a woman living in Avédji with seven children in her care. Aged 47, Yawa sells cakes to earn her livelihood, going on foot around her neighborhood. She makes a good profit and she stocks up four times a month at the bakery. Yawa needs this loan to order some basins of cakes to sell so as to maximize her profit and support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seven basins of cakes to resell on foot in her neighborhood

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca de 50 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa propia  junto así hijo de 12 años. Ella trabaja en la elaboración de oficios varios en un lugar cercano a su vivienda, y gracias a su esfuerzo y desempeño es como ella lleva a diario el pan de cada día hasta su hogar. Blanca con el propósito de realizar un par de mejoras en su lugar de residencia a tomado la decidió de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para de esta forma poder cambiar el techo de una pequeña galera el cual se encuentra deteriorado  y además desea encementar el piso del corredor el cual actualmente es de tierra, para ello con el crédito solicitado invertirá en la compra de: grava, cemento, lámina y la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Blanca is 50 years old. She is a single mother and lives in a house that she owns with her 12-year-old son. Blanca works doing different jobs near her home. Thanks to her hard-work and perseverance, this work allows Blanca to bring home her daily bread. 

With a view to carrying out a couple of improvements to her home, Blanca has decided to applying for a loan from FUSAI. She can thereby replace the roof of her small hall, which has deteriorated in quality. Blanca also wants to cement the floor of the corridor in her house, which is currently just earth. Hilda will use this loan in order to buy gravel, cement, and metal sheeting, and to pay labourers.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, and metal sheeting, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Caesar Iii

texts.en:
Caesar III is 28 years old and single from Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

He owns a water refilling business alongside their school for nursery and kindergarten. He is in this business for five years, and he supplies distilled water within Plaridel and neighboring towns like Calamba and Lopez Jaena. 

He signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC not only for the financial assistance it extends but also for other benefits he can get, like insurance. 

Recently, he availed a loan of 50,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional gallons and materials for his water refilling business so that he can cater to more customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons and materials for his water refilling business

loans.name: Loma Chiquita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Loma Chiquita se reunía anteriormente en una comunidad en donde se podía admirar una pequeña loma que ofrecía una panorámica magnífica cuando los primeros rayos del sol iluminaban el horizonte. De ahí deviene el nombre del grupo; además el lugar es muy tranquilo y las personas son muy amables, la mayoría se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la cría de animales.
   Doña Catalina es un ejemplo de trabajo arduo, toda su vida se ha dedicado a consolidar un mejor futuro para sus seres queridos. Su familia la compone Aurelio, su esposo, y cuatro hijos los cuales ya no dependen de la pareja.
    Desde hace 20 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de dulces debido a que la mayoría de sus familiares son comerciantes. "Fueron mis padres que desde muy pequeña me motivaban a emprender un negocio estable de donde obtener ingresos seguros" recordó Catalina.
   Para iniciar dicho negocio tuvo que hacer uso de los ahorros obtenidos gracias a la cría y venta de animales como borregos, pollos, pavos, etc. En un inicio solo contaba con una pequeña mesa al exterior de su casa y una lona que la cubría del sol y la lluvia. Posteriormente el negocio creció y ahora tiene un local estable donde ofrece una amplia variedad de duces y algunas botanas.
   Esta vez solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder reinvertir en más dulces y mantener un surtido extenso. Catalina obtiene mejores ganancias cuando celebran fiestas infantiles cerca de su comunidad, o bien, en diciembre cuando las tradicionales piñatas se rellenan de diversas golosinas. Catalina está muy agradecida con cada préstamo pues sin ellos su negocio no hubiera crecido tanto y no hubiera brindado estudios a todos sus hijos. Por ahora su única meta es mantener su negocio y hacerlo crecer.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Isidra quien invertirá en dulces y refrescos además de Don José y María de la Luz quienes invertirán en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de Don José, Doña Catalina es quien viste el suéter café con naranja.
texts.en:
The Loma Chiquita (Little Hill) group used to meet in a community where you could admire a small hill that offered a magnificent panoramic view where the first rays of sunlight illuminated the horizon. This is where the name of the group came from. Additionally, the area is very calm, and the people are very friendly. Most people are dedicated to growing corn and to raising animals. 

Catalina is an example of hard work. All of her life, she has been dedicated to making a better future for her loved ones. Her family includes Aurelio, her husband, and four children, who no longer depend on their parents. 

Twenty years ago, she decided to dedicate herself to making sweets, since most of her relatives are merchants. She remembers that her parents, since she was very young, motivated her to start a stable business, from which she could earn a secure income. 

To start this business, she had to use her savings from raising and selling animals, such as sheep, chickens, turkeys, etc. In the beginning, she only had a small table outside her house and a tarp that covered her from the sun and rain. Later, the business grew, and now she has a stable store where she offers a wide variety of sweets and some snacks. 

Now, she requests a new loan to be able to invest in more sweets and maintain an extensive supply. Catalina earns a lot when children’s parties are celebrated in her community, as well as in December when the traditional piñatas are full of different candies. Catalina is very thankful for every loan, because without they, her business wouldn’t have grown as much and she wouldn’t have been able to offer educations to her children. For now, her only goal is to maintain her business and have it grow. 

The other members of the group are Isidra, who will invest in sweets and beverages, and Don José and María de la Luz, who will invest in a small grocery store. 

* The photograph was taken in Don José’s store. Catalina is in the brown and orange sweater.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Charles Darwin is 18 years old and is the second of five children in the family. His mother Arlene is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and supports the family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

Charles Darwin is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Marine Transportation and is currently in the third of this three-year course.

Arlene is borrowing PHP 19,625 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When he graduates, Charles Darwin plans to help his parents to earn additional income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
La cría de aves esta representado para este empresario llamado Francisco un sustento para su familia, la presión de mantener sus 3 hijos de 3, 7 y 13, y a su pareja, lo llevo a tomar una decisión que cambio su vida, empezar su negocio de cría de aves.

Ahora trabaja por una meta la cual es pagar la educación de sus pequeños, no quiere que tengan que vivir su vida, busca que progresen y se conviertan en todos unos profesionales.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de alimento de aves y comprará un cerdo para vender carne por libras.
texts.en:
The noise of birds represents sustenance for his family to this entrepreneur called Francisco. At 40 years of age he had no work and found himself somewhat desperate and powerless at the situation he was in. The pressure to provide for his three children aged 3, 7 and 13 and his partner, seeing them begging food, led him to the decision that changed his life.

He started his business raising poultry. Now he works to achieve a goal which is to pay for the education of his young children. He doesn't want them to live their lives looking for a way to progress and wants all of them to become professionals. He wants to request a loan to buy chicken feed and he will buy a pig to sell the meat by the pound.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and buy a pig to sell the meat.

loans.name: Dina Evelin

texts.es:
Dina, de 34 años de edad, está casada, estudio hasta bachillerato, su esposo se dedica a manejar vehículos y hacer viajes, no tienen hijos, pero ella está embarazada.

Dina, tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad y tiene más de 2 años de tenerla, la tienda está a una distancia de 3 kilómetros y en el negocio se involucra su esposo.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar más productos para surtir la tienda, con está ayuda ella podrá suplir las necesidades de sus clientes y mejorará sus ganancias.

El sueño de Dina, es tener una tienda más grande y mejorar su calidad de vida .
texts.en:
Dina, 34, is married and has a high school education and her husband is a driver who travels.  They have no children yet but she is expecting.

Dina runs a store where she sells basic staple goods and she has been in business for two years.  The store is three kilometers away and her husband helps out in the business.

She is in need of a loan to buy more goods for the store in order to meet customer demand and increase earnings.

Dina's goal is to have a larger store and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store.

loans.name: Amizaday Yohan

texts.es:
Amizaday es un hombre con 28 años de edad, que trabaja en un pequeño negocio de café-bar cercano a su casa, de allí es donde el logra obtener los ingresos mínimos para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

Actualmente Amizaday no cuenta con mucho surtido, por esto solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara cervezas, gaseosas, snack y demás productos de la canasta familiar, con esto espera mejorar sus ingresos.

Su sueño es el de seguir trabajando, en un futuro cercano expandir su negocio, comprarse una vivienda propia y poder pagarles la educación a sus hijos.

Aporta para que estos sueños se cumplan, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Amizaday is a man of 28 who has a small café-bar business near his home. This is how he manages to obtain the minimal income for covering his household needs.

Currently, Amizaday does not have much stock to sell. This is why he is requesting a loan with which he will buy beer, soft drinks, snacks and other household items. With this he hopes to improve his income.

His dream is to keep working and in the near future expand his store so that he can buy his own house and be able to pay for the education of his children.

Please contribute to fulfilling these dreams and make a loan.

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, snacks and other household items.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: Claudia, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Claudia trabajó varios años en una maquila y luego quedó sin trabajo y decidió  poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa como ser camisas, blusas, faldas, pantalones y otros. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años y vende de forma ambulante. ha decidido solicitar un prestamo para comprar mas ropa como camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas etc. para continuar vendiendo y obtener ganancias para su familia. Su idea es mantener siempre inventario para vender y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Claudia is 37 years old. She is s single mother who has three children and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Claudia worked for several years in a factory and then was left without employment. So she decided to open her own business selling clothing such as shirts, blouses skirts, pants and others. She has had the business for three years and sells itinerantly.

She has decided to request a loan to buy more clothing like shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, etc. to continue selling and making income for her family. Her idea is to keep up her inventory in order to sell and grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, etc to sell.

loans.name: Sadrad

texts.es: El señor Sadrad nació en el municipio de Matiguas en el año de 1983, a los 7 años de edad empezó a estudiar su primaria en la escuela Rolando Orozco, luego empezó a estudiar la secundaria en esta misma escuela y estudio hasta tercer año, luego los padres se trasladaron a vivir a un lugar llamado Pancasan, pero comenta que no quizo seguir estudiando y se dedico mejor a trabajar en un terreno que compro el padre, en este lugar Sadrad vivió hasta los 27 años. Sadrad tiene unos familiares en una comunidad llamada las vegas y el los visitaba de vez en cuando, así conoció a la que ahora es su esposa y procrearon un hijo que ya tiene 3 años de edad, actualmente Sadrad vive en las vegas y se dedica a sembrar granos básicos y se dedica a cuidar y ordeñar sus vacas que tiene con su señora. Comenta Sadrad que Dios lo ha bendecido ya que le dio su familia y trabaja en su propio trabajo. En esta comunidad de las vegas no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar y poder alumbrarse por las noches y vivir un poco mejor con su familia, él se sentiría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Sadrad was born in the municipality of Matiguas in 1983.  When he was 7 he began school in the Rolando Orozco elementary school.  Later he studied at the secondary level in the same school system, and he completed 3 years at that level.  After that, he moved with his parents to live in a place called Pancasan, but he comments that he did not want to continue to study, and so it was better that he devote his time working the land that his father bought.  Here, Sadrad lived until he was 27 years old.  He has some relatives in a community called Las Vegas, and he used to visit them from time to time.  This is how he got to know his spouse.  Together they have a son who is already 3 years old.  

Now Sadrad lives in Las Vegas, and he works cultivating staple grains and caring for and milking the cows that he owns with his wife.  Sadrad comments that God has blessed him by giving him a family and work on his own farm.  

In the community of Las Vegas, there is no electricity.  This is why Sadrad is requesting a loan to buy a solar system so that he can have light at night and live a bit better with his family.  Sadrad would be very grateful if you could provide him with the opportunity of a loan to buy a solar system.

loans.use: to buy an 80 watt solar system with 5 lights installed

loans.name: Girasoles De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GIRASOLES DE SENKATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yhovana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de zapatos, venta de comida, venta de fresco de linaza, servicio de fotocopiadora.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yhovana es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer  por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra poleras y chompas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre  y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de 
Salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Girasoles de Senkata” will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Branch.  It is made up of eight members and it is led by a Board of Directors of which Senora Yhovana is the President.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank are involved in are varied.  Among them are the sale of clothing, the sale of cosmetics, shoe sales, food sales, sale of linseed juice and photocopy services. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small business owners such as Yhovana. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer on the invitation of an adviser who is part of the institution.  She currently has a business selling clothing.  She says that she learned this business from her sister-in-law several years ago on her own initiative.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital (to buy shirts and sweaters wholesale) that she will get from the vendors in the city of La Paz and later will sell in her place of business.  This form of work permits her to generate economic resources to support her family since she lives in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and shirts wholesale

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
A senhora  Aida  mãe solteira de 01 filho já maior sustenta seu irmão que vive  com ela e que a estudarem e sustenta 03 netas órfãos que vivem  com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com este credito irá comprar cimento, varões, chapas e pedra. 
Diz que seu sonho é continuar a ampliar a casa a sua casa com mais 2 quartos, terminar a  obra, mobilar .
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos  e que com os créditos anteriores conseguiu fazer sua casa pois antes vivia numa casa de construção precária .
texts.en:
Aida is the single mother of an adult son. She supports her brother who lives with her and studies. She also supports three orphaned granddaughters who live with her in a house that she owns.
She states that with this loan she'll purchase cement, rods, metal plates and rocks.
Aida states that her dream is to continue to enlarge her house with two additional rooms. She also dreams of finishing the construction work and furnish the house.
She states that her biggest challenge is the lack of funds. She also states that with the previous loans she was able to build her house, since she used to live in a house that was poorly built.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, metal plates and rocks.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 47 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Madelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Madelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Madelyn has been in this business for 28 years. 

In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en: This loan of $800 will allow Faustino to send his youngest daughter  to post-secondary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition and school supplies. Faustino loves his daughter very much and hopes that further education will help his daughter to have a brighter future. He is happy with this loan because it helps him send his daughter to school for the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and school supplies.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 53-year-old married woman. Her husband uses his talents to sew clothing, make products, and earn a good income to provide a good life for his lovely wife.

Sahar wants to help her husband in his work and decided to be a part of his business so that she will become able to help her husband, Abd Al Hameed, in his work.  She wants to be a a productive woman.

She took a loan to expand and develop the sewing shop that her husband was running alone; then took many classes to learn how to sew,  design, and work in the shop.

She runs the shop with her husband and they design and sew dresses and clothing. Their business is working well.  Sahar is an ambitious woman and wants to develop the business and buy more sewing machine, fabric, and yarn.  She needs money to do that and applied for another loan to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to develop their business and buy more sewing machine, fabric, and yarn.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 52 years old and has seven children. Lucena is married and has two children who are still in school.

Lucena is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucena has been in pig fattening for 17 years now.

In the future, Lucena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 25-year-old married mother of one child. Five years ago, she started working as a tutor from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family.
 
Today, Khadija is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her son's school tuition fees, who is now in the first year of the kindergarten. Khadija believes that education is the only way to guarantee her son's future.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her son's kindergarten tuition fees

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 28-year-old married mother of one child who sells accessories and clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her family. She has a good reputation among her customers for she is a hard worker and ambitious woman. 

Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with a new collection of summer accessories and clothes to satisfy her customers requests. 

Khadija hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of summer accessories and clothes

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo is a hardworking woman and was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in village with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a constructor, who builds and renovates houses, while she does business in agriculture. Recently she has two calves and two livestock. She has many years of practice doing business. 

She has a dream to educate her daughter at a higher educational institute. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for herstudies. She hopes her daughter would get higher degree and work for social change. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for her studies

loans.name: Ulmashon

texts.en:
Ulmashon is a hardworking woman who was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is capable, responsible, gentle and honest person. She is divorced and has one child and is a teacher at a secondary school. She is well known and repeated client at IMON. 

She has a good loan story. Her eyes are not seeing, by the way she works to ensure her family. She needs to treat her eyes first. She appealed to IMON and KIVA to get a loan to pay for the treatment of her eyes at a medical clinic. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay the treatment of her eyes at medical clinic

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and has eight children. Nancy is married and has four children who are in school.

Nancy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nancy has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Custodia

texts.es: Custodia es una emprendedora de 56 años de edad que con esfuerzo y completa dedicación ha prosperado en su negocio  y ha ofrecido bienestar a su familia.  Ella inició ayudando en el negocio de peluquería de su hermana, de quien aprendió el oficio que posteriormente perfeccionó mediante  cursos de belleza que hoy le permiten ofrecer a sus clientes el servicio de manicure, pedicure, corte de cabello, blower, aplicación de queratina, tintes y demás tratamientos capilares, actividad que combina con la venta de productos cosméticos, ropa en general y artículos para el hogar. Ella ofrece sus servicios y productos desde su casa y a domicilio. Actualmente Custodia  está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en artículos de peluquería, para surtir su sala de belleza y en productos como ropa, y artículos para el hogar. Esta inversión no solo le ayudará a contribuir mejor a la economía de su casa, sino que también obtendrá realización personal y será un apoyo para que su hijo menor pueda convertirse en un profesional.
texts.en:
Custodia is a 56-year-old entrepreneur, who with effort and total dedication has prospered in her business and provided well-being for her family. She started by helping in her sister's hair salon, from whom she learned the occupation that she later perfected through beauty courses that today allow her to offer her customers manicures, pedicures, hair cuts, blow-drying, hair-straightening, dyeing and other capillary treatments. She combines this activity with selling cosmetic products, clothing in general, and items for the home.

She offers her services and products from her home. Currently Custodia is applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she intends to invest in hair products for stocking her beauty salon, and in products such as clothing and articles for the home.

This investment will not only help her to better contribute to the household finances, but she will also obtain a sense of personal fulfillment and be able to help her son become a professional.

loans.use: To stock her beauty salon and to buy products such as clothing and items for the home.

loans.name: Genny Gabriela

texts.es:
Genny es una joven trabajadora, tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo Oscar de 25 años, y sus dos hijos la primera tiene 7 años y asiste a la escuela fiscal, el segundo tiene 4 años. Su esposo por el momento no trabaja ya que sufrió un accidente y tiene su pie enyesado. En su hogar existe un buen ambiente familiar, existe mucha comunicación con entre todos.
Genny se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace 4 años, aprendió sobre este negocio de su abuelita. Ella compra chanchos pequeños, los cría y luego los tiene listos para venderlos. Los compradores van a su domicilio para realizar la compra. A Genny le gusta la crianza de chanchos, y dedica su tiempo  para mantenerlos bien alimentados, invierte en balanceado y afrechillo para tenerlos en buen estado y  así cuando los compradores visiten su domicilio puedan llevarse sus chanchos complacidamente.
Vive en la Merced de Cobuendo, que pertenece a San Antonio, en la zona las personas se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, lo más sobresaliente en este sector es la venta del “cuy asado” que es un plato típico bastante demandado por turistas locales y nacionales que visitan la zona en su mayoría en fines de semana y feriados. 
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de más chanchos y en el arreglo de la chanchera, para mejorar sus ventas y además tener mayor seguridad con sus chancheras en buen estado.Genny agradece a KIVA por el apoyo y la confianza depositada en ella.
texts.en:
Genny, 25, is a hardworking young woman.  She lives with her husband Oscar, 25, and her two children; the first is 7 years old and attends the district school, and the second is four years old.  At the moment, her husband is not working because he had an accident, and his foot is in a cast.  There is a good family atmosphere in her home, and there is a lot of good communication among everyone. 

Genny has been engaged in raising pigs for four years, and she learned about this business from her grandmother.  She buys small pigs, raises them, and then gets them ready to sell.   The customers come to her home to make their purchases.  Genny enjoys raising pigs, and spends her time keeping them well-fed.  She invests in balanced feed and bran so they will be in good condition and thus, when buyers come to her home, they can be satisfied with the pigs they are buying.  

Genny lives in Merced de Cobuendo, which belongs to San Antonio.  The people in this area are engaged in farming and raising animals, but the highlight of this area is the sale of “roasted guinea pig”, a typical dish frequently demanded by local and national tourists that visit the area most weekends and holidays.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more pigs and in restoring the pens to good condition.  Genny is grateful to Kiva for the support and confidence have placed in her.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and restore their pens and, in this way, support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.pt:
A senhora  Carlota é  mãe solteira de 05 filhos a estudarem e sustenta 03 netas órfãos que vivem  com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com este credito irá comprar cimento, varões, chapas, pedra, para fazer uma dependência para seus filhos uma vez que actualmente a casa onde vive só tem um quarto e todos dormem no mesmo sítio . 
Diz que seu sonho é continuar a ampliar a casa a sua casa com mais 2 quartos, terminar a  obra, mobilar .
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los faz pequenas poupanças e  diz que irá solicitar mais créditos .
texts.en:
Carlota is a single mother of five children who are in school. She also supports three orphaned granddaughters who live with her in a house that she owns.
She states that with this loan she'll purchase cement, rods, metal plates and rocks so that she can build an additional room for her children. This is due to the fact that the house currently has only one bedroom and they all sleep in the same room.
Carlota states that her dream is to continue to enlarge her house with two additional rooms, finish the construction work and furnish the house.
She states that her biggest challenge is the lack of funds. She makes small savings in order to overcome that. She states that she'll apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, metal plates and rocks.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1984 and is living with her family. She is married and has two children. She is a teacher by her specialty. In 2007 she graduated higher education with excellence. Now, she is working at secondary school where she teaches English to her students. 

She is asking a loan to pay her daughter’s schooling. She is willing to enter her daughter to primary school. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s schooling

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is the age of 27; she is mother of one son and two daughters and living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well. 

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Nazia requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Nazia  thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. for her husband's general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the repairing costs of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: 219 Lechuguita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LECHUGUITA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño y tunta, venta de frutas, venta de verduras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de edredones, venta de cosméticos, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta tunta y chuño; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tunta por mayor) que adquirirá de las comunidades y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The Communal bank “LECHUGUITA” will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Hub of Senkata. It is comprised by eight members and directed by a board where Felipa is president. The businesses of the members of this communal bank are varied. Among them are: sale of chuño and freeze-dried potatoes, sale of fruits, sale of vegetables, sale of food, grocery store, sale of of comforters, sale of cosmetics, sale of potatoes. The loan they will get will benefit the small businesswomen, where Felipa is a member. She indicates that she entered Pro Mujer after being invited by a counsellor who is part of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling freeze-dried potatoes and chuño. She expresses that she learned this business from her parents many years ago. The loan she will now get is to increase capital (to buy freeze-dried potatoes at wholesale prices) which she will purchase from the communities and later sell in her place of sale. This type of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she is married and has two children. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy freeze-dried potatoes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ofélia

texts.pt:
A senhora  Ofélia é viúva e mãe  de 06 filhos dos quais dois ainda menores e que frequentam o ensino primário e  quatro já maiores de idade,  ela  tem 49 anos de idade é operária agrícola, vive na casa própria, sustenta seus pais enviando lhes dinheiro.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, varões, chapas, barrotes, para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa. 
Diz que seu sonho é terminar a sua obra, mobilar fazer uma mini mercearia na sua casa onde podera vender produtos de 1a necessidade reforçando assim a renda familiar.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los faz pequenas poupanças e tem machambas onde produz para o sustento familiar diz que irá solicitar mais créditos .Diz ainda que a casa que hoje tem é resultado dos empréstimos com a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ofélia is a widow and has six children. Two of her children are still underage and in primary school, and four are already adults. She's a 49-year-old farmer and lives in a house that she owns. She supports her parents by sending them money.
She states that with this loan she'll purchase cement, rods, metal plates, and beams so she can continue building her house.
Ofélia states that her dream is to finish the construction work and furnish her house. She also dreams of setting up a small grocery store at her house where she can sell household staples and therefore improve her family's income.
She states that her biggest challenge is the lack of funds. In order to overcome that, she makes small savings and owns farms where she grows produce to support her family. She states that she will apply for more loans and that her current home is a result of her loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, metal plates, and beams.

loans.name: Lilufa

texts.en:
Lilufa, 26 years old, is an active married lady in the village of Sahispara in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She comes from a poor family. Her family includes her husband, two daughters and one son. Her two children attend the village primary school and the other one is a toddler. Lilufa, in her young age, attended two years of primary school and her husband is illiterate.

The main source of income for Lilufa's family is from a Toto rickshaw transportation service (Toto is an auto rickshaw operated by battery). Her husband has been doing this work for two years. Her husband is running the Toto in the nearest town of Kandi. He works for 10 hours a day and earns a very low income. With this scanty income, Lilufa faces difficulties managing her family expenses, maintaining the Toto and paying the tuition fees for her children.

According to Lilufa, she has a dream of purchasing two more Totos to rent to others for additional income, but her present income is so hand-to-mouth that she can not even think of the future. To earn some more income, she and her husband decided to buy another Toto. Therefore, Lilufa wants to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for developing their existing enterprises. Lilufa will use this loan to purchase a new Toto rickshaw by adding the loan to her small savings. After purchasing the new rickshaw, she will hire out the old Toto rickshaw. This will help her to generate extra income and she will be able to complete the construction of her semi-concrete house and give her children a better education.

Lilufa will be ever grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a 'Toto' (a battery-operated auto rickshaw).

loans.name: Beja

texts.en:
Beja is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a butcher shop business for the past 10 years, selling goat meat at the market. He faces a major challenge of transportation in his business.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Donia

texts.en:
Donia is a 48-year-old divorced mother of two children. In order to provide her two kids with good living conditions, she decided a few months ago to start her own business of selling clothes from her house. She is working hard to cover her children's expenses and needs. 

Donia is an ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Donia hopes to expand her business more in the future and open her own clothing shop to increase her income and stay capable of providing her kids with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers' special requests

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 40-year-old married father of seven children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. 

Twenty years ago he started working in agriculture to cover his family's needs and expenses. He has a long experience in this domain, for his parents work in agriculture too. Mohammad has a good reputation within his region. He is an ambitious man who succeeded through his hard working to build three shops and start renting them as a second source of income. 

Today, Mohammad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary fertilizers and seeds for the new agricultural season. 

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary fertilizers and seeds for the new agricultural season

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en: Elizabeth, who is in her early 30s, is married with three kids who are still in school. She has been running a general store for 10 years. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Elizabeth's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her general store inventory. She dreams of finishing her house and paying the school fees for her kids. Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group "Wazo Tegeta," which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her general store inventory.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 61 years old, married, and has five children. To earn a living and be able to provide for his family's needs, with the help of his wife as a businesswoman, he engaged in a candy-making business. He makes candies and sells them in the market. He aims to increase his income, so he decided to request a loan to buy more ingredients for candies. This will help him make more candies and and sell them in the market, generating more income.

Arsenio's plan for the future is to invest in other businesses with his business income.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for candy making.

location.town: Proper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 22-year-old single man from Khan Younis City, in the Gaza Strip. This is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He lives with his family in a small house. Nidal works a salesman and gets a low income. 

He wants to improve himself and be an independent entrepreneur, so he thought of starting his business idea to sell goods from his rickshaw. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy inventory and then resell it from his rickshaw in the local market. He hopes that by taking this loan, he will be able to improve his family's conditions. Nidal appears in the photo.


Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade.  Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult-to-reach places.

loans.use: to buy inventory and then resell it from his rickshaw in the local market.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is 44 years old, married, and has one child to provide for. She engaged in a fish-vending business to earn a living, with the help of her husband as a fisherman. She aims for a better income so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more fish to sell, so that she can sell more fish in the market and be able to generate a better income.

Dolorosa's plan for the future is to save money from her business income.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y maíz desde hace 41 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 65 years old.  He lives in his own home with his family.  He has worked growing staple foods and corn for 41 years.  When his harvest is ready he sells it in different markets that are found near his house.  

Thanks to his work he has been able to move forward.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides etc. and thus be able to have better economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides etc.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer is 52 years old and married with three children who are still in school. He has been running a gengeduka (shop) since 1998. He works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Amer's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock the missing items in his genge (fruit & vegetable stall) and opened the shop to make a gengeduka. He is doing fine. He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the fast-turnover items in his gengeduka and pay rent. He dreams of expanding his business. He will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast-turnover items in his gengeduka (shop) and pay rent.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en: Shabnam is a generous young girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a capable, responsible, careful, and hardworking daughter. She works at a bank and is a loan expert. Her mother is ill and needs doctors' help. She is willing to treat her mother in the hospital, but she does not have money to pay for service and medicines. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for a loan to treat her mother in the hospital. She is hoping to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to get hospital care for her mother

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Abella

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Abella works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Abella is borrowing 15,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in the market for her meat vending business.

Abella has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a father of four children, two of whom attend school. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a cocoa plantation where he gets income to earn a living and to support his family. 

He is a hardworking and determined man who sells and also buys more cocoa to sell to his customers. He has operated for six years now, though he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to finance his business. 

He has decided to ask for a loan so as to boost his business by buying cocoa beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans for selling.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is a 27-year-old, married man from Dier Al-Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip, which has had an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. He lives with his family in a small, old house.

Kamil also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products. Kamil took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. With this loan, Kamil can buy more cold soft drinks for his store to resell, which is popular because Gaza can get very hot!

Kamil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
From Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, Aileen, 47 years old, is busy with her three enterprises: a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells usual commodities, a coin-operated internet café called Piso Net that provides affordable internet for short time users, and a scrap business. She doesn’t stop thinking about the possible ways of how to enhance her businesses. She aspires that in due time her variety store will grow into a grocery that will also sell school supplies. 

For now, she focuses on her scrap business because it helps many individual scavengers and it contributes a lot to the recycling process in their city. She applied for PHP 20,000 supplementary capital that she will use partly to buy scrap and partly to procure more supplies for her store. Additional income that will be derived from this loan will augment their daily expenditures and tuition fee of her children who are studying in college and high school.
