She and her husband Renato, a driver, exert their best efforts to achieve their dream of completing their children’s education. They also plan to renovate their house soon. 

Aileen is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to recycle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 6 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, harina de arroz, quesillo, frijoles, chicharrón, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area. She has worked selling “pupusas” [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] for 6 years.  Her business is located in her place of residence.  The young woman lives in her own home with her family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, rice flour, fresh cheese, beans, pork rind etc. and thus be able to have better economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice flour, fresh cheese, beans, pork rind etc.

loans.name: Denis Ulice

texts.es: Denis de 22 años de edad es un joven que  vive con su grupo familiar  conformado por sus padres y sus hermanos. Denis es un joven que debido a las necesidades de su hogar se vio desde muy temprana edad a laborar para de esta forma poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, el se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa distribuidora de repuestos para bicicleta, y durante este tiempo ha sido su soporte de ingresos económicos. Denis es un muchacho visionario que con el deseo de ver su casa cada día mas bonita a decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder darle seguimiento a la construcción de su casa ya que anteriormente comenzó la obra pero debido a la situación económica no logro terminarla, con el monto otorgado el comprara: hierro, cemento, ladrillo para piso, etc.  para  continuar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Denis is 22 years old. He is a young man, who lives with his family, which includes his parents and siblings. Denis is a young man, who—because of his household’s needs—was very young when he started working. In this way, he could help his parents with the household expenses. He offers his services in a business that distributes spare parts for bicycles, and at this time, it has been his source of income. 

Denis is a visionary young man, who wants to see his home become more beautiful everyday. He decided to request a loan from FUSAI to complete construction on his house. Previously, he started the work, but because of financial issues, he didn’t finish it. With the amount given, he will buy iron, cement, brick for the ground, etc. to continue construction on his house.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, brick for the ground, etc. to continue construction on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as sugar, butter, wheat and other things

loans.name: Neza

texts.en:
Neza of Davao City dreams that her variety store will develop into a grocery with complete stock someday and that her boarding house will become units of apartment for rent. For now she can only offer a small boarding house and sell few quantities of usual commodities like toiletries, snack items, canned goods, and beverages. Sometimes she grills pork and chicken barbecue in front of her store to augment her income.

Unlike a grocery store where customers instantly pay in cash or through credit card, a community store like Neza’s has many debtors. Most of Neza’s debtors are her boarders. They request later payment for store items, barbecue, and boarding house rental. At times, they just flee, leaving behind their debts. This bad habit of some boarders minimizes her capital. Now she wants to avail additional capital amounting to 50,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) that she can use to improve her business. She will renovate her boarding house and procure more stock for her variety store. She’s hoping that it will lead to a higher profit that can sustain the everyday needs and educational expenses of her children with Brian, her live-in partner.

Personally, she wishes that they will get married in the near future, and she would be happy to see their children enjoying a better career after finishing their college educations. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her boarding house

loans.name: Hajati

texts.en: Hajati is a 52-year-old single woman with four children, living in Masindi, Uganda. She  has a restaurant as her major business and also has houses which she rents out to tenants. She is very hardworking and hopes to educate her children. She is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan, which helped her to buy drinks and a refrigerator to improve on her business. She is requesting a loan to buy drinks and foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ana Felicia

texts.es: Ana de 48 años, luego de perder su último empleo a causa de la quiebra de la empresa para la que laboraba, decidió invertir sus ahorros en su propio negocio; comercialización de prendas de vestir y calzado, actividad que combina con el negocio de restaurante y elaboración de pasabocas para fiestas, productos que vende a  amigos, familiares y vecinos. En su negocio ha logrado un sustento económico digno para su familia y le ha permitido ayudar a su hija para cubrir los gastos de sus estudios. Actualmente está aplicando para su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  el cual planea invertir en la compra de un enfriador y en insumos para el restaurante: maíz, aceite, pollo, carne de res, y demás víveres e incrementar sus inventarios de ropa y calzado para aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades. Ella tiene como meta poder organizar su restaurante en un local independiente de su casa y seguir los ingresos suficientes para que su hija pueda terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old. After losing her last job because the company she worked for went bankrupt, she decided to invest her savings in her own business. She sells clothing and shoes, which is work that she combines with her restaurant business. She makes snacks for parties and products to sell to friends, family, and neighbors. 

In her business, she has achieved a good income for her family, and this has allowed her to help her daughter in paying for school. 

At present, she is requesting her first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she plans to invest in buying a cooler and supplies for the restaurant, including corn, oil, chicken, beef, and other supplies. She will also increase her inventory of clothing and shoes to increase her sales and profits.

She has a goal of having her restaurant be in a location separate from her house. She wants to continue having enough income so that her daughter can finish her university degree.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and supplies for the restaurant (corn, oil, chicken, beef, and other supplies) and to increase her inventory of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mazloom

texts.en:
Mazloom is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. One of her sons is shown in the photo.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years along with her daughter. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors, and packs of zippers and button. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors, and packs of zippers and buttons, to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Julia Rubidia

texts.es: Doña Julia de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un tienda y una tortillería desde hace 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, leche, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y así poder tener mejore ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Julia is 57 years old. She lives in her own house with her family. She has had a store and a tortilla shop for three years. Her business is located in her home, and she has many clients, especially neighbors. With her earnings, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, milk, eggs, sweets, drinks, etc. Thus, she will be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, milk, eggs, sweets, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lalhonim

texts.en: Lalhonim is a brave woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1961. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a constructor. She is a farmer. She has done business in agriculture for almost 15 years. She plants vegetables, cereal and cultivates her land by herself. She got ill. She hopes to be healthy quickly because needs to look after her harvest. She appealed to IMON asking for a loan to pay for treatment at a medical clinic. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay for treatment at a medical clinic

loans.name: Afsana

texts.en:
Afsana is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been in the tailoring business for many years to support her husband (also shown in the photo). She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, and packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Afsana hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, and packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces to meet the orders on time

loans.name: Luciano

texts.pt:
Tem 44 anos de idade, estudou ate 9ª classe do antigo sistema e teve oportunidade de se formar em gestão em Noruega, vive na casa própria com uma esposa que ainda não teve filhos com ela, é separado dum primeiro casamento onde teve 3 filhos, todos com acesso a educação, trabalha em regime contratual e é sócio e fundador de uma empresa e controle de qualidade nas desminagens e conta com ajuda da esposa negociante. Esta a tomar o credito pela primeira vez para investir na compra e venda de produtos em sua casa.
Pretende comprar: açúcar, arroz, óleo, peixe, sardinhas, caldos, cebola, omo, sabão, bolachas, etc, para aumentar o seu stock.
Seu sonho é construir uma residência convencional e comprar uma viatura.
O facto de trabalhar sob regime contratual, tem sido o seu desafio, dado que as vezes fica parado sem trabalho.
texts.en:
Luciano is 44 years old. He completed the 9th grade of the old educational system and he had the chance to get a degree in management in Norway. He lives with his wife in a house that he owns. He and his wife don't have children yet but Luciano has three children from his first marriage, all of whom are in school. He works as a contractor and he's one of the founding partners of a company that provides quality control in mine clearance. He gets help from his entrepreneur wife. This is his first loan and it's for him to invest in buying and selling merchandise from home.
He intends to purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, fish, sardines, broths, onions, laundry detergent, soap, crackers, etc., so he can stock up.
Luciano's dream is to build a conventional house and buy a vehicle.
The fact that he's a contractor has been a challenge for him, because sometimes he's left without work.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, fish, sardines, broths, onions, laundry detergent, soap and crackers.

loans.name: Nilza

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu irmão que se encontra em casa da sua mãe.
 Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: blocos, barrotes, cimento, areia e pedrinhas. Para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência. 
Futuramente pretende ser uma empreendedora e concluir a sua obra de residência. O seu maior desafio é dar continuidade com os seus estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Nilza comes from Maputo. She's 32 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three underage children and she's responsible for her brother who lives with their mother.
This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. With it she intends to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, beams, cement, sand, and gravel so that she can continue building her house.
In the future she intends to become an entrepreneur and finish building her house. Her biggest challenge is keeping up her studies until she graduates from college.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, beams, cement, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Gonolve

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Malema província da Nampula tem 34 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2012. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, blocos, barrotes e mais, para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência. 
Futuramente pretende dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
O seu maior desafio é dar continuidade com os seus estudos
texts.en:
Gonolve comes from Malema, province of Nampula. She's 34 years old and single. She has two underage children who are in school and she's not responsible for anyone else.
She started to work with Hluvuku in 2012. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. With it she intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, bricks, beams, etc., so that she can continue building her house.
In the future Gonolve intends to continue building her house and provide her children with an education all the way to college.
Her biggest challenge is keeping up with her studies.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, beams, etc., so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Micha Ella is 17 years old and is the first of four children in the family. Her mother Elenita supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Micha Ella is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Agricultural Education and is currently in the second of this four-year course.

Elenita is borrowing 4,850 PHP to pay tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Micha Ella plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: N20Qhưng-Young Women Learn To Do Business Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai is 28 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling clothes for five years. Mai lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and her this job is unstable. The main hardship that Mai faces is the lack of capital.

In 2009, Mai joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. All members agreed to vote her to be the group leader of "N20QHưng-Young Women Learn To Do Business" group. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna, who is 36 years old, is married with four children. She has been running a beauty salon and making liquid soap for six years now. She works from 9 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Anna's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the salon stock with up-to-date products and made more liquid soaps. Anna has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit from her business to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy new salon products such as Raster and hair cosmetics. She dreams of improving her business as well as expanding her business. Anna will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new salon products such as Raster and hair cosmetics

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. Sixteen years ago, she started working raising cattle to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary forage for her cows which will help her increase their production.

Afaf hopes to expand her business more in the future by buying more cows to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the necessary forage for her cows to increase their production.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt:
A senhora Verónica de 62 anos de idade é pensionista casada, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 03 a estudar 1 já maior e na sua casa, sustenta 02 enteados que vivem com ele na casa própria em conatrucao.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar cimento, pedra, areia, varões para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa e um jogo de sofás aumentado as garantias para os próximos empréstimos.
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, tornar se um criador de porcos para abate e venda e continuar a melhorar a produção na sua machamba.
Diz que a insuficiência de fundos para superá-los, faz pequenas poupanças e com os anteriores empréstimos fez a sua actual casa e inicou a criação de cabritos diz que ira solicitar mais crédito.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 62-year-old pensioner. She's married and has four children, three of whom are in school and one is already an adult who has their own house. She supports two stepchildren who live with her in a house that she owns and is under construction.
She states that with this loan she'll purchase cement, rocks, sand and rods so that she can continue building her house. She'll also purchase a set of sofas. This loan will help to ensure her next loans.
Verónica's dream is to finish the construction work and start raising pigs for slaughtering and selling. She also wishes to keep on increasing production in her farm.
She states that she lacks funds and in order to overcome that she makes small savings. With the previous loans she built her current home and started raising baby goats. She states that she'll apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks, sand, rods, and a set of sofas.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Maria de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la ventas y elaboración de comida desde hace 33 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollo,carne, granos básicos,verduras, refrescos etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria, who is 60 years old, lives in her own home with her family. She works in the preparation and sale of food for 33 years. Her business is located in a highly frequented area close to her home, which is why she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of chicken, beef, basic grains, vegetable, sodas, etc. so she can continue working, and by doing so, have a better quality of life alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, basic grains, vegetables, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 53-year-old widow with eight children, living in Masindi, Uganda. She deals in furniture making and she hopes to educate her children using the proceeds from this business. She is a hardworking woman but she is challenged by inadequate capital to look after her big family since she is the only breadwinner and high taxes are imposed on timber dealers. She is requesting a loan to buy timber for making furniture to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Noshi

texts.en:
Noshi is 34 years old and a married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She has three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Noshi expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 36 years old and has seven children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Lorna is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en: Costance is a forty-year-old married woman with two children, living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a bar business alongside a clothing shop as her major business and source of income. She is a hardworking woman but is affected by inadequate capital as she hopes to educate her children using the proceeds from her business and building a permanent home. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia, 28 years old, is a married lady with two children. She is shown in the photo with her husband who has been successfully running a small general store. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. For the improvement of her husband's business, Rabia has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand to make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Hondogo Kibamba Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 31 years old and is married, with two of her own sons who are at school. She manages a poultry business, raising 600 chickens per batch. She also raises laying chickens. She is really a busy mother, working from 6am to 6pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, paid back successfully, to buy sacks of chicken feed and vaccines. Her chickens are doing fine and she has a plan to add another batch. She will invest her new credit in buying 600 chicks for her poultry business. Beatrice dreams to be rich with 1000 chickens.

She will share this loan with her group, Hondogo Kibamba, consisting of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 600 chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 43 years old, married and has three children. She manages a retail store for income. She sells noodles, sardines, shampoo, soaps and eggs. Her spouse also manages a welding shop. She hopes for her business to progress and that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to invest in her store. She will buy more stock of grocery items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, bread and soap. She hopes to continue improving her sales for her children's education purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is a diligent woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in a small city with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an emigrant. It is her first time crediting at IMON. She is a responsible, goal oriented and honest person. She has done business for about a year. She is a tailor. She sews traditional Tajik dresses for women. She likes her activity and has permanent clients. She is sick now. She needs to be treated. She doesn't have money to pay for medical service and medicines. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for a loan to be treated at a hospital. She awaits your compassion and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric mill, a heated display case, and a set of tables with chairs in order to organize her point of sale.

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas is 45 years old and married with three children, two of whom are attending school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Cleophas operates a retail shop as his main business, and farming and rentals as side income businesses. He does these businesses for his family's welfare.  He dreams of building a residential dream house. Cleophas is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like bricks, wires, sand and others for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, wires, sand and others for his house construction.

loans.name: Franklin Antonio

texts.es:
Desde los 15 años de edad, Franklin trabaja en la industria camionera, pues era ayudante de un chofer, quien también fue su instructor de manejar y su profesor hasta que decidió abrir sus propias alas y volar por el este mundo de forma independiente, comprando un camión con los ahorros de su arduo trabajo. A sus 33 años de edad, es padre soltero de un adolescente de doce años de edad, quien es su mayor motivación para salir adelante. Ahora se convirtió en comprador y vendedor de materiales de construcción que utiliza con su camión que con tanto orgullo enseña. 
La casa de Franklin está llena de materiales de construcción, sin embargo, hay uno en específico que es atrae a varios compradores, por ende necesita comprar. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar piedras canteras, puesto que está es la principal venta que le genera grandes ingresos. Con esta inversión, podrá tener este material a disposición para sus clientes y obtener ingresos para la educación y alimentación de su pequeño hogar. En sus planes está comprar un camión para aumentar su trabajo.
texts.en:
From the age of 15, Franklin has worked in the trucking industry, since he was the assistant to a driver, who also was his driving instructor and his teacher until he decided to spread his own wings and fly through this world in an independent way, buying a truck with the savings from his hard work. At the age of 33, he is the single father of an adolescent of 12, who is his great motivation to get ahead. Now he has become a buyer and seller of construction materials, for which he uses his truck, which he shows with such pride.

Franklin's house is full of construction materials. Nevertheless, there is one specifically that is attractive to various buyers and he thus needs to buy. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to buy quarry stone, since this is the principal sale that generates good income for him. With this investment, he will be able to have this material on hand for his customers and obtain income for the education and nourishment of his little household. Among his plans is buying a truck to expand his work.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr: Soungalo  est un  membre du groupe  Benkan, il est celui qui tient la corne du bœuf  dans la photo, gentil avec les enfants. Il fait  l’embouche bovine, âgé de 37 ans, il habite au Mali  et père de 6 enfants, ses enfants sont âgés de 2 ans  à 13 ans dont(2) deux fréquentent l’école, son épouse   est une ménagère. Il  exerce ce métier il y a 7 ans, il s‘approvisionne et vend ses animaux aux marchés de sa localité. Il sollicite un prêt  subséquent    pour  accroitre ses activités d’embouche, il lui  servira à  l’auto suffisante de la famille: santé, école, nourriture. Il rêve   d’être autonome et être utile pour la communauté.
texts.en:
Soungalo is a member of the group Benkan. He is the one holding the cattle’s horn in the photo. Kind with children, he raises cattle, is 37 years old, lives in Mali, and is the father of six children, aged 2 to 13, of whom two are attending school. His wife is a homemaker. Soungalo has been working in this trade for seven years. He gets his supplies from the markets in his town and makes his sales there too. 

He is requesting a subsequent loan to grow his business of livestock farming. The loan will be used for his family’s self-sufficiency in healthcare, schooling, and food. His dream is to be autonomous and useful to his community.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell later

loans.name: Sarvelio De Jesus

texts.es: Sarvelio de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 25 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas etc. y continuar con sus cultivos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sarvelio, 48, lives in his own house with his wife.  He has been making a living for 25 years from planting corn and he sells his products in the different markets that are found near his house.  With the sales he makes, he is able to cover some of the household expenses.
He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc, and to continue with his crops in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: G.s. Viña Del Señor Group

texts.es:
El g.s. la viña del señor está conformada por cuatro integrantes tres mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres de familia, responsables de diez hijos, todos originarios  Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar, y dedicaron a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, en la actualidad, luchan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias, todos tiene diferentes actividades económicas y se apoyan entre si ya que es su medio de sacar adelante  a sus familias.
Gracias  a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Odili y tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería como: ropa, camisas, faldas, vestidos, shores, monos, ropa interior, ropa de cama, camisetas, faldas, ropa de niño, body, perfumes, etc. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Y tiene diez años de dedicarse a dicha actividad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de mercadería para  surtir, y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. G.S Viña del Señor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The group G.S. Viña del Señor is made up of four members: three women and one man who are mothers and fathers responsible for ten children. They are all from Carazo, a place that is located in the northern area of the region. The group is characterized as being hard working, responsible, and having a desire for personal achievement. Unfortunately they were unable to go to school and dedicated themselves to working in order to help with the household expenses. Now, they struggle day to day to support their families. They all have different businesses and they support each other within the group since that is their way of providing for their families.

The coordinator is Odili, thanks to her desire to succeed. Her business is selling merchandise like: clothes, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts, toys, underwear, sleepwear, t-shirts, skirts, children's clothing, body lotions, perfumes, etc. Her business is located in her home and she has made a living in this business for ten years. The objective of the loan is to invest in the work capital, stock her business with the purchase of merchandise, and satisfy the demand of her customers.

G.S. Viña del Señor appreciates the help that the Kiva investors have provided to persons with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like: pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, jeans, dresses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Ajesta

texts.en: Ajesta is a mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. Two of them are in school and two are still small children. She is in her early 40s. She works selling beer, soda, water and spirits. She has been in this business for seven years. Ajesta sells from 8 am to 8 pm and is able to make a good profit each month. She is requesting her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has really seen the loan impact because she retained more customers after replenishing her grocery with more drinks. She is so thankful for Kiva's support. Ajesta used the previous loans, since repaid, to improve her business (she bought more drinks). She earned extra income, which she used to cover school fees and part of her home food expenses. She is now requesting another loan, which she will use to replenish her stock of beer, sodas and water to resell. Her desire is to own her house. Ajesta will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her stock of beer, sodas and water to resell.

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Rukia, in her late 30s, is married and a mother of three sons who are at school. She supports her family by running a business. She buy chickens, fries them and sells them from morning to 11 p.m. daily. Rukia is able to make a good profit each month. She is so happy with Kiva's support and she believes her business will grow more with it. Rukia is so thankful for everyone who supports her group. Rukia has been in this business for 10 years.

This will be Rukia's ninth loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, which she repaid successfully, to buy chickens for her business. Rukia earned a profit, which she used to build a house and to cover part of school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, Rukia would like to raise her own chickens instead of buying, and become better off in life. She will use her new loan to buy chickens to be fried and sold.

Rukia and the other Sheraton group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens to be fried and sold.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Florencia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 2,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: N8Tđiềnqnham-Poor But Funny Group

texts.en:
Vận lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has worked in agriculture, raising livestock, for seven years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Vận faces is lack of capital. In 2011, Vận joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Vận has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is a reputable person in the community. All members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "N8TĐiềnQNham-Poor But Funny" group.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Along with her business profit, Vận hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for cakes such as wheat flour, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Shella Mae is 21 years old and is the fourth of five children in the family. Her mother, Helen, supports the family through her fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Shella Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Elementary Education and is currently in the fourth of this four-year course.

Helen is borrowing 5,750 PHP to pay tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Shella Mae plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Rose is in her early 40s, married and has one son and two daughters who are at school. She runs a business, with charcoal being her first business selling 30 bags. She now wants to expand and start a poultry activity to raise 200 broilers. Rose has been in the first business for five years, and starts working from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good profit.

This is her fifth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to raise her stock from 10 bags to the current 30 bags of charcoal. She managed to pay back the previous loans successfully. Rose earned a small profit which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. She dreams to be successful in her business. 

She will use this credit to buy 200 chicks and a few bags of charcoal to resell. Rose will share this loan with her group,Karafuu, two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks and a few bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Rwambano Group

texts.en:
Neema is a businesswoman and mother of one schooling kid. She is aged in her late 20s. She has been running a poultry business for three years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Neema's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy poultry equipment for feeding chicks and bought more chicks and chicken feeds. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, started building her house and covered household expenses. She is happy with the loan. 

She will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds for her poultry business. She dreams of finishing her house. Neema will share this loan with her loan group, "Rwambano," which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds for her poultry business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lourdes is 50 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lourdes has a nipa-making business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks.

Lourdes has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves and bamboo sticks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and has four children. Elizabeth is married, and one of her children is in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and currently working with the local government as a nursing officer. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with her three children. She runs a drugstore in Bundibugyo town to supplement her salary. She started the business using her savings. She has managed to meet her school fee costs for three years with Hofokam school fees loans. Her major challenge is balancing studies, work and supervision for her drugstore.

Caroline has asked for a loan to restock her drugstore with drugs to sell.

loans.use: to restock her drugstore with drugs to sell.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is 38 years old, married and has one child to provide for. To earn a living, he is engaged in a piggery business with the help of his wife as a teacher in providing for his one child. As a father, he always wants the best for his family. That's why he decided to borrow a loan to buy feed for his pigs so that he can produce a good quality of pigs and be able to deliver more pigs to the market to sell.

Rolly plans in the future to save money to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Inspired by her dream of completing her children’s education, Rizalina, from Caloocan City, is working really hard to improve her canteen or food stall business. She wants peaceful and sufficient living conditions for her family. But the income derived from her canteen varies from time to time. It is affected by the school schedule and presence of students to whom she usually caters. The past school vacation became unfavorable for her because a large portion of her customers, the students, were not there to patronize her canteen.

Now she aspires to regain her loss in time for the opening of classes. This season brings greater demand for her business and this means higher income for her and her family. To attain this, she needs additional capital of PHP 20,000 to purchase more ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and condiments. She can cook more recipes and viands that are enticing to her customers.

Rizalina’s source of inspiration is her husband, Eduardo, and their children. She also draws encouragement from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share life stories and Bible reflections.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, seasonings and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a widowed woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagros is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Milagros has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for six years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Tania Bismara

texts.es:
Tania es una mujer muy emprendedora, se ha abierto paso en la vida trabajando duro, ella vende cosméticos y otros productos de belleza de forma ambulante. Su familia es su principal apoyo, ellos son los que la alientan para que luche por sus sueños día a día. Poco a poco ha logrado abastecerse de nuevos productos para ofrecer a su clientela. 
En estos momentos Tania ha vuelto a recurrir a la ayuda de Kiva y MiCrédito, para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita invertir en productos y comprar ropa, sandalias, zapatos, accesorios y cosméticos. Más adelante y siempre contando con el apoyo de financiamientos, planea abrir un tienda para no tener que vender de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Tania is a very enterprising woman. She has opened doors in life by working hard. Tania sells cosmetics and other beauty products as a street vendor. Tania's family is her biggest support. They encourage her to continue fighting for her dreams every day. Little by little, Tania has stocked up on new products to sell to her customers.

Now Tania has returned to request the help of Kiva and MiCredito: she wants a loan that will allow her to invest in products and to buy clothes sandals, shoes, accessories and cosmetics. In the future, with the support of loans, Tania plans to open a shop so that she does not have to work as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy clothes sandals, shoes, accessories and cosmetics.

loans.name: Comoro Group

texts.en: Sharifa is 41 years old, married and has three schooling kids. She has had a genge selling fruits and vegetables for four years. Her business is still new. She prefers this business because it is easier to manage, realizes a good profit and at the same time, she is able to care for her family. Sharifa works from 5 am to 6 pm every working day and is able to make a good return per month. This is her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to improve her business with a new stock of fruits and vegetables that are in demand. She will buy fruits and vegetables to resell in her genge. In the coming days, she would like her business to be of good appearance (managing her big stock). Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group "Comoro", which totals two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy  fruits and vegetables to resell in her genge.

loans.name: Silvia Yessenia

texts.es: Silvia de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de flores naturales y artificiales desde hace 4 años su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de flores por mayor para poder una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Silvia, 37, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her two children.  She sells natural and artificial flowers for a living and has been in business for four years in the municipal market.

She is requesting a new loan to buy flowers wholesale to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: To buy flowers wholesale.

loans.name: Yorley María

texts.es: Yorley de 32 años, desde niña quiso ser propietaria de un restaurante,ella encaminó todos sus esfuerzos a lograrlo y para ello se capacitó en culinaria.  Pese a no contar con un capital lo suficientemente amplio para iniciar su negocio, ella logro conseguir unos recursos que le permitieron vencer los obstáculos y cumplir con su objetivo.  Hoy en día en su restaurante cuenta con tres años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada, que no la cambian por nada, pues sus deliciosos platillos de excelente calidad y a precios asequibles son su premisa de servicio.  En pro de mejorar el aspecto de su negocio decidió hacer una solicitud de crédito y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para realizar adecuaciones locativas y mejorar su imagen empresaria e invertirá en víveres para la preparación de las comidas.  Su meta a futuro es tener una cadena de restaurantes y así poderles ofrecer bienestar a sus dos hijos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Yorley is 32 years old and wanted to own a restaurant since she was a girl. She put in all her efforts in order to achieve this. To do so, she did culinary training. Although she did not have enough capital to open her business, Yorley managed to find the resources that allowed her to overcome resources and achieve her goal. 

Today, the restaurant has been running for three years and has loyal customers. With delicious, quality meals at affordable prices, the customers are not going anywhere. In order to improve her business, Yorley has decided to apply for a Kiva loan, her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Yorley will use this loan in order to carry out work to improve her business' premises and to improve the business's image. Yorley will also invest in supplies to prepare meals.

Yorley's goal for the future is to have a chain of restaurants and to be able to offer well-being to her two children, both under the age of 18.

loans.use: to carry out work to improve her business' premises and to improve the business's image.

loans.name: Mercedes De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes es una mujer muy audaz, toda su vida ha trabajado y sido independiente. Con el apoyo de su madre y de su pareja, ha logrado dirigir dos negocios diferentes al mismo tiempo, ella vende comida  mientras que al mismo tiempo vende mercadería como cosméticos, perfumes, sandalias, entre otros. Ella ha logrado crecer como comercianta, mejorar la infraestructura de su local y comenzar a ahorrar. 
Ahora ella solicita un financiamiento de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para invertir en su negocio de comida y comprar granos básicos, aceite, carnes, entre otros, dada que sus clientes cada vez son más y por lo tanto demandan más. En un futuro planea poder abrir un restaurante y distribuir productos de belleza a distintas tiendas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a very courageous woman who has worked all her life independently.  With the support of her mother and partner she has been able to manage two different businesses at the same time.  She sells food and also sells merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, sandals and other articles.  She has been able to grow as a merchant and improve the infrastructure of her stall, while starting to save.

Now she is requesting a Kiva loan through MiCredito to invest in her food business and to buy basic grains, oils, meats and other goods.  This is because the number of customers is every increasing creating more demand.

In the future she plans to open a restaurant and distribute beauty products to different stores.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, oil, meats, and other goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy snacks such as potato chips, cheese balls, sodas and sweets.

loans.name: Maria Emelinda

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee un comedor desde hace 21 años ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos de los casos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de carnes, pollo, granos básicos, verduras, refrescos, pescado, entre otros ingredientes por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old. She lives in a privately-owned house with her husband and son. María has had a restaurant for 21 years. Located in a place with many passers-by, María uses the profits to cover some household costs. 

María is applying for a loan in order to buy meat, chicken, basic grains, vegetables, soft drinks, fish and other ingredients in bulk. She can thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, basic grains, vegetables, soft drinks, fish and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 35 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Leonarda es una mujer dedicada a su labor pero principalmente al bienestar de su familia por la que lucha a diario para que no les falte nada en el hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos  de belleza para hombres, mujeres y niños por catalogo tales como: perfumes, cremas para la piel entre otros los cuales ofrece a sus vecinos y a las personas que viven en las comunidades de los alrededores. Leonarda con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de productos de los clientes que día con día aumentan a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para poder adquirir una mayor cantidad y variedad de productos y de esta manera aumentar las ventas y las ganancias, con el monto solicitado piensa invertir en la compra de: perfumes, cosméticos, tintes para cabello, cremas para la piel,  etc. para la venta de su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 35 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her partner and two children. Leonarda is dedicated to her work but, more importantly, to her family's well-being. She works hard every day so that they do not need for anything in the home. 

Leonarda makes a living selling men's and women's beauty products from catalogues. She sells perfumes, skin creams and more to her neighbours and those living in surrounding communities. 

So as to fulfill customer demand for product - which is increasing every day - Leondarda has decided to applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy a higher quantity and wider variety of products. She can thus increase sales and profits. Leonarda is planning to use this loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, hair dyes, skins creams and more to sell at her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, hair dyes, skins creams and more to sell at her business.

loans.name: Melvin Geovanny

texts.es: Melvin tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad quien este año ha comenzado sus estudios. Melvin es albañil y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Él es un hombre muy trabajador quien hace todo lo que está en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Melvin ya anteriormente obtuvo un crédito para construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda y  se encuentra muy feliz y agradecido por el hecho de ahora ya contar con su servicio sanitario, el cual ha cubierto de plástico debido a que el monto otorgado no le fue suficiente para poder levantar las paredes y el techo. Por lo anterior solicita este nuevo  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra del material necesario como: arena, cemento, polines, ladrillo y lámina para poder construir las paredes y techo de su servicio sanitario y brindar una mayor higiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Melvin, 31, lives in his own house with his life partner and their five-year-old daughter who has started school this year.  Melvin earns a living as a bricklayer to support the household.  He is a very hard-working man who does all he can to give his family the best living conditions.

Melvin received a previous loan to build a septic tank in his house and he is very happy and grateful to have sanitary service now.  But for now it is covered with plastic because the loan was not enough to put up walls and a roof.

Therefore he is requesting a new loan through FUSAI to buy materials such as sand, cement, beams, bricks and metal sheeting to build walls and a roof over the toilet to improve hygiene for the family.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement, beams, bricks and metal sheeting to build walls and a roof for the bathroom.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María cristina  de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, casada con  tres hijos, dos mayores y un hijo menor el cual está estudiando y tiene diez años , es originaria de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En la actualidad luchan día día para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica de venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace nueve años que tiene dicho negocio, y lo tiene ubicado en un lugar especifico  de la localidad, en el cual persevera día a día para hacerlo más productivo a pesar que uno de los desafíos es cuando llega el invierno ya que su tramo no tiene techo y moje junto con sus productos,  pero nunca ha sido impedimento para salir adelante. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar frutas y verduras como; papas, plátanos, piña, melón, melocotón, sandia, naranjas, cálala etc. Para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María Cristina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina, 44, is married and has three children: two adults and a minor son who is ten years old and attends school.  She is from Carazo which is located in the northern part of the country.  Known as a hard-working, responsible person, she has a desire to improve her situation.  Day after day she struggles to provide for her family and give them the best opportunities in life.

Thanks to her determination to get ahead she works selling fruits and vegetables and has been in business for nine years.  Her stall is set up in a specific place in her town and she perseveres every day to be more productive despite the challenges she faces in the winter.  Her stall has no protection so the products get wet, but this has not stopped her from prospering.

The loan will be used as work capital to buy fruit and vegetables such as potatoes, bananas, pineapple, melon, peaches, watermelon, oranges, maracuya, etc.  This is to attend to customer demand and increase her income in the near future.

Maria Cristina is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting people with low incomes in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have decent work.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables such as potatoes, bananas, pineapple, melon, peaches, watermelon, oranges, maracuya, etc.

loans.name: Joaquin Antonio

texts.es: Joaquín de 25 años de edad vive junto a su esposa con quien tiene un hijo de 5 meses de edad. Joaquín es un joven muy responsable que a diario desde muy tempranas horas se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés en su comunidad y sus alrededores, además con la intención de obtener mayores ingresos dos veces por semana el se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado central de su municipio. Joaquín con el deseo de adquirir mayores ingresos y brindar a su familia una mejor condición de vida quiere iniciase como aserrador por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar una motosierra para serrar  y luego vender la madera con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Joaquín who is 25 years old lives with his wife. They have a five month old son. Joaquín is a very responsible young man. He gets up very early every day and sells sweet breads and baguettes in his community and its surroundings. In order to increase his income he also has a business selling fish in the town's central market. He does this twice a week. Joaquín wants to increase his income so that he can provide a better standard of living for his family. He wants to start out as a sawyer and so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy a chainsaw to cut wood. He will then sell the wood to  increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw to cut wood.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 22-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social conditions of Palestinians in Lebanon, he opened his own motorcycle repair shop to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man who has professional skills in this domain for he gained experience from his father long ago. 

Adham is working hard to develop his business and improve his living conditions inside the camp; thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start building his own house. This loan is very important to Adham for it will help him feel independent and safe and start thinking about his future.
 
Adham hopes to expand his business more in the future and open a motorcycle accessories shop to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to start building his own house.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Víctor   joven ecuatoriano de 21 años de edad, nació en la parroquia Pastocalle de la ciudad de Latacunga en una zona rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi vive en casa de los padres, terminó sus estudios primarios con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio de ellos, y al no poder  seguir dándole para que siga estudiando Víctor tuvo que buscar primeramente trabajo y ahora está estudiando a distancia.
Actualmente trabaja como ayudante en una plantación, desde hace algún tiempo atrás, hoy en día tienen un gran sueño el de que su negocio crezca, el  mismo que se trata de la crianza y venta de pollos de campo, su mayor obstáculo en la vida ha sido que por su corta edad nunca le han podido dar un crédito para fortalecer su pequeño negocio, es por eso que con este crédito comprará alimento para los pollitos e incrementar la producción.
Además a Víctor le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto.  Hace llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal ya que con el dinero que le financiemos podrá cumplir con uno de sus mayores sueños.
texts.en:
Victor, a 21-year-old Ecuadorian, was born in the parish of Pastocalle in the city of Latacunga in a rural area of the province of Cotopaxi. 

He lives with his parents. Thanks to their great efforts and sacrifices he finished his primary education. When they could not support his education further, Victor had to look for a job first and is now taking a correspondence course.

At the moment his is working as an assistant on a plantation, where he has been working for some time. 

Today, he has a big dream: to grow his own business. He raises and sells field chickens. The biggest obstacle in his life has been that, because of his young age, they were never able to grant him any loans to strengthen his small business. This is why with this loan he will buy fodder for the chickens and increase his production.

In the future, Victor would also like to buy a vehicle, which would allow him to reach more customers demanding his product. 

He gives warm and heartfelt thanks to Kiva for making it possible for him to grow in his personal and working life. With this money he will be able to reach one of his biggest goals.

loans.use: to invest in his business buy purchasing fodder and fulfilling his dream of growing as a micro entrepreneur.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 33-year-old married man from Khan Younis City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade, in place since 2007. He is married and lives with his wife in a small house. Rami works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. 

He wants to improve himself and be an independent entrepreneur, so three years ago he thought of starting his business of transporting goods in rickshaws. 

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive because of the economic blockade. They became even more appealing following the assault in the summer of 2014 with the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult-to-reach places.   

Now Rami is thinking of replacing the old rickshaw with a new one. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw. He hopes that by taking this loan, he will be able to improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is a 42-year-old Ugandan man married to Margret. They have four children together, ages 17, 14, 11, and 9, and they all attend school.

Wilber is a farmer. He has banana plantations but he also has other sources of income like trade in livestock, especially goats.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 from Ugafode to buy goats for sale and also organic fertilizers to spread in his banana plantation.

His dream for the future is to acquire more land and a tractor for farming activities, but he says he faces challenges of bad weather and lack of enough income.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell and fertilizer for his plantation.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is a patient woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is divorced and has one child. 

She has five years experience working at catering. She is a cleaning woman at catering. 

She is sick now. She needs treatment in order to be healthy and continue working to feed her family. She requested a loan to be treated at a medical clinic. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: To be treated at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene su casa propia, pero hay áreas de su vivienda que requiere algunas mejoras debido al deterioro que ha sufrido a través de los años . Con $250 comprará materiales para colocar el cielo raso de su casa, así como las baldosas de la sala principal entre otros arreglos. De esta manera se garantiza una vivienda digna para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia has her own home. Parts of the house are in a state of deterioration that's taken place through the years, and need improvement.

With $250 she will buy materials to replace the ceiling, as well as the floor tiles in the living room, among other repairs. She will in this way make sure to have an adequate house for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the improvement of her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 64 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como lechones, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto María espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old, married, and lives with her husband in a rural area in the district of Cayalti, located in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. The population of this district primarily makes a living in agriculture, cattle raising, and trade.

Maria is earning a living by raising and selling smaller animals like pigs, hens, ducks, turkeys, and so on. Her business is situated around her own house. She has 10 years of experience in this business and a good reputation in the area - personally and work-related.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a bigger amount of animals like piglets, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and so on, and also to buy balanced fodder for them.

With this, Maria expects to offer her customers a better product, which will help her to generate a higher income and as a result increase her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals as well as fodder for them.

loans.name: Jubeth

texts.en:
Jubeth is 46 years old and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Jubeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jubeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Jubeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Doris Edilia

texts.es: Doña Doris se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y a la elaboración y venta de artesanías. Solicita un préstamo de $500 con el cual comprará algunos productos naturales para aumentar su inventario , así como materiales para la confección de artesanías. Ella pretende aumentar su clientela con este crédito .
texts.en:
Doris is earning a living by selling natural products and by making and selling art.

She is requesting a loan of 500 dollars, with which she will buy some natural products to increase her stock and buy material for making art.

She intends to make more customers with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase natural products for selling and materials to make art.

loans.name: Remigio

texts.pt:
O senhor Remígio de 50 anos de idade é pensionista e pescador casado pai de 05 filhos  a estudar, sustenta 01 sobrinho que é órfão de pai e mãe que vivem com ele na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito irá comprar fibras, rezina, redes, boias, e fios para pesca.
O seu sonho é ampliar a sua casa, adquirir uma motorizada ou viatura para usar na sua actividade de venda de produtos pesqueiros nos mercados.
Diz que a insuficiência de fundos para superá-los , faz pequenas poupanças e que com os empréstimos anteriores conseguiu adquirir todos os bens que atualmente são usados como garantia para aquisição de empréstimos diz que ira solicitar mais crédito .
texts.en:
Remígio is 50 years old and lives on a pension while also earning money by fishing. He is married and has five children, all of whom are in school, and he also cares for one of his nephews who is an orphan and who lives with him.

With this loan, Remígio will buy nets, buoys, resin, fiber, and thread to help with his fishing. His dream is to add on to his house and to buy a vehicle of some sort that he can use to help him sell his fish at market. He says his main challenge has been a lack of funds but he has saved small amounts and with earlier loans he was able to acquire the goods that he can now use in order to guarantee future loans. He also says he would like to take out more loans in the future.

loans.use: buy nets, buoys, resin, fibers, and thread.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela  is a 31-year-old married woman (shown in this photo with her husband). She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from a city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Shakeela has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors to boost her business earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors to boost her business earnings

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
When the business of selling used clothes started in the Philippines, common vendors had no permanent space to sell their products. They just piled the used clothes on the floor on top of a mat. Sometimes, they had a folding table where they scattered the clothes. Customers would literally dig under the pile to get their preferred clothes. The word "dig" translates to “hukay” in Filipino. This is where the term “ukay-ukay” was coined. From then on, the business of selling used clothes in the Philippines was called “ukay-ukay”. These days, the business has leveled up and used clothes are arranged in hangers in some permanent establishments. 

Arlene, from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur, is selling used clothes at the town’s public market. She offers jeans, trousers, shorts, shirts, blouses, shoes, and household items like bed sheets, blankets, and comforters. Now she would like to add a greater selection of hot items to entice buyers. She is requesting 15,000 PHP additional capital for this purpose. Your generous support will surely help her increase her profit, sustain her family’s daily needs, and boost her savings. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of ukay-ukay in the near future. 

Arlene is married to Johnny, who is a businessman. They have children. They are doing everything to provide for their children’s needs and education. She is also a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a greater selection of used clothes for selling

loans.name: Jomaira Estefania

texts.es: Con 22 años de edad Estefanía es madre soltera, su hijo tienen 3 años, Estefanía vive con sus padres en el campo y se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, Estefanía se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y al jornal de trabajo en el campo, Estefanía va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio para que sea mas rentable,  Estefanía va a  sacar sola adelante a su hijo ya que dice que ella es padre y madre para su niño, Estefanía tiene el compromiso de  educar y alimentar lo mejor que pueda a su hijo.
texts.en: At 22 years of age, Estefania is a single mother. Her son is 3 years old. Estefania lives with her parents in the countryside and is dedicated to farming and to raising young animals. Estefania is dedicated to raising pigs and to the wages of work in the fields. Estefania is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs to expand her business so that it is more profitable. Estefania is going to succeed alone with her son since she says she is both mother and father to her child. Estefania has committed to educating and providing the best she can to her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un años su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de camisas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, etc. todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 61 years old. She lives in her own house with her family. She has been dedicated to selling clothing for some years. Her business is located near to her place of residence in an area that is well trafficked and she has a lot of customers. With what she obtains from her earnings, she manages to cover some of her expenses that arise at home. She is requesting a loan to buy shirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, etc. at wholesale to continue with her sales since this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, blouses, T-shirts, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eutropia is 62 years old now.

Eutropia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Eutropia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Eutropia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Eutropia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a home solar energy system

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 24-year-old woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gladys has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Gladys requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy more meat to sell in the market.

Gladys has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Gladys would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in the market

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Since Mary Grace’s house is facing a gas station in Davao City, she was encouraged to embark on buy and sell of rubber products. She buys used vehicle tires and interiors and recycles it into new products such as plant pots and garbage containers. Gas station customers are her “captured suppliers”, and they may also be her captured buyers. She’s not mistaken! Indeed it’s a prolific place for her business.

Her only difficulty is the unstable supply of rubber and high cost of raw materials. Sometimes she cannot meet the demands of customers due to insufficient stocks. She intends to buy volume of raw materials for rubber products when she gets hold of enough capital. She is requesting for PhP 50,000 to secure the continuous operations of her business.
