With this, she will be able to boost her income and sustain the salaries of her two workers.

If her business grows steadily, she can attain her dream to put up another outlet and slowly build their own house in Samal Island, a tourist destination. She and her husband Lonnie wish to bestow a stable business to their children after they finish their college education.

Mary Grace meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of raw materials for rubber products.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 40-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, a few years ago, Wisam decided to start his own business. He manages a store selling electronic equipment and he sells his products in neighboring markets.

He is the only breadwinner for the family, and they depend on him for support.

Wisam took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new collection of tools and equipment for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Wisam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of tools and equipment for his store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and married with four children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Janet has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Janet aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor tiene treinta y ocho años de edad es casado, trabaja en una tienda de abarrotes como encargado.Se encuentra preocupado por la salud de su mama ya que ella vive sola e irremediablemente perdió el ojo izquierdo debido a la presión intraocular elevada. El teme que pase lo mismo con su ojo derecho, desafortunadamente no puede solventar la cirugía ya que sus ingresos son pocos, y él  es el único sustento de su familia formada por 3 hijos y su esposa que se dedica al hogar. El desea apoyar a su mamá con la cirugía.
texts.en: This gentleman is 38 years old and married.  He works at a grocery store as a manager.  He is worried about his mother’s health.  She lives alone and has permanently lost vision in her left eye due to high intraocular pressure.  He fears that the same could happen to her right eye.  Unfortunately, he does not earn much income and is not able to pay for the surgery.  He is the only breadwinner in his family, which includes his three children and his wife who looks after their home.  He wants to help his mother obtain the surgery.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's eye surgery.

loans.name: Robeena

texts.en: Robeena is a 41-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a taxi driver by profession. He drives in a large city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. Now he wants to replace the taxi's engine, as it is producing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil. Thus, Robeena  has applied for a Murabaha loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees for her husband so he can buy a new taxi engine to provide better services to his customers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's taxi

loans.name: Aasma

texts.en: Aasma is a 31-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband (also shown in the photo). She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Aasma ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Aasma has requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. This will help her provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers; to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida goes fishing. She sells fresh fish, crabs, and sea shells to the locals in the community. She is married with three children. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is 3 months old. Her husband is also a fisherman. They work together to support the needs of her children.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net. These materials could help improve her ongoing catch and enable her to sell more volume as well. With these, she could settle her obligations and be able to start expanding her fishing livelihood activity. She could continue to send her children to school and provide them with proper diets.

Zenaida is hopeful that she will be successful to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 54-year-old, married woman who has a business buying and selling animals with the help of her son, who is also shown in the photo. Her business has provided her family with a decent living. She is a mother of three and is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, including a good education, food and clothing. Thus, she has applied for a Murabaha loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees, with which she intends to buy more baby goats and calves so she can cater for more customers. Rehana is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves to sell

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman living together with her husband and five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past twelve years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business into the wholesale supply of firewood in the village. 

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.en:
Gulandom is a diligent woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. She lives with her family in a district far from the city. She is married and has one baby. 

Gulandom is a housekeeper and does business at home. She is a tailor. She gets orders at home and sews traditional women's dresses. She has regular clients each week. She saved up money to buy a sewing machine and progressed her business efficiently. However, Gulandom recently got sick and has no money to pay for treatment at the medical clinic. She asks for a loan from IMON to pay for medical services at hospital. She awaits KIVA lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for medical services at hospital

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Gracias a su entusiasmo y las ganas de seguir prosperando que lo hace luchar día a día, para brindarle a su familia una mejor  calidad de vida, ella cuenta que antes ella no contaba con la posibilidad de realizar una mejor inversión en su negocio de verduras, pero gracias al crédito ella logro incrementar su negocio por lo que ahora sus ingresos han mejorado mucho, pero con el afán de seguir mejorando sus ingresos  ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de una variedad de verduras.
El gran sueño de Paula es poder construir una vivienda  más digna para su amada familia.
texts.en:
Thanks to her enthusiasm and her drive to keep prospering, she fights day to day to give her family a better quality of life. She remarks that previously she didn't have the possibility of making a better investment in her vegetable business. Thanks to the loan she was able to grow her business and now her income has improved a lot. However, in order to continue improving her income, she is now asking for a new loan to invest in her business, which is buying and selling vegetables.

Paula's big dream is to build a house that is better for her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Maria Lyn

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Maria Lyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Maria Lyn is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Maria Lyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 39 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 39 años de edad es casado y vive muy feliz mente con su amada familia en su humilde hogar, José se encuentra muy satisfecho por los logros que ha obtenido gracias al apoyo del crédito, pues el antes no contaba con el capital suficiente para poder cultivar con mucho más volumen, pero con el crédito él consiguió  cultivar y sus ingresos han mejorado mucho, Jose con el afán de seguir prosperando solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá nuevamente en la compra de abono químico para el cultivo de ejotes criollos, porque con este cultivo el espera aumentar aún más sus ingresos.
El gran sueño de Jose es poder construir una casa más grande para su querida familia para que ellos vivan mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Jose is a 39 year old man. He is married and lives very happily with his beloved family in their humble home. José is very satisfied with the achievements he attained thanks to the help of the loan. Previously, he didn't have enough capital to grow with a lot more volume, but with the loan he was able to grow more and his income has improved a lot. In order to keep prospering, Jose is asking for a loan which he will again invest in buying chemical fertilizer to grow local green beans, because he is hoping to increase his income even more with this crop. 

Jose's big dream is to be able to build a bigger house for his beloved family so they can live much more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer to grow green beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es: Oscar de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 15 años y comercializa sus producto en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa,el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos para tener junto con sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar, 39 years old, lives in his own house with his four children. He has been working in corn farming for 15 years and sells his products at different markets that are located near his house. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides etc. This way, he can increase his income and improve the quality of life for him and his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides etc.

loans.name: Benilda Gloria

texts.es: Benilda sintió inclinación por la estética y aunque tenía algunos conocimientos empíricos decidió capacitarse para poder ejercer esta profesión con calidad total.  Tan pronto como se graduó empezó a trabajar en un salón de belleza como estilista y gracias a un primo quien le proporcionó el capital inicial, inauguró su propio salón de belleza en el que lleva quince años funcionando con una clientela fidelizada a quienes les ofrece servicios de corte de cabello, cepillado, tintes, desrizado, iluminaciones y tratamientos capilares.  Todos los días labora doce horas, un horario muy amplio para que todos sus clientes puedan tomar sus servicios,  en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una vitrina y una silla de peluquería. Esta inversión es muy significativa para mejorar el servicio puesto que el cliente tendrá la oportunidad de escoger tratamientos de acuerdo a sus necesidades exhibidos en la vitrina.  A largo plazo desea ampliar su negocio para tener más capacidad, oportunidad, agilidad en el servicio y generar empleo.  Así mismo continuar trabajando para ayudar en la educación de su sobrino.
texts.en: Benilda felt inclined toward the beauty business. Although she had some self taught knowledge, she decided to get trained to be able to practice this profession totally qualified. As soon as she graduated, she started to work in a beauty salon as a stylist. Thanks to a cousin, who provided her with the initial capital, she opened her own beauty salon, and she has been running it for fifteen years, with loyal customers whom she offers haircuts, coloring, straightening, highlights and hair treatments. She works every day for twelve hours, a very long schedule so that all of her customers can access her services. Right now, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in buying a display case and a salon chair. This investment is very significant to improve service, since the customer will have the chance to choose treatments according to their needs, as shown in the display case. Over the long term, she wants to expand her business to have more capacity, opportunity, and agility in the service, as well as generate employment. She also wants to continue working to help with her nephew's education.

loans.use: to buy a display case and a salon chair.

loans.name: Rizalia

texts.en:
Rizalia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rizalia is 43 years old and has one child in school.

Rizalia has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Rizalia requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like lotion, face powder, shampoo, etc..

Rizalia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Rizalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like lotion, face powder, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Tamuna

texts.en:
Tamuna is 21 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 infant children. Tamuna has a beauty salon and serves locals as a hair stylist. 

She wants to expand her salon and add manicure services. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $450 for purchasing tools and nail cosmetics. She will provide manicure and pedicure services to her clients. 

Tamuna is very hardworking and loves her job, this impacts that she has a good number of satisfied clients. The Start Up program will be a great support for her to increase income.

loans.use: to purchase tools and nail cosmetics and provide manicure and pedicure services to her clients

loans.name: Sunarti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Sunarti. Sunarti lives in Solo, a city located about 6 hours drive from Jakarta. She is happily married and she sells mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community. She decided to join Ruma because she realized that she has to help her husband to improve their income and she wants to help her community to get better access to communication and financial services as well.

As the business grows, Sunarti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sunarti improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.  Sunarti’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve e-commerce business for her costumers. As seen in the photo, Sunarti is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more liters of kerosene

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is a 40 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living, he is engaged in a transport business for 1 year already. For him it is a good business because he can able provide his family daily needs with the help of his wife whose taking care of his children. 

He wants to increase his income so that he can give what is the best of his family, He took a loan to buy motor parts for motorcycle repair so that he can continue to cater to more passengers that will generate a better income.

Rene plan for the future to buy new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motorcycle repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, gravel, and sand in addition to paying for labor to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Novia

texts.en:
Novia is 41 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Novia works very hard to provide for them.

Novia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Novia has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Novia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Pinny

texts.en:
Pinny is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur, is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Pinny has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Pinny requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Pinny has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Pinny would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock such as beer, soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Reinaldo De Jesus

texts.es:
Reinaldo un señor con 43 años de edad, dedicado a la preparación y posteriormente a la venta de alimentos en un carrito que adecuo para esto, un medio por el cual el logra obtener los ingresos mínimos para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

Reinaldo solicita un auxilio económico con el cual surtirá su negocio de frutas, comprara vasos y cucharas desechables y demás implementos de aseo que sean de su utilidad.

Su meta es seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que debido a las fuertes lluvias esta se ha ido deteriorando.

Aporta al sueño de este empresario, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a 43-year old man who earns his living preparing and then selling food from a specially-adapted cart. This is how he manages to earn enough money to pay for his household needs.

He is seeking financial help to buy items for his business such as fruit as well as disposable glasses and spoons, and useful cleaning supplies. Reinaldo's goal is to continue working so he can fulfill his dream of improving the condition of his house since it has been damaged by the strong rains.

Please help this businessman achieve his dream by providing him with a loan.

loans.use: buy fruit and disposable glasses and spoons

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is a mother of three kids,two schooling and one still small. She is a divorcee and taking care of her family with a small business/general store. She sells soft drinks(sodas,juices and water),kilos of rice,beans sugar plus other stuffs in her shop. She has been in this business for fifteen years now, her self aged early forties. She works hard to make her kids life better and build a house for them. Ashura starts working from 08am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good return. 

For her business to grow and meet her dream, Ashura approached Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania to find capital support. This is her 15th credit request,paid back her previous successfully. She used the previous loans to improve more her business(raised her capital)bought more missed stocks in her shop and now sells more stuff. She made profit which enabled to buy a plot of land and made some bricks to start building. Covering school fees and household expenses. 

Ashura request another credit to buy sodas,juices,water,sacks of rice, beans, sugar and and other shop stuff. She will be held accountable for paying back her loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, water, sacks of rice, beans, sugar and and other shop stuff.

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en:
Vasile is a farmer from Petresti village in the Ungheni region in Moldova. He owns a small land where he grows crops and nutria, pigs and chickens. 

Vasile has managed his farm for many years, producing cereals, vegetables, wine, nutria and pig meat that he sells locally. He is a loving father of an 11-year-old boy. His wife is a saleswoman at a gas station and helps Vasile in managing his farm.
 
This hard-working farmer wants to develop his business and build a small boutique for selling farm products to increase his income as well as improve the conditions they are living in.

Vasile will use the loan to build a small boutique for selling his farm products and extend by this mean his farm's income.

loans.use: to build a small boutique for selling his farm products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as reed and palm branches and to pay the handyman to renovate her house.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
It’s barely two months after her husband died, but here is Merlyn, who doesn’t want to be bogged down by loneliness and loss. Instead she keeps on, focusing on her children’s needs and the ways on how to grow her businesses. She operates a variety store combined with a small canteen, videoke rental, and Piso Net. 

Her variety store sells commodities like toiletries, biscuits and candies, canned goods, beverages, and others. Her small canteen offers cooked viands and snacks. Her customers may also sing in her coin-operated videoke machine or surf the Internet through her coin-operated Piso Net. Her business is quite beneficial for her and her children because it provides for their daily needs and educational expenses. It also gives her a sense of productivity and self-confidence that she can get through all the hurdles in life.

Now she is applying for a PHP 15,000 loan, mainly to buy more stock for her sari-sari (variety store) and ingredients for her canteen. Your assistance will be gratefully appreciated by a widow like her. As a father and mother to her children, she has to shoulder all the responsibilities for them.

She wants to live happily with her children in Butuan City in the Mindanao region. She draws strength and inspiration to her co-fellowship members at CCT Credit Cooperative who meet every week to share life experiences and reflect on the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her variety store

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jesselyn is 39 years old, and five of her children are in school.

Jesselyn has a buying and selling of spices business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Jesselyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jesselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase a large quantity of beans, cassava and bananas, which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 30 years old with four children. With three children in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

Rosana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosana has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana una mujer con 40 años de edad, que desde hace poco logro consolidar un taller de confecciones a terceros y una línea de  marca propia, con lo que ha logrado un gran progreso, es de allí donde saca los ingresos suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia conformada por dos hijos menores y su actual pareja.

Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de de compra telas, hilos de alta costura al por mayor, maquina planas y con lo otro arreglara su taller, ya que su estado no es el mejor.

Su sueño es principalmente comprar una vivienda y formaliza su negocio para que en un futuro quede en manos de sus hijos. 

Aporta al sueño de Adriana, haga un  préstamo.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 40 year old woman who recently managed to establish a wholesale tailoring workshop as well as a line of clothing of her own brand. She has made great progress with this business, from which she receives sufficient income to cover the necessary expenses of her family, which is comprised of two young children and her current partner.

She is requesting a loan with the goal of buying material, high quality thread in bulk and sewing machines. The rest she will use to renovate her workshop, which is not in the best state.

Her dream is to buy a house and to formally establish her business so that in future it will pass on to her children. Contribute to making Adriana's dream a reality. Make a loan.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, sewing machines, and to renovate her workshop.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is 41 years old, a married woman and the mother of 3 children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is in the poultry business to help meet their household expenditures. He makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her husband's business, Gulshan contacted Kashf Foundation and has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to build a shed roof for the hens and to purchase feed for them.

loans.use: to build a shed roof for the hens and to purchase feed for them.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Mary una mujer con 29 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos menores, que en el momento se encuentra pasando por una situación económica un poco difícil.
Desea abrir su primer negocio, una sala de spa, con lo que esperar generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

Solicita un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar con el fin de comprar las herramientas necesarias como sillas y camas de relajación, aceites, cremas y principalmente para la compra del local.

Su mayor sueño es formalizar su negocio, y comprar una vivienda propia.
Como Mary, miles de empresaria están esperando de su ayuda, Anímese y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
29-year old Mary is a single mother with two young children. Right now she is going through a somewhat difficult financial time. She wishes to open her first business, a spa, with which she expects to generate enough income to pay for household necessities.

Mary is seeking a loan from Corporación Interactuar to buy necessary equipment such as chairs, relaxation beds, oils, creams, and most of all a place where she can run her business. 

Her greatest dreams are to have the business running properly and to buy a house of her own. 

Thousands of business people like Mary await your help. Please make a loan now!

loans.use: buy chairs and relaxation beds, oils, creams, and premises for her spa

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a member of the Methodist Church, Letecia wants to be faithful in tithing; it is ten percent of net income that is set aside to be offered to the church. If a person is faithful in tithing, he/she might also be honest in all undertakings, including management of a business. 

Letecia runs a variety store with an adjacent canteen in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. Just like other business owners, she also experiences stiff competition and a lack of capital; it hampers the continuous operation of her business and consequently affects her income. If she will be given enough capital, she is confident that she can manage her business properly. 

From a loan worth PhP 20,000, she can buy added items to sell in her store. She can also cook more meal choices in her canteen. Her income will sufficiently provide for her and her children’s usual expenditures. She is a widow who has taken all the responsibilities for her children on her shoulders. She has hope you can lighten her burden through your generous support. 

She prays for a growing business, good health and more blessings for her and her children. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy added items to sell in her store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Single parents like Evangeline may be considered exceptional because they perform the tasks and carry the responsibilities of both father and mother. 

Evangeline is a loving parent to her child and a caring daughter to her sick mother. She provides for their needs with the help of her buy-and-sell business and water distribution service. She buys sacks of rice and firewood at wholesale prices, then sells it per kilo and bundle. She also distributes gallons of water in her community in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte. 

But a big portion of her income is utilized for her sick mother’s medical expenses. She can hardly save for the future and educational needs of her child. Their financial insufficiency fuels her to improve her business and increase her profit simultaneously. 

She asks for your kindness to loan her an amount of PhP 12,000 that she will use to buy more bundles of firewood and also sacks of rice and gallons of water. If her business will prosper in due time, she plans to buy a motorcycle for rent. She also dreams to see her only child finish her studies and have a better living condition someday. 

She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and also sacks of rice and gallons of water

loans.name: Markhaba

texts.en:
Markhaba is a 51-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began a business of milk-selling along with her son, who is also shown in the photo. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 37 years old, a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a taxi driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. 

He wants to change the taxi's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its' work. That is why Shazia has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities to his customers. 

Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Phors

texts.en:
Phors is a 33-year-old married factory worker with no children, who resides in a community in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has worked in the factory since 2005 and earns $5 a day. Her husband, 28 years old, is a construction worker and also a rice farmer, earning $3.5 a day. 

Now Phors is requesting a loan for her husband to buy a water pump and fertilizer for rice farming. This loan will help her husband have his own water pump and enough fertilizer for rice farming to gain better rice crops. In the future, she is going to buy two cows for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 49-year-old married mother of two children. 20 years ago, she started tailoring from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She has her loyal customers and a good reputation in her region.

Samira is trying desperately and working hard to improve her family's living conditions for they are her priority. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. 

Samira hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Doncellas Group

texts.es:
Carmen continúa con su actividad de venta de juguetes y productos de temporada. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería. El pago de sus cuotas pue puntual porque no tuvo dificultades (segunda de la derecha, viste blusa verde a rayas y calza a blanca a rayas negras). Debido a la necesidad de continuar trabajando por el bien sus hijos, formó la banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de jardinería, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura, venta de productos médicos naturales y venta de vajillas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. En esta oportunidad su negocio es la venta de regalos, como; portarretratos, relojes, velas, libretas, bolígrafos, llaveros, etc., “en esta época del año los regalos son muy demandados para cumpleaños, bodas, fiestas de colegios y muchos acontecimientos que hacen de mi negocio un éxito…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que realiza ventas por temporada, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer y surtir el negocio. Su sueño es abrir  un puesto de venta fijo ya no tener que ambular. Ella desea realizar la compra de regalos para todo acontecimiento para continuar con su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de regalos para todo acontecimiento para continuar con su negocio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Carmen is continuing with her work selling toys and seasonal products. The loan she obtained before was used to buy merchandise. She made her repayments punctually as she had no financial difficulties (she is located second from the right, wearing a green striped blouse and white leggings with black stripes). As Carmen needed to continue working for the sake of her children, she formed a bank with people who have businesses such as providing gardening services, selling chicken, selling flowers, tea service, tailoring shop, and selling natural medicines, and selling crockery, so that they could apply for a loan and improve their businesses.

Now Carmen's business is selling presents such as photo frames, alarm clocks, candles, notepads, pens, key chains etc. "At this time of year gifts are much in demand for birthdays, weddings, school graduations, and many other events that make my business successful," she says.

The advantage of her business is that sales are driven by seasons; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to keep her business well-stocked. Carmen's dream is to open a store in permanent premises so she doesn't have to always be on the move. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the two years she has had her business. 

For these reasons Carmen is seeking a loan to buy presents for all occasions so she can continue her business and line of work.

loans.use: to buy giftware for all occasions as stock for her business

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Sewing fabrics is like shaping a person’s life. Before an end product comes, the fabric needs to undergo outlining or planning, cutting and lots of piercing with the needle. The beautiful end products will be used as clothes, curtains, bed sheets, and many more. Basilisa from Butuan City is happy to sew various designs of clothes, bed sheets and pillowcases from nicely printed fabrics. She also makes school and office uniforms. This enterprise is very important in maintaining her household and providing for her children’s school expenses. She is dreaming that this business will expand and grow in progress, and later on she will own a tailoring shop with complete equipment.  

To take another step towards reaching this dream, she needs your help. She would like to borrow a loan worth 15,000 PHP that she will use to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabrics, threads, ribbons and laces, zippers, and other sewing accessories. From these, she can make more clothes that will bring more profit and savings for her family. 

She is married to Gregorio, a municipal employee, and they have two children who are still studying. They aspire that their children will finish their schooling and obtain a decent job someday.

Basilisa meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, threads, ribbons and laces, zippers, and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley, age 35, is from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns three tricycles. Her husband, John Rey, drives one tricycle to earn an income. The two other units are being rented by drivers in the couple's neighborhood. They earn enough to support their daily needs and the education of their young children. But if her tricycles suddenly encounter mechanical problems, she would not have enough spare parts and tools necessary for troubleshooting. As a result, the damaged tricycle would be idle for days, affecting her income and the income of the driver who rents it. 

Shirley is still paying for the monthly amortization of her third tricycle; therefore this amount is still being deducted from her monthly income. Now she wants to pay the full balance so she can maximize her profits. A loan worth PHP 10,000 would be enough for this purpose. She will also use part of the loan to buy spare parts and tools for troubleshooting. 

She is determined to enhance her business and operate more tricycles some day. This will ensure the future and education of her children, and their dream of owning a house and lot in the future will no longer be elusive.  

Shirley meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay the full balance of her tricycle and to buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Lydmer Christine

texts.en:
Lydmer Christine is 26 years old. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Lydmer Christine has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Lydmer Christine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 34 years old and married with two children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Colonia Rosalinda Group

texts.en:
In Colonia Rosalinda, the small village where Susana (first from the left) lives with her husband and their three children, there are no plans to have traditional electrification through power lines in the upcoming years. 

The neighborhood of Colonia Rosalinda has very low income people who want to improve their living conditions now, and have decided to get third-generation solar home systems to have basic electricity in their houses. 

The loan is asked to fund those systems and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first year of operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic systems for their houses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic systems for their houses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic systems for their houses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Mlimani Group

texts.en:
Rehema is in her early 40s and married with three children, two of whom go to school and one of whom is grown up. She has been running a grocery business for ten years now. She works from 8pm to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Rehema's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock items in her store and buy chicken broilers to sell. She has paid back all her loans successfully and was happy with them. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this new loan to buy beer, whiskey, wine, soda, juice, and water for her store. She hopes to sell her drinks at wholesale prices. 

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group "Mlimani", which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beer, whiskey, wine, soda, juice and water for her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 29 years old and has two children. Rosalinda is married and has two children who are in school.

Rosalinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Srey Tuch's Group

texts.en:
Srey Tuch, 24, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Mondulkiri province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and one who is younger. To support her family’s living, she can earn income via cassava growing and working for others for a fee to get more income. She has worked on her cassava farm for seven years. 

Her cassava was destroyed by insects which has made her cassava’s price lower than before. Due to having not enough funds to continue farming, she decided to take a Kiva loan. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a new group of three members to get the loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy cassava seed and pay for labor fees to support her cassava farm and boost the crop yields. 

She hopes that she can get a good yield from her cassava farm to increase her income and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cassava seed and pay for labor fees to support her cassava farm and boost the crop yields.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 23-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, which has an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007.

He  lives with his family in a small old house. Ibraheem works as a waiter in cafe where he earn low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ibraheem took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system and filter to clean and heat water for the family house. 

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot and clean water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

Ibraheem appears in the photo and he is holding the filter.

loans.use: to buy a solar system and filter to clean and heat water for the family house.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucila is 55 years old now.

Lucila has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Lucila requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more meat and other supplies for her business.

Lucila has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Lucila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 47 años, casada, tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de pulpería.
Ella es comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por los orígenes de sus pobladores; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del área e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio, de clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la primera de la derecha), su vida la realiza con su esposo que trabaja como transportista, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar la banca de personas con negocios como; artesanía en tela, confección de tejidos, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de tomates, confección de ropa, venta de pescado y servicio de construcción, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de todas aquellas cosas que los pobladores necesitan como: telas, comestibles, remedios, ropas, artículos de talabartería, tabaco, papel para armar cigarrillos, yerba, etc. “vendo artículos de primera necesidad, mis clientes son continuos y mis ventas son diarias, eso me hace abastecer constantemente mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fieles, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reabastecer la pulpería. Su sueño es construir su casa para tener su negocio en su casa, ella desea realizar el abastecimiento de artículos de pulpería para continuar con su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio de pulpería y con los beneficios construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria, age 47, is married and has six grown children.  Her business is selling general store items.  She is understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible, and very hard working.  She conducts her business in the ‘plan 300’ area.  This place is known for its inhabitants who are descendants of the Ayores tribes, which are native to the area and the miners who are relocated from the west.  The miners adapted to the area and started working in manufacturing and commerce.  The area has a hot sub-tropical and very humid climate.  The temperature varies during the day between 21 – 35 degrees centigrade.

Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that is tied back.  She is short and has a medium build.  Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish with the general public and for the business she does.  (She is the first on the right.)  She shares her life with her husband, who works as a driver.  They live in a rented room built from brick and cement.  It is a corrugated tin roof and a dirt floor.  They have running water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

Her desire to improve drove her to lead a bank of people with businesses like fabric handicrafts, making weavings, selling second-hand clothes, selling tomatoes, making clothes, selling fish, and construction services.  They are in the bank to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling all of the things that the inhabitants need like fabric, food, remedies, clothes, saddlery products, tobacco, rolling paper for cigarettes, and herbs, etc.  “I sell basic needs items.  I have regular customers and I make daily sales.  The makes me constantly stock my business,” she says.

The advantage of my business is that I have loyal customers.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to restock my store.

Her dream is to build her house in order to have her business at her house.  She wishes to stock general store items in order to continue with her business.  This is the second loan cycle with the institution in the one year that she has been engaged in this business activity.  It is for these reasons that Maria is requesting a loan to stock her general store and to build her house with the profits.

loans.use: to stock her general store business and to use the profits to build her house.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and has four children. Vilma is married and has three children who are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Vilma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married mother of three children. She is from the Chuka area of Kenya. She runs a 3-acre mixed farm. She has dairy cows, poultry, cash crops, and over 200 trees. With all these activities, however, Pamela could not make enough income to meet her family's basic needs. Therefore, she started a cereal trading business. Basically, she arranges the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers.

Pamela is seeking a loan to grow her cereal business. The borrowed money will be used to aggregate more cereal produce from local farmers; the larger the stock, the more the income.

The impact of your loan will be felt by both her family and other farmers in her village. By using her better understanding of the market conditions and prices, she will be able to sell much easier, and this will free her supplies to focus more on production. Income from this trade will help Pamela to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a twenty-six-year-old single man living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a very hard-working man and has a shop that sells general merchandise. He also has motor cycles that he uses for motor cycle transportation. 

He is challenged by inadequate capital but hopes to construct a permanent house for his parents.

He requests a loan to buy general merchandise like jelly, bathing soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like jelly, bathing soap and other things to sell.

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is married and a mother of six kids. She is working hard to help her husband to provide a good life and good education for their children. 

Reema decided to help her husband by working making dairy products and cheese to sell. Now she is supporting her kids to complete their education and she is also helping her husband with the household expenses. 

Now she wants to expand and develop her work and increase her income because she wants to pay the university fees for her kids. Therefore she is applying for a loan to buy supplies and equipment to produce more products and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment to produce more products and increase her profits.

loans.name: Nzije

texts.en: Nzije is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Nzije operates a stall in the market selling vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of seasonality at her place of operation. With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Battambang province, Song is 40 years old. She is divorced from her husband and lives with three dependent children. Nowadays, she earns income to improve her living condition via growing rice and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved with her rice farming for 10 years. 

Even though, she has been involved with rice farming for long time she still has problems of having enough capital to support her farm. For Song, this is her twelfth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. With her past loans, she bought decent household supplies for her family. 

In a group of three, she is the group leader. She got a new loan from VisionFund of about 2,000,000 KHR to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pay plowing fees to support her rice farm. She hopes that her rice will give her a good yield, so she can get more income to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sabrositas Group

texts.es:
Jhovana continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas (sentada al centro, viste polera blanco, y chompa). En esta oportunidad reunió la banca de emprendimiento con actividades como; venta de medicina natural, confección de tejidos, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para continuar mejorando sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., actividad que genera una rotación constante de toda su mercadería y que necesita reponer continuamente con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para continuar con su negocio, “la ropa se vende casi al momento, tardamos más tiempo en trasladarla que en venderla…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa es de venta constante, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder continuar con su negocio. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta para dejar  de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para continuar en el negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jhovana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para continuar con su negocio y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jhovana continues with her business selling used clothing. The loan that she obtained was invested in buying merchandise at wholesale. The loan payments were punctual because she didn't have any problems. In the photo, she is seated in the center with a white shirt and sweater.

The community bank reunited in order to improve their respective businesses: selling natural medicines, tailoring, selling chicken meat, selling flowers, tea service, seamstress, and selling second hand clothing.

Jhovana has a business selling second hand clothing such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, sweaters, blouses, etc. She constantly rotates her merchandise and need to restock continually with a great variety and quantity of clothing in order to continue her business. She comments, "the clothing sells almost immediately, it takes us longer to transport the clothing than to sell it..." The advantage to her business is that the clothing sells constantly; the challenge is the lack of capital in order to continue with the business. Her dream is to open a permanent stand and stop selling as a street vendor. She wishes to buy second hand clothing at wholesale in order to continue with her business.

This is the second sequence of loans from this institution in 3 years for this work. It is for these reasons that Jhovana seeks a loan to buy second hand clothing at wholesale in order to continue with her business and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing at wholesale in order to continue with her business and feed her family.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man. Due to the poor financial situation of his family, he left school early to start working in the construction field with a limited salary to cover his needs and expenses. Mohammad is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to open his own clothing shop. This loan is very important to him for it will help him work independently and build his own future.
Mohammad hopes to succeed in this business and gain loyal customers to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to open his own clothing shop

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
HEIDY continúa con su actividad de venta de comida tradicional.  El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de utensilios de cocina. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo ningún problema (sentada, la primera de la derecha, viste blusa crema y cartera negra). En esta oportunidad la necesidad la hiso reunir la banca de personas con negocios como; venta de productos médicos naturales, artesanía en cerámica, tienda de barrio, servicio de taxi,  venta de sándwiches, venta de poleras y venta de refrescos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, la necesidad constante de su negocio es la reposición de insumos de cocina como; aceite, especias, verduras, tubérculos, fideos, arroz, carne, etc., “el anterior préstamo me ayudó con el movimiento de mi negocio, y mis necesidades son continuas deseo realizar compras por mayor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos por mayor. Su sueño es conseguir un local propio y grande donde trabajar, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que HEIDY solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para cocinar a diario y conseguir un local propio.
texts.en:
HEIDY continues with her business selling traditional food, The loan that she obtained previously was invested in buying kitchen utensils. The loan payments were made punctually as she didn't encounter any problems. In the photo, she is seated on the right in a cream blouse and black purse. Today the community bank met and their respective businesses are: selling natural medicines, ceramics, neighborhood store, taxi service, selling sandwiches, selling sweaters, and selling beverages. They seek a loan to improve their businesses.

HEIDY's business is selling traditional food. She constantly needs ingredients and supplies such as oil, spices, vegetables, tubers, noodles, rice, meat, etc. She comments, "the previous loan helped me grow my business and my needs are continuous so I want to make purchases at wholesale..." The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales; the challenge is the lack of capital to buy ingredients at wholesale. Her dream is to obtain her own large locale where she can work. She wishes to buy supplies at wholesale. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in 5 years that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that HEIDY seeks a loan to buy kitchen supplies at wholesale in order to cook daily and obtain her own locale.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies at wholesale in order to cook daily and obtain her own locale.

loans.name: Casta

texts.es:
Casta es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, de buena actitud, optimista, amable, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur, a orillas del majestuoso caudal del agua, paseo tradicional de la semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde se puede degustar la tradicional comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas. De clima cálido, sub tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Casta es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física delgada,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como cocinero, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en un cuarto de su casa para la hora de almuerzo y la hora de cena, “cada vez tenemos más clientela y nuestro mobiliario nos quedó chico…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos  y diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de muebles para atender a más clientes. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes y de forma adecuada. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida a más clientes y ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Casta, 38, lives with her husband and 4 children.  She operates a restaurant business.  She is an optimistic woman, kind, generous and a good mom to her children.  She lives in the south of the city and operates her business along the banks of the river there, a popular spot for walkers.  The climate here is sub-tropical with day-time temperatures that vary between 21- and 35-degrees, Centigrade.

Casta has brown eyes and long, dark hair that she wears tied at the back.  She speaks Guaraní, her native language, and Spanish.  Her husband is a cook and the family lives in a rented house.  The house was constructed with wood and has a tin roof and cement floor.  The house has electricity and well water, but is not plumbed.  

Casta sells traditional foods: sopa de maní (a peanut-based broth), arroz con queso (made with rice, milk and cheese), ají de panza (made with fatback, onions and tomatoes), etc.  She operates the business from a room in her house and works every day, opening for both lunch and dinner.  "We have more customers every day", she says, "but we don't have space to grow".  She has many regular customers now and is applying for a loan to buy more tables and chairs so that she can seat all who come.  She has operated her business for two years and never borrowed from the bank before.

For the future, Casta hopes to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Flor De Kantuta Ii Group

texts.es:
Lizbeth es una mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 8 años y 2 hijas de 3 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de dulces y refrescos.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, optimista, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Panamericana’ área central donde lado a lado conviven empresas públicas y privadas, como; restaurantes, galerías comerciales, cines, heladerías, edificios de departamentos familiares, universidades y todo tipo de comercio, de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-26 grados centígrados.
Lizbeth es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie, la primera de la izquierda, viste: chompa  negra y blusa ploma). Su vida la comparte junto a su esposo que trabaja como constructor, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica. Su necesidad de superación la llevó a formar una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Las personas de la banca desarrollan actividades como; tejido de chompas de lana, venta de medicinas naturales, agricultura, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, librería y recarga de baterías de auto. Su negocio es la venta de dulces y refrescos en su puesto de venta al aire libre en la puerta de un colegio, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes en el turno de la mañana y de la tarde, “inicié mi negocio porque nos trasladamos a esta zona a vivir y mis hijos estudian en esa escuela…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a su familia mientras trabaja, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio con; dulces, galletas, chocolates, papas fritas, chicharrones, etc. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de barrio, ella desea realizar la compra de golosinas y refrescos para reponer su puesto de venta y continuar vendiendo hasta que finalice el año escolar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Lizbeth solicita un préstamo para la compra de golosinas y refrescos para abastecer su puesto de venta y continuar con su negocio hasta que finalice el año escolar.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a 24 year old married woman. She has a 8 year old son and 2 daughters ages 3 and 6. Her business is the sale of candy and soft drinks. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, patient, optimistic, friendly, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located in the 'Pan' central area where there are public and private companies such as restaurants, shopping malls, movie theaters, ice cream shops, apartment complexes, universities and all kinds of trades. The temperate climate has a temperature that varies during the day between 18-26 degrees Celsius.

Lizbeth has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair tied in a ponytail, short stature, thin physique. Her first language is Quechua spoken at home and she generally speaks Spanish in business. In the photo, she is standing, first from the left, dressed in a black sweater and blouse. She lives with her husband who works as a builder. The live in a house owned by the family, built of adobe, brick and cement with tin roof and floor. The home has electricity and well water drawn by electric pump.

Her need to excel led her to form a bank of people to borrow funds and improve their businesses. Members of the community bank have business such as: woven wool sweaters, sale of natural medicines, agriculture, food sales, sale of used clothing, book and recharging car batteries. Her business is selling candy and soda in her stall outdoors at the door of a school. She works on weekdays in the morning shift and afternoon, "I started my business because we moved to this area to live and my children attend that school ... " she says. The advantage of her business is that she can care for her family as she works, the challenge is the lack of capital to supply the business with candy, cookies, chocolates, chips, por rinds, etc. Her dream is to open a neighborhood store. She wants to make the purchase of candy and soft drinks to replenish her stall and continue selling until the end of the school year. This is the first sequence of loans in seven years to support this activity. It is for these reasons that Lizbeth asks for a loan for the purchase of candy and soft drinks to supply her stall and continue her business until the end of the school year.

loans.use: to buy candy and beverages to stock her stand to continue business to the end of the school year.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.en: Victor Hugo is a Kubo.financiero client. This is his second loan. He paid the first one on time and now he is asking for a loan that will be used to prepare his food stall for the rainy season and repair the truck that he uses for his work. He feels accomplished because he decided to become independent and, so far, the business is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy food inventory.

loans.name: Nuevo Mundo Ii Group

texts.es:
Clara es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de cena.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora (de rodillas a la derecha, viste color celeste). Debido a su necesidad de mejorar su negocio, esta vez lidera la banca de emprendimiento, los integrantes realizan actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de jugos batidos, venta de celulares,  taller de llaves, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cena; la cena se acostumbra a comer a partir de las 7 de la noche, ella varía su menú tradicional tratando de que cada día sea diferente, “durante el día me ocupo de mi familia y preparo el trabajo de la noche…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que la comida se vende diariamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas de plástico. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta de comida bajo techo, ella desea realizar una inversión en la compra de mesas y sillas de plástico para atender a más clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Clara solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender cena a muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Clara is a young, 20-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has a 4-year-old son.  She has a restaurant that is open for dinner.  

She is a good mother and an optimistic, perseverant, patient, responsible, and very hard-working woman.  She is the woman in light blue who is kneeling on the right of the photo.  She is leading the group of entrepreneurs this time because of her need to improve her business.  The members of this group lead various business activities such as vehicle upholstery, fruit smoothie sales, cell phones sales, a key workshop, natural health product sales, beverage sales, and secondhand clothing sales.  They want to take out a loan and expand their businesses.  

Clara's restaurant is open for dinner, which is customarily eaten after 7 P.M.  She will vary her traditional menu and make sure that every day is different.  She notes that during the day she takes care of her family, and works on her restaurant at night.  The advantage of her business is that food is something that sells every day, and the disadvantage is that she doesn't have enough capital to buy tables and plastic chairs to serve more customers.  Therefore, Clara is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to serve dinner to a lot of customers.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to serve dinners to a lot of customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on pants, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, skirts, and dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for sale

loans.name: Scholasticah

texts.en:
Scholasticah is a small-holder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 30. Thirty years ago, Scholasticah married her husband. Five years later, she started farming on her husband's 6-acre piece of land to help him generate more income for their family. If you were to visit the farm today, you'll find four dairy cows, a garden full of tea crops and nearly 500 trees. 
Scholasticah wants to improve the state of her dairy farm. She is seeking a loan to construct a better cowshed for her animals. Through this loan investment, she hopes that the welfare of her animals will be much improved and this will make them healthier and more productive. This, in the long-run, will lead to a significant increase in the the number of stock and cattle products for her family.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Templarios Group

texts.es:
Valeria continúa con su actividad de venta de ropa de segunda mano. Él crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas (la primera de la izquierda, usa polera verde). Debido a la necesidad constante de alimentar a su familia reunió la banca solidaria para solicitar otro préstamo y continuar con sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano infantil como; buzos deportivos, chamarras, poleras, conjuntos para bebe y todo aquello que sea para uso de los niños, “los niños van creciendo y dejan sus ropas nuevas, esta es una manera de reciclar y vestir continuamente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa para niños se vende continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reponer y surtir su mercadería. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta bajo techo para dejar de ambular, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa infantil de segunda mano por mayor para reponer su mercadería y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Valeria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa infantil de segunda mano  y con los beneficios pagar el material escolar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valeria continues her business of selling second hand clothes. The loan she received she invested in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale. The loan payments were prompt because she did not have any problems. In the photo she is the first on the left, wearing the green turtleneck. Because of the constant need to feed her family, she met with the community bank to apply for another loan and continue with their respective businesses. Her business is selling secondhand children's clothing: track suits, jackets, sweatshirts, outfits for babies and other items for children. "Children grow out of their new clothes, this is a way to recycle and continually dress ..." she says.
