The advantage of her business is that children's clothes are continuously sold, the challenge is the lack of capital to replenish and fill her merchandise. Her dream is to open a stall indoors to stop selling as a street vendor. She wants to invest in her business by buying second-hand children's clothing at wholesale to replenish her stock and pay the school tuition for her children. This is the 3rd sequence loans in four years with this institution in support of her business.

It is for these reasons that Valeria apply for a loan for the purchase of second-hand children's clothing and paying for school tuition for her children.

loans.use: to buy second hand children's clothing and with the proceeds pay school tuition for her children

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is a small-holder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is a single mother of three children, the youngest only 14 months old. In 2008, Naumi started farming as soon as she secured a 0.3-acre plot of land. Today, she has two cows, half a dozen poultry and grows tea, vegetables and 30 trees on the farm.
Naumi's biggest challenge is lack of capital to buy more land. The small area she is operating in is fully utilized. She is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to buy land. She hopes that this loan investment will enable her to secure land to cultivate and produce more food that will give her family decent diets and better income.

loans.use: to buy land for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: A decade ago, Salina started farming on a small parcel of land in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Salina is a 52-year-old woman who has been a farmer for 10 years. She has a piece of farm land and a small house made out of earth, with two habitable rooms. On the farm she keeps cows and grows vegetables that she uses for both consumption and sale. This business has enabled her to raise her family. Salina's own upbringing was so difficult that she never had the privilege of attending school. She is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. With the loan, she will acquire a brood of hens that will lay eggs for food, sale and hatching. This business is projected to significantly increase her income. The birds will also bring life into her home, as they will be free-range and scratch the earth for bugs. The money from the investment will enable Salina to afford basic needs and save up for the future. This loan will go a long way towards empowering her to become a better entrepreneur and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Marcela Norma

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 8, 10 y 16 años, y su negocio es la enseñanza de música.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, autodidacta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad; caracterizada por recibir la migración campo-ciudad, que genera una intensa actividad económica conformada por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Marcela es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su esposo que trabaja como empleado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la enseñanza de música; y es conocida por sus clases de música para niños. Esta actividad fue la que la llevó a formar su academia hace más de 10 años y sigue siendo su misión principal conseguir despertar una sensibilidad musical en los niños desde su más temprana edad, “hemos aplicado un programa de clases de música para niños, paralelo a su formación educativa y cuya finalidad principal es desarrollar sus aptitudes musicales…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con alumnos mensuales y anuales, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de instrumentos para enseñar música a más niño. Su sueño es contar con un lugar propio donde enseñar música, ella desea realizar la compra de un teclado y un pedestal para enseñar música. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marcela solicita un préstamo para la compra de un teclado y un pedestal para enseñar música a mucho niños.
texts.en:
Marcela, 42, lives with her husband and 3 children: 16-, 10-, and 8-years old.  She makes a living teaching music.  She is an enterprising woman, self-taught, hard-working and always there for her children.  She lives in a southern neighborhood of the city, an area where many of the residents have only recently moved from rural parts of the country.  There are many small, often informal businesses, there.  The climate is sub-tropical with day-time temperatures that vary between 21- and 35-degrees, Centigrade.  

Marcela has brown eyes and short brown hair.  She speaks Guaraní, her native language, and Spanish.  Her husband works for a private company and her children are still in school.  The family lives in a rented house.  The house is made of brick and cement and has a metal roof and tiled floors.  The house is plumbed and has electricity and running water. 

Most of Marcela's students are children.  She started her business 10 years ago and says that she is especially eager to teach young children and awaken a passion for music in them that she herself feels.  "We created a series of lessons for children that are designed to develop the children's natural aptitude for music", she adds.  Marcela can count on a steady stream of revenue from the business, but lacks the capital to develop and grow it.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a keyboard and pedestal for teaching music.  This will be her first loan from the bank.

For the future, Marcela would like to have a space of her own for teaching.

loans.use: to buy a keyboard for her music-lessons business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on sugar, salt, flour, etc

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking 29-year-old smallholder farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a married mother of 4 children who practices diverse farming. On her 2-acre land, she is farming dairy, poultry, pigs, goats and trees. Her work brings home an important source of income.

Susan is seeking a loan to buy materials for constructing a cowshed. Having a cowshed will shelter her animals from harsh weather and pave way for modern farming techniques such as confined feeding.

With this investment, Susan hopes to kill two birds with one stone: reduce the cost of health interventions by improving the animals' welfare and increase sales through improved milk production.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a cowshed.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a diligent Kenyan farmer from Chuka; she is married and blessed with five children. This year, Regina and her husband will be celebrating their 15th anniversary of marriage. Regina lives on a small house and from the small house she can see light at the end of the tunnel, thanks to the income she earns through practicing mixed farming. 

Regina passionately loves dairy farming. Because of her immense farming knowledge she commands a lot of respect from other farmers. The biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her family. She has gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo and she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and help her be able to pay back the loan. Regina is confident that if you invest in her dream, you will be impacting the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah, at heart, is a resourceful, loving mother. Her motherly love has been enough to show her that she needs to work hard to help her children get ahead with excellent values and education. Peninah is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who hails from Kapsowar, a rural town in Kenya. She has a lovely family that she really loves and cherishes. Peninah and her husband work as a team supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past five years. 

Peninah is seeking a loan to buy vegetable and fruit seeds to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Peninah. Through a group of 15 members called Kaplamai, Peninah has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Peninah because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de hielo y helados.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dedicada, amable, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Puerto Pailas’ distante a 44 kilómetros de la ciudad, caracterizada por su variedad de comidas típicas como el majadito de pato, de carne, locro de gallina, picante de gallina, pescado y chancho al horno; además de los sabrosos horneados como el cuñapé, empanadas de maíz, pan de arroz y las infaltables bebidas típicas de la región como la chicha de maíz, mocochinchi, limonada y tamarindo. De clima cálido, sub tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 22-30 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Erika es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (la tercera de la izquierda, viste polera a rayas horizontales). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja en agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y  energía eléctrica no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su necesidad por pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos, la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; elaboración de sombreros de saó, artesanía en cerámica, venta de comida, carpintería, venta de verduras y venta de desayunos, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de hielo y helados tipo bolo, actividad que realiza durante el día en su puesto de venta fijo al aire libre de lunes a lunes, “trabajo durante toda la semana porque los clientes compran todos los días y día que no trabajo pierdo ventas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas no paran durante toda la semana, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una congeladora. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de una congeladora para guardar hielo y helados tipo bolo para mejorar sus ventas y contar con mercadería constante. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora para vender hielo y helados y con los beneficios pagar la escuela de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erika is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has 2 children ages 8 and 14, and her business is selling ice and ice cream. She is a good mother, enterprising, dedicated, friendly, strong, responsible and hardworking. Her business is lcoated in the town 'Puerto Pailas' which is 44 kilometers from the city. The area is characterized by its variety of traditional foods such as duck meat, chicken locro, spicy chicken, fish and pork baked; well baked as cuñapé, corn empanadas, corn bread and the inevitable typical drinks of the region such as corn chicha, mocochinchi, lemonade and tamarind. In a warm weather climate, the area is subtropical and humid with a temperature between 22 to 30 degrees Celsius during the day.

Erika is of dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair tied back, short, medium physique. Her first language is Guaraní spoken in the home and she speaks Spanish for business. In the photo she is the third from the right, wearing the blouse with horizontal stripes. She lives with her partner who works in agriculture and their children study in school. The live in a room built of wood with tin roof and floor that has well water extracted by pump and energy electric, there is no sewerage. She need to pay school fees for their children, so she is seeking a loan with her communal bank. Their respective business are making hats, ceramic crafts, food vending, carpentry, selling vegetables and selling breakfast. Her business is selling ice and ice cream, which she does during the day in an outdoor permanent stand, 7 days a week. "I work all week because customers buy every day and that way I don't miss out on any sales ... " she says. The advantage of her business is that sales do not stop throughout the week, the downside is the lack of capital to purchase a freezer. Her dream is to expand her business, she want to buy a freezer to store ice and ice creams to improve her sales and have constant merchandise. This is the first sequence of loans to the institution in 20 years that she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Erika applies for a loan to buy a freezer to sell ice and ice creams and with the proceeds pay for school for her children.

loans.use: to buy a freezer in order to sell ice and ice cream in order to pay for school for her children.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Victorine, who, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. They didn't just get together romantically. They joined their hands in improving their farm to create financial strength for the home that they share. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 3 children, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandi Hills area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 70,000 KES to buy poultry. Being a woman, she finds that accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. 
Help this hardworking woman realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca continúa con su actividad de venta de perfumes, fragancias, cosméticos y artículos de belleza. El pago de sus cuotas fue a tiempo porque no tuvo inconvenientes. En esta oportunidad a medida que su comercio va mejorando, ella va buscando la manera de continuar ampliando el negocio, “ya conseguí una cartera amplia de clientes con la que puedo dar el siguiente paso, que es abrir una tienda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una cartera amplia de clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la apertura de una tienda. Su sueño es aumentar su capital de trabajo, ella desea realizar la apertura de una tienda. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a  esta actividad.
Es por ese motivo que Rebeca solicita un préstamo para la apertura de una tienda de perfumes para continuar mejorando su negocio y abastecer los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Rebeca continues selling perfumes, fragrances, cosmetics, and beauty products.  She paid her previous loan back in time and did not have any difficulties.  On this occasion, since things are getting better for her, she is looking for a way to expand her business.  “I already have a large number of customers and the next step is for me to open a store...” she says.  The advantage of her business is that she has many customers.  The disadvantage is that she doesn’t have enough capital to open her store.  Her dream is to increase her working capital so she can open a store.  This will be her second loan through the institution in the five years she has had this business.

Rebeca is asking for a loan to open a perfumeries store in order to continue her business and cover her family expenses.

loans.use: to open a perfumeries store.

loans.name: Los Carreteros Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos gemelos de 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de asaditos de pollo.
Ella es buena madre, amable, respetuosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en ‘puerto pailas’ ubicado a 47 kilómetros al noreste de la ciudad, se destaca por la producción ladrillera y la vasta oferta gastronómica, los visitantes a su paso por el pueblo, pueden degustar de ricos pescados que ofrecen sus pobladores a los miles de visitantes y viajeros. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Ana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (la primera de la izquierda, viste polera naranja). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su esposo que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no cuenta con alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de semillas, tejido de ropa de bebé, artesanía en cerámica, venta de productos naturales, venta de ropa de segunda mano, elaboración de sombreros de sao y lavandería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de asaditos de pollo; en plena esquina de puerto pailas hay una parada casi obligatoria, sobre todo cuando se trata de disfrutar un buen asadito de pollo, “este tipo de carne por la grasa que lleva le da un toque de exquisitez al plato…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la comida se vende a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una heladera donde refrigerar los alimentos. Su sueño es ampliar su puesto de comida, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de una heladera dónde conservar los alimentos frescos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para refrigerar los alimentos para vender asaditos de pollo.
texts.en:
Ana, 39, lives with her husband and 20-year old twin sons.  She has a food business, making and selling roast chickens.  She is a patient and responsible woman, hard-working, friendly and always there for her boys.  She lives in Puerto Pailas, some 47 kilometers northeast of Santa Cruz.  The area is know for its food and visitors come here from far and wide.  The climate is sub-tropical and day-time temperatures vary between 21- and 35-degrees, Centigrade.

Ana has brown eyes and long, dark hair.  (She is standing at the far left in the photo, wearing an orange blouse.)  She speaks Guaraní, her native language, and Spanish.  Her husband works and her children work and study.  The family owns their house.  The house is made of wood with a metal roof and a dirt floor.  The house has electricity and well water, but is not plumbed.  

The members of the Los Carreteros group banded together to support their small businesses.  The members operate a range of businesses that include: seed sales; clothing sales; ceramics-making; natural products sales; hat-making; and laundry services.  Ana operates a business preparing and selling roast chickens.  She operates the business in the center of town, an almost-obligatory spot for anyone passing through.  "The fat on the meat makes it especially delicious", she says.  She likes the business because she can count on a steady stream of customers, but she lacks the capital to pay for all of the equipment she needs.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a freezer for storing food.  She has operated the business for 20 years and this is her first loan from the bank.

For the future, Ana hopes to expand her food business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her food business.

loans.name: Deyniss

texts.es:
Deyniss es una joven mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años, y estudia la carrera de administración de empresas. 
Ella es inteligente, buena madre, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en una escuela superior de administración de empresas en la zona ‘Pampahasi’, ubicado al norte de la ciudad, al pie de las faldas del cerro donde las calles son pendientes y empinadas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Deyniss es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a su madre que trabaja como comerciante y con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de administración de empresas y se encuentra en 1 año de 3 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta resolver los problemas de administración, su carácter es de servicio, “estudio administración y trabajo comerciando artículos para fiestas…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios ella trabaja importando artículos para fiestas y cotillones, viaja constantemente a la frontera a realizar compras. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando. Su sueño es ser profesional para trabajar en su rubro y dejar de viajar a la frontera, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a ambas actividades. 
Es por esos motivos que Deyniss solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios y trabajar en su rubro.
texts.en:
Deyniss is a 26 year old young woman, single, and has an 8 year old daughter. She is studying business administration. She is intelligent, a good mother, committed, consistent, sweet, loving, sensitive and sincere. She studies in a college of business administration in the area 'Pampahasi' located north of the city at the foot of the slopes of the hill where the streets are steep. This area is known for cold, dry weather with temperatures during the day between 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Deyniss is of dark complexion, long black hair, her first language is Aymara but she no longer speaks it because she studies and lives in the city. Her works with her mother who works as a trader and her daughter is studying in school. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a tin roof and wooden floor. It has water services, electricity and sewerage. She studies Business Administration and is in the first year of a 3 years-long course of study. She enjoys helping people, she likes to solve management problems, and her character is one of service. " I study administration and I work selling party supplies ..." she says. Along with her studies she works selling party supplies and party favors, constantly traveling to the border to make purchases. The advantage of her work is that there is no conflict of times do between work and school; the challenge is the lack of capital to purchase a laptop for further study. Her dream is to be a professional to work in her field and stop traveling to the border. She wants to purchase a laptop to continue her studies. This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in the five years she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Deyniss is requesting a loan to purchase a laptop to continue her studies and work in her field.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer in order to continue with her studies and work in her field.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a smallholder farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She practices dairy farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. Joy is married and has three children who enjoy dairy farming and often help their mother with the work. 

Joy applied for a loan because she wants to construct proper housing for her cows. She will buy tools and materials with the borrowed money. She will also use locally available materials to cut on costs. 

She hopes that this loan investment will go a long way in improving animal welfare on her farm. Having healthy animals will lead to high production of milk and thus, better income for her family.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Adonai Group

texts.fr: Djamila est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire Adonai, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est sociétaire d’un magasin des pièces de rechange depuis 7 ans. Elle va acheter les pneus, amortisseurs, segments, coussinets et les huiles moteurs. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en:
Djamila is a small-scale retailer and a member of the village borrowing group called Adonai. She is a client of MFI Hekima, married, aged 40, and the mother of five children, all enrolled in school. She has owned a spare parts shop for seven years. She is going to buy tires, shock-absorbors, segments, brake pads, and motor oil. 

Djamila started her business with money she was given by her husband. Her spouse is also a businessman. She hopes to get more loans to grow her working capital, keep her children in school, and feed them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by the conventional banking system.

loans.use: to buy tires, shock-absorbors, segments, brake pads, and motor oil

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
In Kapsowar area of Kenya it is normal to have a chicken farm, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely.

Susan is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kapsowar. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years. To earn a decent living she sells different variety of farm produce and engages in numerous small personal businesses or “side hustles” as she likes to call them. Only recently, she started seeing how she could be making big money off poultry farming.

To Susan, raising hens is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs, but figures the quantity she produces won't make economic sense. She needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand.

Susan is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in the Kipkaner village located in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Kipkaner village is at the center of a primarily maize farming region. However, most farmers, like Margaret, prefer to keep income-generating animals on their farmland, too. Margaret started farming ten years ago. Her primary income sources are milk, maize, and vegetables. She uses the income from these activities to take care of her family. Margaret is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With more poultry on her farm, she will produce more eggs for food, hatching, and selling. She will also expand her asset base to secure more loans in the future if need be. 

The immediate impact of this loan on Margaret's family is that she will be able to afford her children's education expenses. She cherishes her children. She would do anything to provide them with the best environment for mental and physical growth.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: El Carmen-74 Group

texts.es:
Rosmery continúa con su negocio de tapicería. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de telas, tapices y herramientas. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual (la segunda de la derecha, viste pantalo azul y polera rosa, chaleco negro) . En esta oportunidad volvió a reunir a la banca de personas con negocios como; llantería, venta de perfumes, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, arteanía en cuero, venta de huevo, elaboración de sombreros de sao y reparación de refreigeradores,  para solicitar un préstamo y continuar con sus actividades. Su negocio es la tapicería, actividad que continúa siendo su forma de vida y negocio familiar, “las telas y tapices se acaban rápido y es una de nuestras principales necesidades…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes frecuentas, la desventaja es la falta de capital de trabajo para la compra de material. Su sueño es tener el mejor taller de tapicería, ella desea realizar la compra de telas y tapices por corte, para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de cortes de tela de tapiz para contar con material constante de trabajo y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosmery is second from the right in the photo, wearing a black vest and pink blouse.  She used a past loan from the bank to buy tools, fabric and other supplies for carrying on her upholstery business.  She repaid the loan in the agreed-upon time.  

The members of the El Carmen-74 community bank operate a range of businesses that include: tire services; perfume sales; food sales; clothing sales; leather crafts; egg sales; hat-making; and refrigerator repair.  Rosmery has operated an upholstery business for 3 years.  "We use a lot of material for the business . . .  it is our main expense", she says.  She has many regular customers, she adds, but lacks the capital to buy bulk supplies of the upholstery fabric she needs.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of fabric.  This is her second loan from the bank.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Felister, a joyful smallholder farmer from Kerugoya area in Kenya. Felister has aspirations of turning her subsistence farmland into a commercial one, so that she can generate better income and take greater care of her family's financial needs. 

She is seeking a loan to buy dairy goats and farm inputs. The dairy goat investment will start paying off almost immediately as she will be selling the milk at the local market. As for the farm inputs, she hopes better quality seeds and manure will lead to greater yield during the harvesting season. 

Income generated from these investments will be rolled back into the business to fuel growth and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats and farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a smallholder farmer based in the Chuka area of Kenya. The Chuka area has extremely fertile soil for agriculture but it experiences seasonal rains. Most crop farmers have implemented irrigation farming to keep their crops green and healthy. One of these farmers is Grace. She is a married mother of two who grows vegetables, fodder, and bananas on her one-acre piece of land. 

Grace is afraid that having one tank on the farm is not sufficient. She is seeking a loan to buy another water tank. With two tanks, she can store double the quantity of water which will last twice as long. This investment will guarantee production of crops throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity has a small piece of land in Mathira village in Kenya where she lives and farms. She keeps dairy cows and grows a wide variety of food crops. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home. She started farming many years ago and through the years she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

The biggest growth constraint for Charity is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. She also plans to use the money to buy feed for her livestock. 

With your lending, Charity will be able to use high quality farm inputs and feed to plant her crops and feed her animals respectively. This, she hopes, will result in a significant increase in productivity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy feeds and construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Buhanyiri Group

texts.fr: Saasita est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Bahanyiri», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 32 ans, mariée à un infirmier, mère 2 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de divers pagnes  dans un marché  de la place depuis 5 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter 80 pièces de pagnes. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Saasita is a businesswoman and member of the community borrowing group called «Bahanyiri». She is a client of MFI Hekima, aged 32, married to a male nurse, and the mother of two children, both enrolled in school. She has been selling various sorts of African print cloth in a local marketplace for five years. 

Saasita began her business with money received from her husband. She is going to buy 80 lengths of  pagne (cloth).  She hopes to grow her working capital, keep her children in school, and feed them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by the conventional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 80 lengths of pagne (brightly colored African print cloth)

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has a 0.25 acre farm in the Kerugoya area of Kenya where she lives and farms with her family. She is a single mother of 2 children and keeps poultry and goats and grows rice for subsistence. The big challenge is, subsistence farming pays just enough for survival. To turn her rice-growing commercial, she needs external capital. In the picture, she is seen standing beside a rice milling machine, her first step to go commercial. 

Mercy is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to buy farm inputs. By investing in quality seeds and fertilizer, there will be an increase in quality and quantity of yields. Having a large amount of quality yield of rice will give her an edge when negotiating for better prices from buyers. The income generated from this investment will enable her to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a smallholder mixed-farmer from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She lives and conducts mixed-farming on a small piece of land in Mwerua location. Her main income sources are milk, vegetables and cereal produce. 

Grace is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES to buy cereal and farm inputs. She plans to use 60% of the loan amount to aggregate cereal produce from local farmers which she will later sell at a profit. The rest of the borrowed money will be used by her to buy quality seeds and fertilizer for the growing of food crops. 

The impact of this loan investment will be improved livelihood and raised the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereal and farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inventory: a bale of school satchels and a bale of belts.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a smallholder farmer from Kerugoya area of Kenya who is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES to buy farm inputs, poultry and animal feed. Many years ago, Milka started farming to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. To date, she is still a farmer doing dairy, poultry and horticultural farming. Throughout the years, her farm has had low productivity. This is because she lacks enough capital to invest in modern farming techniques. 

With your loan, however, Milkah plans to buy quality seeds and fertilizer to improve the quality and quantity of her crop harvest, feed rich in nutrients for improved health and productivity of her domestic animals and more poultry to increase the quantity of the poultry products she takes to the market. 

The impact of your loan will be improved production levels on Milkah's farm and elevated quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, poultry and feed.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Matutuine província de Maputo tem 38 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade, apenas 2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2012. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, barrotes e mais. Para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende fazer a vedação da sua casa construindo muro.
texts.en:
Hortencia was born in Matutine in the province of Maputo. She is 38 years old and unmarried. She has three young children, only two of whom is of school age. She is not financially responsible for anyone else.
She started working with Hluvuku in 2012. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, and she intends to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, beams, and more  to continue the construction on her house.
In the future she plans to enclose her house by building a wall.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, beams, and more.

loans.name: Khatijamo

texts.ru: Хатичамо жительнице района Хамадони 32 года. Она замужем и имеет детей школьного возраста. Еще с юности Хатичамо вместе со своими братьями занималась разведением сельскохозяйственных животных. Имея большой опыт в этой сфере, она со своим мужем закупила несколько голов крупнорогатого скота для разведения и дальнейшей продажи их на рынке. Но в связи с трудным финансовым положением ее семьи ей нахватает денег на покупку телят и комбикорма для них. Хатичамо просит Вас войти в ее положение и помочь ей в осуществлении ее планов.
texts.en: Khatijamo is a resident of the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  She is 32, married, and the mother of school-aged children.  She and her brothers became involved in animal husbandry when they were still very young.  Later on, as she had gathered a good deal of experience in this field of work, she and her husband bought a few head of cattle for breeding and further resale at the market.  But because of the family's difficult financial situation, Khatijamo has been unable to buy calves and animal feed.  She is kindly asking you to put yourself in her situation and to help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase a few calves.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Mixed farming is an important source of income and employment for smallholder Kenyan farmers like Rachel. She is 31 years old and has been happily married to Maina for the last nine years; they have two children. 

For the past five years Rachel has operated a one-and-a-half-acre mixed farm in Kangari village located in the Central Province of Kenya. She keeps dairy cattle, poultry, and grows maize, vegetables, and other crops on her farm. She also engages in other side businesses for additional income. She is constantly upgrading and introducing new ways and approaches of doing business to make her farm more sustainable for the environment while still being profitable. 

Rachel is seeking a loan to fully incorporate pig farming on her farm. With your funding, the introduction of pig farming will create significant value for Rachel's business. Pig farming in Thika is a very profitable business since there is a ready market for pork. Rachel will never have a problem in selling pork and this will translate to immediate profits. Your loan will elevate the quality of life for Rachel and her family.

Lend to an enterprising Kenyan woman who has great ambitions!

loans.use: To start raising pigs

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is an enterprising and tenacious woman with great dreams that she has been trying to cultivate and meet. She was born in 1963, and started mixed farming 15 years ago in Mwangathia village in Nkubu area of Kenya. On her farm, she raises dairy cattle and poultry. She also grows various types of crops. However, over the years, the mother of 4 has developed a biased and passionate interest in beef cattle farming. Evaline is seeking a loan to buy beef cows. With your loan, she is planning to purchase a beef cow that she will keep and later sell to meat-processing companies. Lack of capital is the major challenge standing between her present state and her future aspirations. Part of the income generated from this investment will go to loan repayment. Profits will be ploughed back into the business to settle mounting costs and expenses. When she was asked how the loan will benefit her family, Evaline replied, "It will increase family assets hence financial security."

loans.use: to purchase beef cattle.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Milkah, a smallholder farmer from Kerugoya area of Kenya. She practices dairy and horticultural farming. She has aspirations of making big returns for her family from farming. 

In the recent past, one of her cows delivered a calf and she was disappointed that she could not provide decent housing for the calf. She is applying for a 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs and construction materials for a cow pen. She plans to spend 60% of the loan amount to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to grow more crops. With the rest of the money, she plans to construct a cowshed that will shelter her animals from harsh and unforgiving weather. 

The impact of this loan investment will be improved productivity and animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and construction materials for a cow pen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily owns a small farm in the Molo area of Kenya where she lives and works with her family. She keeps domestic animals and grows fodder and food crops. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home and uses the income to grow the business and pay for household expenses. Lily started farming many years ago and through the years, she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

Lily is seeking a loan of KES 62,500 to buy improved seeds and fertilizers to grow more potatoes on her farm. The biggest growth constraint for her is lack of access to capital. 

With your loan, Lily will buy agricultural inputs necessary for improving her farm's productivity and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ranito

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga província de Inhambane tem 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e blocos. Para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende erguer capoeiras para a criação de frangos e abrir um salão beleza para sua esposa.
texts.en:
Ranito was born in Massinga in the province of Inhambane. He is 32 years old and lives with his partner. They have four young children who are all in school, and Ranito also takes care of his niece, who lives with them.
He started working with Hluvuku in 2013. This is his third loan with Hluvuku, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.
In the future he plans to build chicken coops and open a beauty salon for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Mansajena província de Gaza, tem 45 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 6 filhos, apenas 5 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com Hluvuku em 2009. Este é o seu 9º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende adquirir insumos agrícolas como: adubos e sementes de milho, para satisfazer os seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende melhorar a sua casa, adquirir uma viatura para transporte familiar mudar o sistema de rega usando uma motobomba para o sistema solar que mais económico.
texts.en:
Wilson was born in Mansajena in the province of Gaza. He is 45 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. He is not financially responsible for anyone else.
She started working with Hluvuku in 2009. This is his ninth loan with Hluvuku, which he will use to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seed corn to meet his customers’ needs.
In the future he plans to improve his home, buy a vehicle for his family, and switch his irrigation system from an electrical pump to a solar system, which will be cheaper.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and seed corn.

loans.name: Sofia Group

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de pan casero.
Ella es buena madre, amable, comprometida con su trabajo, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, considerada zona peri urbana. Creada debido a un desborde del río, en la que más de 3.000 familias quedaron sin hogar, y con las pocas pertenencias que llevaban tuvieron que asentarse en unos terrenos baldíos, para empezar una nueva vida.  De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Isabel es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (la primera de la derecha, viste polera blanca a rayas horizontales de colores). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller mecánico, cerrajería, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes y venta de refrescos para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de pan casero. Con la ayuda de su pareja, ella se encarga de hornear diferentes variedades de panes para luego realizar la venta de forma ambulante, “horneamos todas la variedades de pan, esto depende si se encuentran todos los ingredientes en el mercado…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el pan se vende constantemente, al desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos como; variedades de harinas, manteca, leche, huevo, levadura, etc. Su sueño es ampliar su panadería, su negocio es rentable porque el pan se vende diariamente, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para hornear pan casero y vender de forma ambulante. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que lleva con esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de harinas e insumos de  cocina para continuar horneando pan casero.
texts.en:
Isabel, 42, lives with her husband and 2 children, 12- and 10-years old.  She operates a bakery business.  She is a hard worker, friendly, responsible and always there for her children.  She operates the business on the city's south side, in a neighborhood that is only partly developed.  There are more than 3,000 families without homes here, many displaced by river flooding and forced to settle with their remaining belongings on open land.  The climate is sub-tropical with day-time temperatures that vary from 21- to 35-degrees, Centigrade.

Isabel has brown eyes and long, dark hair knotted in the back.  (She is standing on the right in the photo, wearing a striped blouse.)  She speaks Guaraní, her native language, and Spanish.  Her husband works at the bakery, as well, and her children are still in school.  Their house is made of wood and has a metal roof and cement floor.  The house is plumbed and has electricity and running water.  

The members of the Sofia community bank banded together to support their small businesses.  They operate a range of businesses that include: auto repair; locksmith services; juice sales; cell phone cards; perfume sales; and soft drink sales.  Isabel and her husband make and sell homemade breads. They make the bread and other baked goods at home and then go out, working as street vendors, to sell what they make from place to place.  "We make all kinds of bread", she says, "depending on what ingredients are available in the markets".  Sales are steady, she adds, because people always need bread but the couple lack the capital to buy all of the supplies that they need.  Isabel is applying for a loan that she will use to buy flour, butter, milk, eggs, yeast, etc.  She has operated the business for 5 years and this is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.pt:
Senhora Deolinda tem 44 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 5 filhos frequentando o ensino secundário e primário, é negociante, vive em casa própria e sustenta uma sobrinha.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de diversos sumos, cerveja, carne, para revender em sua mercearia.
No futuro pretende reabilitar a sua casa e aumentar o volume de mercadorias de modo a colocar mais produtos junto as comunidades.
 O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Deolinda is 44 years old, married, and the mother of five children who are in primary and secondary school. She has a business, lives in her own home, and is also supporting a niece.
She will use this loan to buy products such as beer and meat to sell in her shop.
In the future she plans to refurbish her home and increase the volume of stock she carries so she can offer more products to the community.
Her biggest goal is to pay back this loan promptly so she can request more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy products such as beer and meat to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto es un hombre de 55 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 12 años, y su negocio es la confección de sábanas. 
El es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, la región de mayor crecimiento, representada mayormente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal, es la zona más importante de producción hidrocarburífera. Situada a una altura de 437 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados. 
Jacinto es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y juega fútbol, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de sábanas, modelos exclusivos de edredones,  protectores de colchones, fundas de almohada y otros, “mi trabajo se distingue de los demás por ofrecer diseños originales de la mejor calidad, mis clientes me prefieren por la puntualidad en la entrega de las sábanas y demás productos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una cartera de clientes establecida, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de tela. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para vender sus confecciones, el desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de tela por rollo para la confección de sábanas para hospital. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Jacinto solicita un préstamo para la compra de rollos de tela para la confección de sábanas para hospital para abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Jacinto is a 55 year-old man who lives with his partner.   He has 2 children aged 10 and 12.  Jacinto has a business making bed sheets.  He is a good father and is enterprising, independent, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking.  He is developing his business in an area in the southern part of the city, which is the fastest growing region.  Here the economy is dominated by agriculture and forestry, and this is also the most important area for hydrocarbon production.  This area is located 437 meters above sea level and has a hot tropical climate, with a daytime temperature that varies between 21-34 degrees Centigrade.

Jacinto has a dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, a short stature, and a slim physique.  His native language is Guarani, which he speaks in the area.  He also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in his business.  He shares his life with his partner, who is a merchant, and their children, who attend school and play soccer.  They live in a rented room built of brick and cement, with a tin roof and cement floor.  Their dwelling has drinking water, electricity, and sewer service.               

Jacinto has a business making bed sheets, exclusive models of comforters, mattress covers, pillow cases, and other items.  "My work is distinguished from others because I offer original designs of the best quality, and my customers prefer me because I deliver my sheets and other products punctually," he comments.  

The advantage of his business is that he has an established customer base. The disadvantage is that he lacks the capital to buy fabric.  His dream is to open a store to sell his products. He wants to expand his business by purchasing fabric by the roll to make bed sheets for a hospital.  This is his first loan with the institution in the 2 years that he has been doing this work. 

This is why Jacinto is requesting a loan to buy rolls of fabric to make bed sheets for a hospital so that he can open a store.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric to make bed sheets

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Senhora Maria tem 49 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estão ainda na sua responsabilidade, frequentando o ensino primário e superior respectivamente, é negociante e vive em casa da mãe e sustenta 1 neto.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de batata, arroz, farinha, feijão, carnes para confeição de refeições para a venda.
No futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio construindo mais takaway bar e construir casa própria.
O seu desafio é de conquistar mais clientes visto que o mercado está muito renhido e comprar carro para o transporte pessoal e de mercadorias.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, is not married, and has three children, two of whom are still her responsibility because they are in primary and secondary school. She runs a business and lives in her mother’s home, and also supports one grandson.
She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, rice, flour, beans, and meat to prepare food to sell.
In the future she plans to expand her business by building a takeaway stall and to build herself a home of her own.
Her biggest goal is to bring in more customers, since the market is tight, and to buy a car for transporting people and goods.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, rice, flour, beans, and meat to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en: Elosy is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Kerugoya. She comes from a really humble family and has been through many hard times, but she has accomplished finding her way in life by working really hard, 7 days a week, and by creating her own mixed farm. She started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kerugoya and today, this humble mum sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and she is proud to wake up every day to milk her cow. Although she makes profits by selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax, and also prevents them from coming down with diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather such as rain. Elosy believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Elosy thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy.

loans.name: Pepukai Group

texts.en:
“Age is but a number, it cannot be a restricting factor in working and continuously developing yourself.” 
These are the words of Joyce, one of the remaining members of Pepukai Group. The two mature women who make up Pepukai group are in their fifth loan cycle with Thrive Microfinance. The group joined Thrive in 2012. Joyce is a cross-border trader who buys clothing, bedding, and kitchenware for resale in Harare and surrounding rural areas. 

Joyce has been able to grow her business and have some personal achievements while benefitting from the loans availed to her. She has been able to buy herself a kitchen unit, put tiles in her house, and help her husband add more rooms to their family home. The training sessions she attended at Thrive Microfinance benefitted her immensely. Now she has learnt the importance of savings and how to periodically assess her business. In the future, she wants to keep saving money to send her school-going child to university.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Flor De Patuju Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de 2, 10, 13, 19 y 20 años, y su negocio es el servicio de imprenta y serigrafía.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, activa, constante, dedicada, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘mutualista´ un lugar céntrico caracterizado por el cambódromo, espacio con capacidad para 30mil personas y mil metros de largo, dónde se realiza; el corso de carnavales, desfiles y otras actividades culturales. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (de pie, la primera de la derecha, viste blusa negra/blanco a rayas). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su esposo que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y el menor que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar sus ingresos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de comida, venta de flores, costura, venta de huevo, venta de refrescos y servicio de llamadas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es el servicio de imprenta y serigrafía; y se ocupa de imprimir, tarjetas, volantes, facturas, notas, invitaciones, posters, etiquetas, boletos, etc., “Ofrecemos a nuestros clientes el mejor servicio junto al mejor producto del mercado, mejorando día a día para poder así ser la mejor opción para todas las empresas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con contratos continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de trabajo, como tinta, papel y otros. Su sueño es tener su local propio, ella desea realizar la compra de material de impresión para cumplir con sus contratos pendientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de impresión para cumplir con sus contratos pendientes y conseguir un local más grande.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 37 year old married woman who has five children aged 2, 10, 13, 19 and 20 years old. She has a printing and screen printing business.

She is a good mother, understanding, active, consistent, dedicated, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is located in the 'Mutualista´ neighborhood, a central area which houses the Cambódromo, a space with capacity for 30,000 people. It is a thousand meters long and Carnival festivities, parades and other cultural activities are held here. It has a hot sub-tropical climate with a daily temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Carmen is dark-skinned, has dark eyes, long black hair that she ties back, short and robust in build. Her native language is Guaraní which she uses in her home and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (In the photo she is the first person standing to the right wearing a black and white striped blouse).

She shares her life with her husband who works and her children who study in school. Her youngest one is not yet school age. They live in a room they built themselves of wood with a metal roof and dirt floor that has electricity, running water and sewage.

The need to improve their income led her to form a group of people with businesses like selling second hand clothing, selling flowers, sewing, selling eggs, selling soft drinks and a telephone calling service to request a loan to improve their businesses. Her business provides printing and screen printing and prints cards, flyers, bills, notes, invitations, posters, labels, tickets, etc. "We offer our clients the best service along with the best product on the market, improving day by day so it can become the best option for all businesses" she commented. The advantage of her business is that it has continuous contracts and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy work materials like ink, paper and others.

Her dream is to have her own shop. She wants to purchase printing materials to complete some outstanding contracts. This is her first loan from the institution in the 7 years she has been in business. For these reasons Carmen is requesting a loan to purchase printing materials to fill outstanding contracts and get a larger shop.

loans.use: to buy printing materials to fill some outstanding contracts and get a larger shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the nutritional and living situation of her young children by adding two dairy cows to their agricultural activity.

loans.name: Prene

texts.en:
Prene is a 60-year-old villager and a married mother of three who wants to buy 25 goats with your loan. For the past ten years, her focus has been on establishing a little rural activity including agriculture and livestock. Currently, she has only one goat and one young dairy cow. In the 5500 square feet of agricultural land she owns, she has mostly grapevines. She sells approximately ten quintals (1000 kg) of white and red grapes a year and also plants some seasonal veggies for family use.

"The retirement pension of $286/month that both my husband and I make is not enough to buy any medications that we need now in our age. Thus, doing something extra will help us put aside some money for the days to come. We have three children, but they have their families and live in the city," said Prene to the loan officer while showing them around the stable and the goat she has.

loans.use: to add 25 goats to the one goat she has

loans.name: Floresha

texts.en:
Floresha is in her 60 and a married mother and a member of the vulnerable ethnic community of Egyptian Albanian.  She has three children who are all grown up now, yet they are not doing well financially to help their mother. They are very poor and she is very poor also and this is the case with the majority of this vulnerable community. She lives in the city of Korce that has been embracing the interracial marriages between white and Egyptian community for generations and these eloping have proved to be successful and lasting.  
Floresha needs your compassion and financial help because she has to go to a health specialist because not long ago she went through some surgery, yet lately she has been feeling not very well. She and her husband receive retirement pension of $87 and $144 both.

loans.use: to cover for a visitation to a health specialist since she had some surgery months ago and at the moment doesn't feel very well

loans.name: Doralba

texts.es: Doralba de 45 años, inició su negocio de confecciones para aportar a los gastos familiares, así mismo esta emprendedora mujer adicionalmente de su actividad principal, maneja otros negocios como el comercio de variedades, minutos a celular y recargas.  Ella reside en un barrio del municipio de soledad en compañía de su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en la actualidad cuenta con 15 años dedicada a sus negocios y  gracias a ello ha podido ofrecer bienestar a su familia.  Ella confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir, sin embargo su especialidad es la ropa deportiva que provee a colegios y para mejorar sus utilidades está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar telas e insumos de confección al por mayor.  Esta inversión le permitirá acercarse a su meta de fortalecer su capital de trabajo y sus ventas.
texts.en: Doralba is 45 years old and began her business creating clothing in order to support her family's expenses. So this enterprising woman also manages other businesses selling household goods, cell phone cards and rechargeable cards. She lives in a neighborhood of Soledad with her husband and three children. They have had their businesses for 15 years and thanks to their work she has been able to take care of her family. She makes all kinds of clothing, with her specialty being athletic clothing she provides to high schools. In order to improve her business she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has done through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy fabrics and sewing supplies at wholesale. This investment will enable her to get closer to her goal of strengthening her working capital and her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
Ana es una joven mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 1 mes y de2, 4, 6 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica. 
Ella es buena madre, cariñosa, amable, optimista, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por los orígenes de sus pobladores; tribus ayoreas nativas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del área e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio, de clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Ana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (la primera de la derecha, sentada con su bebé). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores se encuentran en edad escolar, los 2 que siguen aún no están en edad escolar y el último es un recién nacido, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación para pagar los gastos posnatales de su recién nacido, la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; pintura en tela, venta de velas, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cosméticos por catálogo, venta de empanadas, servicio de reparación de electrodomésticos y venta de desayunos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, labor que realiza de lunes a sábado a la hora de almuerzo en su puesto de venta fijo al aire libre. La comidas tradicionales más demandadas son; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), y otros, “esta actividad me brinda la oportunidad de poder brindarle a mi bebé la atención médica que necesita…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; aceite, arroz, fideo, yuca, carne, etc. Su sueño es ver sano y fuerte a su hijo recién nacido, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, arroz, fideo huevo, carne, papa, chuño, etc., para continuar con negocio ya que sus hijos menores le dificultan la actividad. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que lleva desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para vender comida y pagar los gastos posnatales de su recién nacido.
texts.en:
Ana is a young mother of 33.  She lives with her partner and they have 5 children of 8, 6, 4, and 2 years old, and a 1-month old.  She sells local cuisine.  She is a good mother and a caring, friendly, optimistic, perseverant, responsible, and hard-working woman.  She carries out her business in the 'Plan 3000' Zone, which is characterized by the origins of its settlers, the Ayoreo people native to the area and relocated miners from the West who started manufacturing and trade in the area.  The climate is hot, sub-tropical, and very humid, with a temperature that varies during the day from 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.  

Ana has a dark complexion, strong build, grey-brown eyes, and long black hair that she ties up.  She speaks Guaraní, her native language, with her family and she speaks Spanish with the general population and when she does business.  She is the first one on the right in the photo, sitting down with her baby.  She enjoys her life in the company of her partner, who is a construction worker, and her children.  The 2 oldest in school, but the 2 middle children aren't in school yet.  The youngest child is a newborn.  They live in a rented apartment made of wood with a corrugated iron roof and dirt floor that has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.  

Her desire to improve her life and pay for the postnatal expenses of her newborn led her to form a credit group of people with businesses in diverse areas such as fabric painting, candle sales, secondhand clothing sales, cosmetic sales from catalogs, empanada sales, appliance repair service, and a breakfast restaurant, who want to take out a loan and improve their businesses.  She sells traditional food, a job that she does from Monday to Saturday at breakfast time from her fixed outdoor stall.  The dishes that are most in demand are: majadito de charque (dehydrated meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro (soup made of dehydrated meat, meat cut into small pieces, yuca, and egg), and Sopa de Remojado (bone soup), among other dishes.  She notes that this business provides her with the opportunity to provide the necessary medical attention for her baby.  The advantage of her business is that she sells her products daily, and the disadvantage is that she doesn't have enough capital to buy ingredients such as oil, rice, noodles, yuca, and meat, among others.  

Her dream is to see her newborn son healthy and strong.  She wants to expand her business by buying kitchen supplies such as oil, rice, eggs, meat, potatoes, and potato starch, among other things, to continue her business, since having younger children makes the business more difficult.  This is her second sequence of loans with this institution in the 2 years that she has been in business.  For these reasons, Ana is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to sell food and pay for the postnatal care of her newborn.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies to sell food and pay for the postnatal care of her newborn.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 52-year-old farmer from Nandi Hills area of Kenya. The married mother of five children does dairy farming for a living. Her work brings home an important source of income and the children help with the work. 
Pauline applied for a loan because she wants give her cowshed a facelift. The current structure is old and has poor drainage system. With your help, she hopes to replace the old parts of the structure and work on the drainage system.
Through this loan, she aims to improve the hygiene and welfare of the animals.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Junither

texts.en:
Junither is a 28-year-old farmer from Makimeny village in Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and sells milk at a local market near her residence for income. Junither is passionate and optimistic about her business. She is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for her cows. 
With the loan, she will purchase building tools and materials for the cowshed construction. She also plans to use locally available materials to drive down the costs. 
The most important benefits that the cowshed will give her are improved health and productivity of the animals. Supporting improvement of Junither's livelihood will go a long way towards uplifting the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline's objective is to improve her quality of life and live a dignified life. These objectives prompted Jackline to begin mixed farming. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling different varieties of food crops from her farmland and milk. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kapsowar area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry and build poultry structures. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved; she will be able to buy more poultry and her poultry will have a comfortable place to stay in. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry and build poultry structures.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 22-year-old farmer from Kipchimchim village in Kenya. She does dairy farming for a living. Her work brings home an important source of income. Despite her tender age, she is fired up to leave a mark on the lives of her loved ones and set a proper foundation for her bright future. 

Caroline is applying for a loan to purchase cow feed and materials for building a cowshed. Through this loan investment, she seeks to improve the health and productivity of her dairy animals. This will result in reduced health care costs and improved milk production, both recipes for greater profits. 
By having a more profitable farm, Caroline will generate enough income to repay the loan, grow the business and meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a woman with all the spirit for work, who resides in a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. For the past five years, Jane has been involved in mixed farming.
