Her primary sources of income has been planting different varieties of crops and some personal business she engages in to earn additional income. Jane has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She passionately loves dairy farming. Villagers have nicknamed her Mrs. Cow. Jane sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it is a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This milk production will immediately translate to increased profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan. The extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Jane is very visionary, and she intends to start adding value to her milk business. All that she patiently waits for is for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es:
Rebeca es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 16 años y su negocio es la tienda de barrio y librería. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, activa, atenta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores, en la mayoría; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, situado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Rebeca es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (sentada al centro, viste blusa negra con flores blancas). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación por la necesidad de generar mejores ingresos para su familia, la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de moto taxi, artesanía en cuero, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de refrescos, confección de sábanas, venta de medicina natural venta de desayunos,  para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la tienda de barrio y librería; ella atiende una tienda de barrio en su mismo domicilio dónde vende alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; refrescos, pan azúcar, golosinas, etc., en el otro costado de la tienda cuenta con una pequeña librería con materiales como: cartulinas, bolígrafos, gomas, reglas, marcadores, hojas, cuadernos, etc., “inicié mi negocio con mi tienda de barrio, debido a los pedidos de los clientes empecé a ampliar la librería…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes le realizan pedidos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para cumplir con los pedidos y surtir la tienda de abarrotes. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de sus vecinos, ella desea realiza la compra de material de librería y surtir su tienda para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rebeca solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de librería y abastecer su tienda de barrio para mejorar sus ventas y cumplir con sus pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has a 16-year-old son. Her business is a convenience store and stationery shop. She is a good mother, independent, constant, active, attentive, responsible and very hardworking. She has her business in the "Plan 3000" area of town, which is known for the multiculturalism of its inhabitants, who are mostly Aymara, Quechua, and Guarani, and which is located in the southern part of the city. Immigrants took over the place and created a commercial area that is in constant growth. The city has a warm, subtropical climate with a temperature that varies from 21° to 35° Celcius [70° to 95° Fahrenheit] during the day.

Rebeca has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she ties up. She is short and robust. Her mother tongue is Guarani, which she uses with her family, and speaks Spanish due to common practice and because of her business. She sits at the center of the picture, wearing a black blouse with white flowers. She enjoys life accompanied by her partner, who works as a driver, and her son who still goes to school. They live in a rental room made of wood, and which has a tin roof. They have drinking water, electricity, and sewerage. Her wish to get ahead so she could generate a greater income for her family led her to form a group of people with businesses such as: motorcycle-taxi service, leather crafts, second-hand clothes sales, soda sales, manufacture of sheets, natural medicine sales, and breakfast services. By creating this group, they can request loans and improve their businesses.

Rebeca runs her convenience store and stationery shop from her own home, where she sells food and household essentials such as sodas, sugar bread, candy, etc. On the other side of her store she has a small stationery shop with items such as cardboards, pens, erasers, rulers, markers, paper, notebooks, etc. " I started my business with only the convenience store, and due to requests from my customers I began to expand into a stationery shop," she says. The good part of her business is that her customers make orders, the bad part is the lack of capital to meet the demands and to supply her store.

Her dream is to expand her business so she can increase her sales and satisfy the needs of her neighbors. It is for these reasons that Rebeca wishes to purchase stationery supplies and to stock her convenience store so she can improve her sales and meet her customers' pending requests. This is the first loan sequence with the institution in the one year she has been doing this activity.

loans.use: to purchase stationery supplies and to stock her convenience store so she can improve her sales and meet her customers' pending requests.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a smallholder farmer from Kapsowar area of Kenya. She practices dairy farming; her major source of income is milk. Throughout the years, she has experienced challenges keeping the movement of her dairy animals under control. She has tried various methods before but the solutions we not very elegant until now. 
Rosa is seeking a loan to buy materials for fencing. She want to put a fence along the boundary of her property and within the paddocks. Through this loan, the animals can allow pasture to grow on some parts of the farm while they graze on other parts. This will lead to the availability of pasture throughout the year and save Rosa great costs on purchasing animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy fencing materials.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en: Selly, 32, is a smallholder dairy farmer from Makutano village based in the Kitale region of Kenya. Selly is hardworking and determined to make it in the world of farming. The land she owns is big enough to support more than just dairy animals. She is planning to make use of the available space to start growing vegetables and fruits. Starting a horticultural farm is very costly, especially for smallholder rural farmers. Besides securing land space, a farmer needs to invest in intensive labour, farm tools, and farm inputs. The farmer will also have to construct a store/granary for her produce. Selly is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to venture into horticulture. With your loan investment into her business, Selly will have an alternative source of income besides dairy in the near future. This will not only make her family better off but also open new possibilities for her to diversify further in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a group leader of three, he is standing in the middle raising his hand. He is 40 years old and lives in a village named “Dera Bee Wali”, which is situated in District Gujranwala in Pakistan. 
He cultivates wheat, rice and vegetables in his farm to feed his family. He is a poor farmer lacking financial resources for agricultural supplies.

He and his group members are requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, better  quality seeds and fuel for their rice crop. This loan will help them improving their farm productivity, and they will be able to improve the living standard of their families. They are committed to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad has over 25 years of experience in rice farming. His parents passed it down to him. Despite his limited income, the farming business enables him to respond to some of his family's needs. He intends to do a lot more work to make a good harvest, so he can improve his day-to-day life. He is the group leader raising his hand in the photo.
He is requesting a loan to buy 4 sacks of quality seeds, 19 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for his rice crop. He plans to reinvest his profit in business and to pay his children's tuition.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Kallen

texts.en: A decade ago, Kallen started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Mukuuni a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Kallen enjoys poultry farming and dairy farming above all other activities. The main challenges she faces with this type of farming are disease outbreaks and expensive dairy feed. Kallen is asking for a loan to buy a quality breed of dairy goat. To her, raising goats is an enjoyable and lucrative farming experience. She understands the challenges that come with dairy goat farming and the market uncertainties. This knowledge has influenced her strategic plans to incorporate a few measures beforehand. Dairy goat farming is very profitable and Kallen will benefit from goat milk fetching high prices in the local and international markets. She plans to use the income from this investment to repay the loan and to pay for her children education. When she was asked how the loan would benefit her family, she said, “I will be able to educate my children and also feed my family”.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela una señora con 33 años de edad, que desde hace poco inicio su primer negocio, un taller de confecciones, el cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside.

Para Marcela no hay nada imposible, solicito un crédito con el cual comprara mas maquinaria y ampliara el lugar de trabajo. Con esto espera poder brindarle trabaja a las personas que más lo necesitan.

Su sueño seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su casa y poder pagarle la educación a su hijo, pues le preocupa su bienestar. Sabe que de la  mano de Interactuar y los prestadores del portal Kiva lo lograra.
texts.en:
Marcela is woman of 33 who a short time ago started her first business, a dressmaking workshop located in the living room of the house where she lives.
For Marcela, nothing is impossible. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy more equipment and expand her work area. With this she hopes to offer work to those people that need it most.

Her dream is to continue working so that she can improve her housing conditions and be able to pay for her son's education, as she is concerned for his well-being. She knows that with a helping hand from Interactuar and the help of Kiva lenders, she will achieve it.

loans.use: To buy equipment and expand her shop.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is the men raising his hand in the photo, he is 41 years old, married with 8 dependents. He lives with his family in Allah Ditta village, Pakistan. He is a farmer and he grows rice and wheat in his land. He sells agricultural products to earn a living and support his family.

After attending the training on farming, he and his group members acquired knowledge and skills in farm management which can enable them to improve the quality and quantity of their production.
The group therefore requests for a small loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and better quality seeds. With this loan, they will be able to increase their output on their farms and be able to improve the quality and quantity of their crops.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam is a 35 years old farmer with 5 family members. He lives in k.N Shah, a native village in Pakistan. He has over 10 years of experience in farming. His parents passed it down to him. He is the leader of his group of three, raising his hand in the photo. He is an honest farmer that grows rice and wheat in his land. He meets his family’s day to day expenses through the sale of his crops.
He is requesting a loan to buy 5 sacks of quality seeds, 15 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for his rice crop. He  wants to use his profits to support his business. He also plans to take care of his family and to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: It is common to have a sheep farm in Kenya, but starting your own business is something else entirely. Anne is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kapsowar, a remote village in Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years. To earn a decent living, Anne sells different varieties of crops and engages in numerous small personal businesses. Only recently, she started seeing how she could make more money through sheep farming. In the past, Anne saw raising sheep as just a hobby. She wants to sell sheep meat and wool but assumes that the quantity she produces will not make economic sense. She needs to purchase more sheep. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand her business. Anne is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva's lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, in order to purchase sheep of a good-quality breed. Future proceeds from the commercialization of Joy's sheep farm are already committed to pay for her children’s education. In the long run, she is confident that her efforts will translate into a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep of a good-quality breed.

loans.name: Amira Rosa

texts.es: Amira de 62 años, reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge, ella es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad a quienes ofreció bienestar.   Como en su familia han sido comerciantes de diferentes artículos, desde niña aprendió de este oficio y se dedicó a esta actividad en la que cuenta con treinta años de experiencia ofreciéndole a sus conocidos, amigos, vecinos y familiares artículos para el hogar, como abanicos, baterías de cocina, planchas y demás, así mismo ofrece por intermedio de catálogos artículos de su oferta como colonias, cremas corporales, maquillaje y productos de cuidado personal.  En la actualidad necesita una inyección de capital para su negocio puesto que sus clientes le han solicitado unos encargos de artículos, ella está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará mercancías varias como cosméticos, perfumes y productos de belleza. Amira ha logrado surgir gracias a su empeño y dedicación, también por la confianza que han depositado sus proveedores los cuales le dan crédito y a quienes también les realiza sus compras de contado; así mismo ella brinda facilidad de pago a sus clientes por lo que le es necesario manejar un buen flujo de caja para cumplir a sus proveedores.  Su meta a futuro es mantener su negocio surtido y continuar apoyando a su cónyuge en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Amira is 62 years old.  She lives with her partner in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla.  She is the mother of 3 adult children whose wellbeing she looked after.  There have been merchants of various products in her family, so she learned about being a salesman since she was a girl.  She decided to dedicate herself to this trade since she has 30 years of experience offering home goods such as fans, kitchen batteries, irons, and more to her acquaintances, friends, neighbors, and family members, as well as selling items through catalogs such as cologne, body cream, makeup, and personal care products.  

Currently, she needs an injection of capital for her business, since her customers have put in some orders for merchandise.  She is applying from her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which she will use to buy various merchandise such as cosmetics, perfume, and beauty products.  Amira has been able to rise thanks to her determination and dedication, and also because of the trust that her suppliers have put in her who have allowed her credit or cash payments.  This allows her to facilitate payment for her customers because it is necessary to maintain a good cash flow to pay back her suppliers.  Her future goal is to keep her business supplied and to continue helping her partner with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise such as cosmetics, perfume, and beauty products

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
Ver el progreso de José, alienta a todos a seguir sus sueños, puesto que poco a poco ha ido avanzando en su cafetín. Más ahora que ha logrado invertir más, pues anteriormente solicitó un crédito para comprar jugos, agua, gaseosas, golosinas y útiles escolares. Cabe resaltar que los resultados fueron más que positivos, por esta razón agradece a todos los que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior, puesto que como padre soltero, sabe lo importante de salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
Ahora, este comerciante de cuarenta años de edad, se siente más que motivado por seguir creciendo. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, entre otros granos básicos para alimentar su cafetín de comida. Esto le permitirá seguir ofreciendo comida de calidad y así seguir en colegio donde le evalúan como excelente comerciante. En sus planes está establecer una librería en su casa.
texts.en:
Seeing Jose's progress encourages everyone to follow their dreams, since little by little he has been moving forward with his snack stand.  More so now that he has managed to invest more, since previously he requested a loan to buy juice, water, soft drinks, candy, and school supplies.  It is worth mentioning that the results were more than positive.  For this reason he thanks everyone who supported him with this previous loan, since as a single parent, he knows it is important to support his small family.  

Now, this forty-year-old businessman feels more motivated to continue growing.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy fruit, rice, sugar, and beans as well as other basic grains to stock his snack stand.  This will allow him to continue offering quality food and thus continue at the school where he is considered an excellent businessman.  In his plans is establishing a bookstore in his house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, rice, sugar, beans, as well as other basic grains.

loans.name: Rana's Group

texts.en:
Rana is a married, 27 year old young men raising his hand in the photo. He has 5 dependents in his family. He inherited the business of farming from his parents, who taught him everything about growing rice and wheat. He is seeking your help because agricultural materials cost a lot and he couldn't afford it. Especially the costs usually incur when the crops are growing and he has no income. With this loan, He can buy 2 sacks of quality rice seeds, 18 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for his rice crop.

His goal is to maintain and expand his crop land. He plans to use his profits to support his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es:
BEATRIS es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Ella es buena madre, decidida, activa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, al borde del cristalino caudal del agua, paseo típico de fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales locales en donde se puede degustar la tradicional comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas. De clima cálido, sub tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
BEATRIS  es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (de pie al centro, viste polera amarilla). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como ayudante de camión y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, servicio de lavandería, taller eléctrico, venta de artesanía, taller de llaves, venta de productos lácteos y venta de productos médicos naturales, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades.   Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes en su tienda de barrio; que es uno de los escenarios típicos de los barrios, encontramos desde productos de la canasta básica familiar hasta otros artículos como periódicos, revistas, libros e incluso combinados con papelerías. Su tienda es un estilo de antaño, “mi negocio abastece a gran parte de la población del lugar, por eso debo surtirla y abastecerla constantemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias y clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer y surtir el negocio. Su sueño es abrir un micro Marquet, ella desea realiza la compra de abarrotes en general por mayor para abastecer y surtir su tienda y continuar en el negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Beatris solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer y surtir su tienda para convertirla en micro market.
texts.en:
BEATRIS is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children, five and eight years old. Her business is grocery sales. She is a good mother, determined, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her business in the southern part of the city, along the shore of the crystal-clear water. It is a typical place for a weekend stroll, with rustic buildings made of locally-sourced materials where one can enjoy typical traditional food and partake in several sporting activities. The climate is subtropical, warm and humid with approximate temperatures between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius throughout the day.

BEATRIS has olive skin, brown eyes and long chestnut-brown hair that she usually wears tied in a ponytail. She is short-statured with a thin build and her first language is Guaraní, which is spoken in the area. She also speaks Spanish for general use and running her business. She is pictured standing in the middle, in a yellow T-shirt. She shares her life with her partner, who works as a truck attendant, and with her children, who are in school. They live in a house owned by the family, made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof. There they have drinking water, electricity and plumbing.

Beatris’s desire for self-improvement led her to form a bank with people of various businesses, such as food sales, laundry services, an electrician’s workshop, artisanal crafts, a key-making workshop, dairy product sales, and natural medicine sales. They are requesting a loan to improve their businesses. Beatris’s business is selling groceries in her neighbourhood store, one of the typical scenes in barrios. Her products range from basic groceries to other items like newspapers, magazines, books and even packs of stationery. Her store has an old-fashioned style. She comments, “my business supplies a large portion of the area’s population, so I have to re-stock and supply it constantly.”

The advantage of Beatris’s business is that it makes daily sales and has loyal customers; its disadvantage is a lack of capital to stock and supply the store. Her dream is to open a micro-market. She wishes to purchase general grocery products wholesale to stock and supply her store and continue with the business. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been developing this business. For these reasons, Beatris is requesting a loan for the purchase of grocery products to stock and supply her store, to convert it into a micro-market.

loans.use: buy grocery products to stock and supply her store, to convert it into a micro-market.

loans.name: Yerson Leandro

texts.es:
Yerson es un joven hombre de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de adornos para fiestas infantiles.
Él es buen padre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, área caracterizada por recibir a la población migrante del campo, que genera una intensa actividad económica formada por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Yerson es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que se dedica a l mismo negocio y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de artículos de cotillón como; tarjetas exclusivas para eventos sociales, invitaciones elaboradas a mano, piñatas, dispensadores de dulces, centros de mesa, cotillones, figuras decorativas, cajas de regalo y otros, “el cotillón es el accesorio ideal para toda fiesta temática ya que le aporta originalidad y detalles a las mismas, por eso nosotros elegimos y diseñamos todas las ideas para los eventos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el servicio funciona constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para ampliar y mejorar el negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su tienda, él desea realizar la compra de un mueble mostrador y una máquina compresora para pintar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yerson solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles y máquinas para su negocio de cotillón, para mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
Yerson is a young man, aged 22. He lives with his partner, he has a two-year-old child, and his business is making decorations for children's parties.
He is a good father: entrepreneurial, independent, consistent, optimistic, responsibly and very hard working. His business is located in the southern area of the city, which is populated largely by rural migrants. They generate a lot of economic activity in the informal sector. The climate is warm and sub-tropical, with temperatures during the day averaging between 21 and 35 degrees celsius.
Yerson has a dark complexion, brown eyes and short black hair. His figure is short and slim and his mother tongue is Guarani, which he speaks with his family. He also speaks Spanish for everyday use and to conduct business.
He enjoys life in the company of his partner, who works in the same business, and his son, who is not yet of school age. They live in a rented apartment made out of bricks and cement with a calamine roof and a ceramic floor. The house has running water, electricity and a sewage system.
His business is the production of party supplies, such as exclusive cards for social events, handmade invitations, piñatas, candy dispensers, table decorations, party favors, decorative figures, gift boxes and other things.
"Party supplies and decorations are ideal for any themed party since they provide originality and detail. That is why we select and design all the ideas for the events." he says. The advantage of his business is that is runs continuously. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to grow and improve the business. His dream is to enlarge his shop. He wishes to buy a counter and an airbrush compressor to paint with. This is his first loan with this organization in the two years that he has been running his business. This is why Yerson is requesting a loan to buy furniture and machines for his party supplies business, in order to improve the services he provides.

loans.use: to buy furniture and machines for his party supplies business, in order to improve the services he provides.

loans.name: Sufyan's Group

texts.en:
Sufyan is 24 years old, he is standing in the middle and raising his hand in the photo. He is the leader of a group of three. He attended primary school and he wanted to go to high school, but his economic condition and his family held him back. He is a married with 8 family members. 

He makes a living working as a farmer. He works day and night in his land to meet day to day family expenses.

He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies to grow rice crop in his land and to pay labors for plowing land. He also plans to buy 2 sacks of quality seeds, 16 sacks of fine fertilizer and pesticides. 

He wants to improve the mud walls of his parents' house, where he currently lives in. He also wants to send his children to study and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Shalom Faith Group

texts.en:
Bertha of Shalom Faith is a 43-year old mother of six children. She and her husband are hard working parents. They want to send all of their children to University. Her group first took a loan in 2012. Bertha runs a detergents business. She produces dishwashing liquid, toilet cleaner, and tile cleaner. Her products go by a brand name called “Vital.” She sells her products at wholesale prices in her neighborhood and in the city. One of the challenges that she faces is securing a supplying opportunity in supermarkets.

Using profits from her second loan, Bertha was able to set up a catering business. So far, she has more than 500 plates and other equipment. With profits from her third loan, she bought her mother-in-law a high quality bed. Despite the difficult economic environment, Bertha has been able to build a two-roomed cottage. Her group is now on their fifth loan cycle. They hope that a $2400 loan from Kiva will help them to further grow their businesses and send their children to University.

loans.use: to expand her business making detergents, washing liquid, and tile cleaners.

loans.name: Cranbornian Group

texts.en:
Betty is the chairwoman of the Cranbornian Group. Betty, a former teacher, is in the cake making business. She has been baking cakes for the last ten years and started last year baking as a way of earning a living. Her business was experiencing some financial constraints until she heard about loans being availed to women in small businesses by Thrive Microfinance. Betty and three other ladies from her neighborhood who had a shared interest of uplifting their businesses came together to form the Cranbornian Group.

The women attended Thrive Microfinance and got business trainings and their first loan in 2014. With her first loan Betty grew her baking business and managed to bake the biggest cake of her career so far, a 24 tier wedding cake. This gave her profits that saw her being able to purchase a new car. Betty was recently lent her second loan by Thrive Microfinance. There is no going back for this industrious lady as she even wants to grow bigger and one day open a cake shop and give baking lessons.

loans.use: to expand her cake shop.

loans.name: Wilfredo Del Pilar

texts.es:
Llegar a trabajar en la institución pública más grande del país, es la meta que tiene Wilfredo, un joven de 24 años de edad que estudia Medicina y Cirugía desde hace cuatro años, con la meta de llegar a servir a su comunidad, que tanto mira que pasa por necesidades de salud. Actualmente está realizando sus prácticas, por lo que se siente emocionado de estar llevando a la práctica lo que ha aprendido en los años anteriores.
Wilfredo está casado con una hermosa joven que lo ha apoyado todo el tiempo, quien también ayuda en su negocio de venta de pijamas médicas. Por esta razón, se siente más que motivado por salir adelante, de manera que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y pagar los próximos aranceles de su universidad. Esto le permitirá avanzar en su plan de estudios y contar con el equipo necesario para sus prácticas y así terminar con honores su carrera.
texts.en:
Wildredo is a young, 24-year-old whose dream is to work in the largest public institution in the country.  He has been studying medicine and surgery for 4 years towards the goal of serving his community, because he sees how much need there is for health services.  Currently, he is undergoing his hospital training and he is excited to be able to put into practice what he has learned in the previous years.  

Wilfredo is married to a beautiful young women who has always supported him and who helps out with a business of selling medical scrubs.  He feels more than motivated to get ahead, so he is taking out a loan to buy a computer and pay the next round of tuition at the university.  This will allow him to go ahead with his study plan while counting on the necessary equipment for his training and therefore finish his degree with honors.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay for the next round of tuition.

loans.name: Tapiwa Group

texts.en:
Rachel, aged 38, is a member of the Tapiwa Group (Given by God). The group consist of five hardworking women who encourage each other to improve their businesses and their home situations. Since the formation of the group about a year and a half ago, the group members have shown their abilities in transforming their economic and social lives as they can now send their children to school, contribute to savings, and meet some of the household expenses, as well as putting food on the table for the family without waiting for the husband's income. 

Rachel is in the business of cooking and selling sadza (staple food in Zimbabwe), buying and selling refreshments and snacks. She started her business three years ago and from the good reception she received from the market she serves, she has managed to gain more customers and increase her revenue. Her wish in the medium to long term is to buy a delivery van to start delivering breakfast and lunch in companies around Harare Central Business District. With a $400 loan, Rachel can save more towards the purchase of her first delivery van. She and her group have made two loan cycles with Thrive in which they repaid successfully.

loans.use: to increase the range of her catering business.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en: This is Marte and Preng. Marte's 28-year-old son needs this loan to pay for Preng’s eye surgery; hospitals in Albania are private thus, they have to pay for the procedure. Marte is 54 and has another son in his early twenties. Marte is the only one who works in their family and she makes about $170/month; the oldest son and her husband receive disability income and the youngest one goes to school and despite that he has been wanting to work part time, there are no such opportunities for the youngsters in Albania especially in towns like theirs. Marte also plants veggies and has fruit orchards in the 2400 meters of land they have.

loans.use: to pay for her oldest son's eye surgery.

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
Dile and Gjin are dressed up for the occasion; the photograph. Kindly note that people in their rural area consider a photo as something special that they should dress up for in their very best attire. Dile wants this loan because her husband has been suffering from some affliction and he has been scheduled to go to the hospital soon.

While Gjin doesn’t work, Dile does work in a deli factory for a pay of $220/month. They are both in their late forties and are literally poor and your financial help will be appreciated very much from them, as per their saying. They have a 16-year-old child as well who goes to high school and who lives with them, whereas the oldest son who is 26 went to Germany recently to find work because he had none here and was married as well.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's hospitalization.

loans.name: Gull's Group

texts.en:
Gull is a 33 years old farmer, raising his hand in the photo. He is a resident of “Chadyala”, a village in Gujranwala, Pakistan. He is married and he lives in his own house with his wife and child. He grows rice and wheat in his farm. He has been working in agriculture for 15 years and it has allowed him to make a living. He sells his production in the market close by his house. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides to increase his income from farming.
He wants to use his profits to support his business. He also plans to take care of his family and to pay for better food for his family.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Mehboob's Group

texts.en:
Mehboob is a 49 years old farmer with 7 family members. He lives in “k.N Shah”, a native village in Pakistan. He has over 20 years of experience in farming. His parents passed it down to him. He is the group representative, raising his hand in the photo. He is a poor farmer growing rice and wheat in his field. He meets his family's needs by selling his production.
He is requesting a loan to buy 6 sacks of quality seeds, 18 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for his rice crop. He wants to use his profits to support his business. He also plans to take care of his family and to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and has six children. She resides in Nandi Hills, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 20 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Jane enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Jane has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Jane will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Suratmo

texts.ru: Эту жизнерадостную женщину зовут Суратмо. Суратмо вежливый, трудолюбивый и скромный человек. Ей 44 года. Суратмо одна вырастила четырех детей. Ей было нелегко, когда она потеряла мужа, но ради своих детей она трудилась дни напролет. Теперь её старший сын студент, другой продает мороженное на рынке, а две младшие дочки учатся в средней школе. Её дети всегда помогают своей маме, так как они знают, с каким трудом она их вырастила. У Суратмо не было Высшего образования, но она зарабатывала шитьем. Вот уже несколько лет как они не могут купить себе холодильник, но летом без холодильника невозможно. В этом году Суратмо решила получить кредит и купит холодильник в дом. Она действительно нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: This cheerful woman is called Suratmo. Suratmo is a polite, hard-working and modest person. She is 44 years old. Suratmo has raised four children on her own. It was difficult for her when she lost her husband, but she worked all day long for the sake of her children. Now her eldest son is a student, another sells ice-cream at the market, and her two youngest daughters are studying in secondary school. Her children always help their mother since they know with what difficulty she has raised them. Suratmo does not have a higher education, but earns a living by sewing. They have not been able to buy a refrigerator for a few years but in summer it is not possible to get by without one. This year Suratmo has decided to take a loan and to buy a refrigerator for her house. She really needs your support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Linda Elizabeth

texts.es:
La sonrisa amable con la que atiende Linda, la hace más que la ideal para su carrera universitaria de Auxiliar de salud familiar y comunitaria, puesto que trae un don de nacimiento para atender a las personas desde la salud medica con gran armonía, respeto y comprensión. A sus 24 años de edad, además de estudiar ayuda a su papá quien es enfermero, para aprender más de este mundo tan solidario.  
Linda también cuenta con el apoyo de su madre quien es docente y ni se diga que cuenta con el apoyo de su universidad, más su propio esfuerzo, teniendo una beca por excelencia académica. Por esta razón, siente que debe invertir más en ella, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora y herramientas médicas para realizar sus trabajos de enfermería y llevarlos a la práctica. En un futuro piensa terminar esta carrera para entrar de lleno a estudiar una licenciatura en Enfermería.
texts.en:
The friendly smile that goes along with 24-year-old Linda's service makes her all the more suited for a university degree in family and community health.  She has a natural gift for providing medical services with great harmony, respect, and understanding.  In addition to studying, she helps out her sick father, in order to understand more about this caring world.  

Linda also counts on the support of her mother, who is a teacher.  In addition to her own strength, it goes without saying that she has the support of her university, and she has a scholarship for academic excellence.   For this reason, she feels that she should invest more in her education, so she is applying for a loan to buy a computer and medical tools to carry out her work as a nurse.  In the future, she wants to finish her degree and then go directly into studying for her nursing license.

loans.use: to buy a computer and medical tools.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
Gjyste is almost 60 and has a two kids - a married daughter and Ervin, the youngest at 29 years old, who works only on weekends as a football trainer for youth for a pay of $290/month, with the rest of the week free to work. He is shown in the photo with his mother.

"I want to start a family soon, and the money I make is not enough and I don't want to rely on my family for financial help because they are in such a situation that they need help themselves. Thus, I thought that doing taxi service at the same time would bring me about $500/month," said Ervin to the loan officer.

They live in a little town in the central part of the country with approximately 10,000 residents, meaning there are no rural activities that people can pursue. The family of Gjyste relies financially on her husband's pension of $188/month, and another income of $200/month.

loans.use: to invest in a taxi vehicle for her son.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en:
Ndue wants to dig a water well that is 35 meters deep. He says, “We don’t have enough water for the plantations, so I know that having a well will give us enough water for the plants." 

He is married and has four children ranging in age between 17 and 27 years old, and they all live in the rural north. For the past seven years his focus has been on agriculture/livestock; a good part of the land they own is planted with grapevines, and the rest is just with grass for the animals (a dairy cow, a baby calf, and some chickens) to graze. In addition to this, he works for a pay of $300/month and his oldest son earns $250/month. They also sell one calf per year and 400 kg of Grappa alcohol drink per year as well.

loans.use: to dig a well for watering the plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: pay for soil treatment prior to planting and buy seeds to sow new plots.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married mother of three children. She keeps cattle, poultry, and goats for milk, eggs, and meat respectively. On her four-acre piece of land, you will also find a granary, cereals, and over 100 trees.

To make better income, Pamela engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the ten years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Since she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, Pamela prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to build her inventory by aggregating more produce from local farmers at competitive prices. She will use her understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell later at a profit.

Your loan will help local farmers selling to Pamela to focus on production, rather than sales. Pamela’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Belle Vue Group

texts.fr: La cliente Munyemana est une commerçante, membre d’une banque communautaire «Belle vue», âgée de 35 ans, mariée à un agent de l’Administration publique, mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers matériaux de construction dans une quincaillerie dans le bidonville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 55 sacs de ciments. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Munyemana is a shopkeeper and member of a banque communautaire called Belle Vue.  She is 35 years old and married to a public administration employee.  She is the mother of 5 school children and sells various construction materials in the shantytown's hardware store.  

She is asking for a loan from Hekima to improve her business.  She is going to buy 55 bags of cement.  Therefore, she is hoping to receive some money to build a house and so she can put her children through school and feed them.  

She is grateful to Hekima for the support they provide female entrepreneurs who are excepted from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy 55 bags of cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings.

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es:
Desde pequeño, William descubrió que Nicaragua necesita mucha actividad médica, por lo que no dudo ni un segundo de decir que él quería convertirse en médico cuando sea grande. Ahora que tiene 18 años de edad, ya está en segundo año de medicina y cirugía, además de ya estar trabajando como operario por más de un año, sintiéndose más que realizado cumpliendo con su profesión que le permitirá contribuir a la buena salud de la población. 
A pesar de que su madre es administradora de empresa, él siempre se miró en el área de medicina y ahora posee el apoyo de todos por sus grandes metas. Por esta razón, su familia decide apoyarlo todo el tiempo y más ahora que solicita un préstamo para pagar un curso de inglés y comprar un equipo médico para desempeñarse mejor en el área educativa y especialmente laboral, pues aprender inglés le dará una ventaja ser el que guíe a los extranjeros cuando llegan al hospital. En sus planes está terminar su carrera para entrar de lleno ayudando a los demás.
texts.en:
From a young age, William found out that Nicaragua needs a great deal of medical services, so he did not hesitate for a second in saying that he wanted to become a doctor when he grew up. Now he is 18 and already in the second year of medicine and surgery, in addition to working as a health worker for more than a year, feeling more than in fulfilled in the meeting the requirements of his profession, which will allow him to contribute to the good health of the population.

Despite the fact that his mother works a company administrator, he has always seen himself in the area of medicine, and now has everyone's support for his great goals.

For this reason, his family is determined to always help him, and more so now that he is applying for a loan to pay for an English course and to buy medical equipment for performing better in his studies, and especially in his work area. Learning English will give him an advantage, as the one to guide foreigners when they arrive at the hospital.

His plans are to complete his degree program, so that he can be fully engaged in helping others.

loans.use: To pay for an English course and buy medical equipment.

loans.name: Muhammad's Group

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 48 years old and he lives in his own home with 6 family members. He grows rice and wheat in his land. He is raising his hand in the photo. He has been farming for 25 years, and he sells his crops in several markets around his home. He uses the income to cover some of the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy insecticides, herbicides and fertilizer and pay the labors plowing the land for his rice crop. As a result, he can have a good harvest and increase his income to have a better quality of life. His goal is to rebuild a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase agriculture inputs such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Florinte

texts.en:
Florinte, a 62-year-old villager and single lady who lives in the northern part of the country, has been photographed at the beehives. She is a hard-worker and a very compassionate lady, as described by others, and is very active in the community among the elders. She wants to buy calves to raise and then sell, and your financial help will make it possible for her.

So far, Florinte has been living with other members of the family and siblings who are married with kids. She been doing agriculture and livestock with them. They have citrus orchards, grapevines, and plant fodder for animals, as well as 12 beehives. Each year the family sells fodder, 100 kg of honey, 40 kg of homemade Grappa alcohol called ‘Raki,' and cattle. In addition to these, Florinte stitches sacks and sells them.

loans.use: to buy young calves to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Muchos son amantes de los números, otros de los planos arquitectónicos, otros del baile, pero Juan es amante del deporte, una actividad que no solo te hace verte mejor, sino que sentirte mejor. A sus 33 años de edad, estudia todas las tardes el quinto año de la carrera de Educación física, pues su meta es alentar a los jóvenes a preferir el deporte que el mal que pueden afectar sus vidas.
Afortunadamente este atleta cuenta con el apoyo de su madre que es enfermera, quien le encaminó por el camino del bien. Por esta razón, ahora que ya está a punto de terminar, solicita un crédito para cubrir los gastos de su tesis y así poder conseguir el título para optar por un empleo en su área preparada y así llegar a muchos jóvenes. Juan siente que ese propósito lo tiene más que calado en su mente, por lo que no se arrepiente ni un segundo por estar casi terminando la carrera y no espera que pronto pueda llegar a trabajar en un colegio o en una universidad.
texts.en:
Many are lovers of numbers, others of architectural plans, others of dance, but Juan is a lover of sports, an activity that not only makes him look better, but makes him feel better.  At 33 years of age, he studies every evening for his fifth year in the physical education degree.  His goal is to encourage young people to prefer the sport instead of the bad things that can affect their lives.

Fortunately, this athlete has the support of his mother, who is a nurse.  She directed him down the path of good.  For this reason, now that he is at the point of finishing, he is requesting a loan to cover the costs of his thesis so as to be able to obtain the degree to choose a job in his prepared field.  In this way he can reach many young people.  Juan feels that this purpose has left a mark on his mind, and so he does not regret for one second for being almost finished with his degree and soon expected to get to work at a high school or university.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his thesis.
